title: First Customer Integration Manager
description:

title: Senior Product Manager, Interoperability
description:
Abacus Insights is a mission-driven technology company focused on transforming the healthcare data industry, ultimately creating a more personalized patient experience, improving health outcomes, and lowering the overall cost of healthcare. Abacus Insights provides a flexible, efficient, and secure platform that organizes and exchanges healthcare data from various sources and formats, allowing our customers to uncover differentiated insights. In addition, our employees know that they play an active role in keeping our customers' data safe and are responsible for ensuring that our comprehensive policies and practices are met.Â 

With our deep expertise in cloud-enabled technologies and knowledge of the healthcare industry, we have built an innovative data integration and management platform that allows healthcare payers access to data that has been historically siloed and inaccessible. Through our platform, these healthcare organizations can ingest and manage all the data they need to transform their business by supporting their analytical, operational, and financial needs. Â Â 

Since our founding in 2017, Abacus has built a highly successful SaaS business, raising more than $81 Million from leading VC firms with deep expertise in the healthcare and technology industries. We are solving problems of massive scale and complexity in a sector that is not only ready for disruption. We're growing quickly and would love for you to be a part of it!Â 

Â 

About the Role:â€¯Â 

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Product Manager to drive forward strategic Abacus product development that positions our solutions to meet critical needs of the healthcare payer market. The initial focus will be on developing the best-in-class CMS-9115 / CMS-0057 product suite and will expand to support other payer needs in the compliance and interop space. As a Product Manager, you will play pivotal role in shaping our product vision by identifying, developing and leading critical initiatives with significant ROI to our customers and Abacus while collaborating and providing support to Product Owners on the Platform Product team.Â 

The ideal candidate will possess extensive experience in healthcare interoperability and demonstrate in-depth understanding of the CMS 9115 and 0057 mandates and their implications for healthcare payers. We are seeking someone with experience integrating and developing products that are directly adjacent to interoperability needs, including Enterprise Master Patient Index (EMPI/MDM) and HL7/FHIR workflows. Â 

Finally, we are seeking someone with experience developing SaaS solutions with the working knowledge of latest technologies that underpin todayâ€™s cloud-based products, including Databricks, Snowflake, AWS, and Azure. This role requires a person who can successfully inform strategic direction, ensure timely execution, foster strong cross-functional collaboration, be the voice of the customer internally, and support sales and delivery with engaging with prospects and clients as a deep SME on interoperability. Â 

You will:

  • Drive product strategy, development and execution of Abacus CMS Interoperability Data Solutions and ensure their timely delivery and alignment with the market needs.Â 
  • Ensure smooth integration of upstream EMPI/MDM solutions in service of interoperability and other offerings.Â  Â 
  • Own the product roadmap for your domain and ensure its value delivery is optimized through ruthlessÂ quantified prioritization of features by balancing input from the market, customers, and internal stakeholders.
  • Ensure product backlog is â€œshovel-readyâ€ and presents Product Engineering with a clear problem statement and definition of done before their work can begin. Â 
  • Be the voice of the customer through regular client engagement, evaluating their needs against current product capabilities and potential future enhancements. Â 
  • Understand key Abacus technologies and partner with Product Engineering to effectively guide the enhancement of existing solutions and relentlessly evaluate emerging tech that enables Abacus to maintain its competitive edge and meet evolving customer needs.
  • Collaborate closely with product engineering, delivery, support, sales and marketing to inform holistic perspective on product roadmap and ensure successful product launches.
  • Conduct market research and analysis to identify trends, competitive landscape, and customer needs to inform product strategy and development.
  • Actively engage with clients and key stakeholders (internal and external) to gather feedback, understand pain points, and drive continuous product improvements and innovation.
  • Effectively connect with Executive Leadership to provide updates on product priorities, articulate the product strategy and direction, and solicit input to improve value delivery to clients and the market.
  • Partner with client enablement to ensure new products and features are supported by an effective documentation collateral (e.g., user guides, implementation guides, etc.) to ensure their smooth implementation and optimized utilization.
  • Collaborate with the product marketing team to create go-to-market strategies, product messaging, and marketing collateral to drive adoption and usage of the platform.
  • Provide mentorship and guidance to junior product team members, fostering a culture of learning and growth within the team.Â 

What We're Looking For:Â 

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field.Â 
  • Minimum of 8 years of product management experience in US healthcare interoperability, including hands-on experience with CMS mandates 9115 and 0057.
  • Experience with integrating or implementing healthcare-related EMPI/MDM workflows.
  • Proven track record of successfully launching and managing cloud-native products and services to support healthcare organizations.
  • Strong overall technical background with experience in Databricks, Kubernetes, AWS and/or Azure and related cloud infrastructure. Â 
  • Demonstrated ability to understand complex technical systems and experience working closely with engineering teams.
  • Previous experience working with international teams (preference for India and / or Nepal) and proven track record of successful delivery in this environment.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex ideas to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience with Agile and Scrum methodologies, and familiarity with product management tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence, Productboard).
  • Exceptionally strong client / prospect acumen with the ability to both communicate product features and roadmap and listen empathetically to understand their needs/problems and how Abacus can solve their problems.
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to provide leadership in cross-functional teams to ensure on-time / on-budget delivery of commitments.
  • A highly proactive get-it-done attitude and the skills to back it up. Â 
  • Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.Â 

Nice To Have:Â 

  • Significant experience working at a healthcare payer in an operational role or developing products to support healthcare payers.Â 
  • Depth of expertise in GenAI product development with experience bringing products based on GenAI to market. Â 

Â 

Equal Opportunity EmployerÂ 

As a mission-led technology company that is helping to drive better healthcare outcomes, Abacus Insights believes that the best innovation and value we can bring to our customers comes from diverse ideas, thoughts, experiences, and perspectives. We are dedicated to building diverse teams and providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants. Abacus prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type in regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.Â

title: People Operations Generalist
description:
About Carrot:

Carrot Fertility is the leading global fertility, family-building, and lifelong hormonal healthcare platform providing care for everyone, everywhere. Trusted by more than a thousand multinational employers, health plans, and health systems, Carrot's comprehensive clinical program delivers industry-leading cost savings for employers and award-winning experiences for millions of people worldwide. From maternity through menopause and pre-pregnancy through parenting, Carrot is dedicated to expanding access and improving outcomes. Carrot empowers members with compassionate, personalized, and inclusive support.

The Role:Â 

We're seeking a passionate People Operations Generalist to join our growing team and shape the future of our employee experience. This is more than just an HR role; it's a chance to build strong relationships, optimize systems, and develop meaningful processes.

You'll be a strategic partner across the organization, using your HR expertise to manage everything from compliance and benefits administration to data analysis. Are you a data whiz with a knack for problem-solving? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and love creating impactful processes? If you said YES (and maybe know your way around advanced Excel functions like VLOOKUP), we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

  • Own and manage our HRIS (ADP Workforce Now), ensuring data integrity, system optimization, and troubleshooting as needed
  • Develop and maintain custom reports, dashboards, and data analyses to support People metrics and company-wide reporting needs
  • Manipulate and analyze data in Excel (VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, formulas, etc.) for compensation, benefits, headcount, and compliance reporting
  • Partner with Finance, payroll and other stakeholders to ensure alignment between People data and business processes.
  • Support administration of employee benefits programs, including enrollments, life events, audits, and compliance reporting
  • Assist in compensation processes such as benchmarking, data analysis, and pay equity reviews
  • Support People-related projects, including process improvements, compliance audits, and implementation of new tools or systems
  • Maintain and enhance process documentation and SOPs to ensure scalable People Operations infrastructure
  • Ensure compliance with federal, state, and local employment regulations, and support audits as needed
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with Recruiting, IT, Finance and other departments to deliver a seamless employee experience

The Team:Â 

You will report to the Sr. Manager, People Operations and partner with the collective People team on the full spectrum of HR responsibilities, including but not limited to HRIS system management, compliance, benefits administration, payroll operations and data analysis.

Minimum Qualifications:Â 

  • 3â€“5+ years of experience in People Operations, HR, or a related field, with a strong technical focus
  • Experience supporting benefits administration, payroll operations, and compensation processes
  • Hands-on experience with ADP Workforce Now (preferred) or similar HRIS platforms
  • Advanced Excel skills (VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, nested formulas, data validation, etc.)
  • Proven ability to analyze complex data and translate insights into action
  • Strong project management skills; PMP certification is a plus
  • Excellent attention to detail, organizational skills, and a process-oriented mindset
  • Clear communicator with the ability to influence and build trust across stakeholders
  • Passion for building scalable, compliant, and employee-friendly People processes

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with other systems like Tilt or Pave
  • Experience working in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment
  • Knowledge of employment law and compliance best practices across multiple states

Â 

Compensation:Â 

Carrot offers a holistic Total Rewards package designed to support our employees in all aspects of their life inside and outside of work, including health and wellness benefits, retirement savings plans, short- and long-term incentives, parental leave, family-forming assistance, and a competitive compensation package. The starting base salary for this position will range from $96,000.00 - $105,000.00. Actual compensation may vary from posted base salary depending on your confirmed job-related skills and experience.Â 

Â 

Fraud and Security Notice:
Please note that all communication regarding job opportunities at Carrot will come exclusively from an @get-carrot.com email address. If you receive messages from any other domain, please disregard them and report the incident to: securityreporting@get-carrot.com

Why Carrot?

Carrot has received national and international recognition for its pioneering work, including Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies and World Changing Ideas, Inc. Power Partners, and Modern Healthcareâ€™s Innovators. Carrotâ€™s global workforce has been acknowledged with several accolades, including Fortuneâ€™s Best Workplaces in Healthcare, Great Place to Work, and Age-Friendly Employer certifications. Carrot is regularly featured in media reporting on issues related to the future of work, women in leadership, and healthcare innovation, including MSNBC, The Economist, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, CNBC, National Public Radio, Harvard Business Review, and more. Learn more at carrotfertility.com.Â

title: Principal DevOps Engineer
description:
Principal DevOps Engineer
ABOUT THE JOB

Company Intro: TurbineOne is a fast-moving and high-performance startup with a mission to strengthen situational awareness for all Americans serving at our nationâ€™s frontlines â€” and we are backed by the best DefenseTech venture capitalists. Our Frontline Perception System is an edge-first software platform that allows anyone, even with no technical knowledge, to build and use machine learning models within a comms-contested tactical environment.

We're seeking a versatile and experienced DevOps Engineer to take ownership of our build systems, pipelines, and development tooling. Our engineering team spans multiple languages (Go, Python, Js), platforms (Linux, Windows, multi-arch), and repositories â€” and we need someone ready to bring order and efficiency to our growing and complex environment. This is a high-impact opportunity to define and implement scalable, secure build systems that support field deployments and compliance pipelines for mission-critical software. If you're excited by open-ended challenges and want to shape the foundation of a growing DefenseTech product, we want to hear from you.

Job Title: Principal DevOps Engineer

Location: Remote, with availability for periodic in-person meetings or team gatherings

Reports To: Engineering Operations Manager

Â 

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Design, build, and maintain our build and deployment systems across a multi-repo, multi-language codebase.
  • Add efficiency, robustness and security to our release processes by standing up automated tools or processes as necessary.
  • Integrate security and compliance workflows, including tools like Grype and SBOM generation for ATO/IATT processes.
  • Support container and artifact packaging, release automation, and reproducible builds across OS and CPU architectures. This includes version control and tagging schemas to work with different build types (nightly, dev, release) and developer workflows.
  • Collaborate with software, ML and field engineers to ensure fast, reliable, and developer-friendly tooling.
  • Maintain our Makefile and Docker Bake build system while seeking out and identifying opportunities for improvement.
  • Document tooling, pipelines, and processes clearly and maintainably.
  • Build and test automation for both cloud-based development workflows and air-gapped production deployment workflows.
ON A TYPICAL DAY, YOU WOULD
  • Review and optimize a build for one of our Go-based services, Python models, or Vue UIs.
  • Patch up a Makefile dependency chain thatâ€™s gotten out of sync and refactor for readability.
  • Investigate a cross-compilation issue affecting an ARM/Linux target and diagnose the cause.
  • Implement SBOM generation and wire it into GitHub Enterprise CI workflows.
  • Debug a flaky build pipeline or blocked deployment job.
  • Jump on a Slack thread to help a teammate understand how to use our build tooling more effectively.
  • Propose and prototype a path toward more unified and modular builds.
  • Triage and coordinate the fix for an automated test failure.
DESIRED EXPERIENCE AND ATTRIBUTES
  • High standard of ethics, grit, integrity, and moral character.
  • 10+ years of experience in build engineering, CI/CD, or DevOps roles.
  • Experience managing complex builds across multiple languages and platforms.
  • Deep understanding of Linux-based development environments (x86/ARM experience a plus).
  • Hands-on experience with GitHub Enterprise, GitHub Actions, Docker, and vulnerability assessment.
  • Intimately familiar with git operations and workflows.
  • Implementation experience with automated testing and validations through CI/CD.
  • Familiarity with compliance-focused build environments, including SBOM, CVE tracking and reporting.
  • Strong debugging skills and the willingness to dive into Makefiles, shell scripts, or container issues.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills â€” you can clearly explain what you built and why.
  • Desire to work at a fast-paced, small startup and own major infrastructure initiatives.
  • A college degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field is preferred.
STARTUP CULTURE EXPECTATIONS
  • Weâ€™re a small, fully remote team, and everything is our responsibility.
  • Our team thrives on autonomy, trust, and solid communication.
  • Everyone on the Team needs to be very comfortable with constant change, moving fast, sharing failures, embracing grit, and building things themselves.
ELIGIBILITY
  • Must be eligible to obtain a clearance with the U.S. government.

title: Technical Support Representative
description:
Trust is the foundation of our products, values, and culture. More than a mission to eliminate security questionnaires, weâ€™re driven by a singular purpose and passion â€” to create a world built on customer trust. We are excited to build the Technical Support team and hire our first technical support representative! In this role, you will work on and troubleshoot technical issues, configure settings and integrations, and guide a wide range of customers to utilize the SafeBase platform successfully. As the first Technical Support representative to join SafeBase, you will work with and learn from a close-knit team of Solutions Engineers who have made it their mission to provide the highest quality, customer-focused support possible. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment with a team of A players to learn and grow, SafeBase is the place for you.Â 

While this position will initially work solely with the SafeBase team, it will eventually become part of the larger Drata organization.

What youâ€™ll do:Â 

  • Become a technical product knowledge expert on the SafeBase platform, products, and services with guidance from our Senior team members.
  • Serve as the first line of defense when customers ask questions about how the product works and when they encounter challenges. This will include improving our AI chat responses, solving issues outright, investigating and escalating complex issues quickly, and submitting feature requests with contextual information.

Named one of Timeâ€™s â€œWorldâ€™s Best Brands of 2024,â€ Acorns has helped over 14 million people save & invest over $25 billion dollars, much of it from spare change and small amounts.Â

title: QA Engineer
description:
About Battle Creek Games

We're the studio behind Offroad Outlaws, No Limit Drag Racing 2, and American Marksman, delivering fast-paced mobile games to millions of players. Our environment is data-informed, collaborative, and laser-focused on delighting our community. If you're passionate about quality, thrive in a live-ops setting, and enjoy building technical solutions to streamline testing, come join us!

Role Overview

As a QA Engineer for No Limit Drag Racing 2, you'll be pivotal in ensuring top-notch quality and performance for one of our most popular racing titles. Beyond traditional testing, you'll develop and maintain automated testing systems, collaborate with engineers to integrate QA processes into the development pipeline, and help us deliver rock-solid game updates to our player community. This role is ideal for someone who excels at both hands-on testing and technical automation in a fast-paced, live-ops environment.

Key Responsibilities
  • Test Automation & Tooling
  • Develop, maintain, and refine automated test suites that validate gameplay features, UI flows, and back-end systems. Work closely with engineering to ensure seamless integration into build pipelines.
  • Manual & Exploratory Testing
  • Execute hands-on playtests to detect gameplay, UI, and performance issues. Explore edge cases to identify and document hidden bugs before they impact the player experience.
  • Performance & Compatibility
  • Collaborate with developers to profile and optimize the game across various devices and platforms. Validate frame rate, memory usage, and device compatibility.
  • Bug Tracking & Reporting
  • Clearly document and prioritize defects in our bug-tracking system. Communicate findings and potential solutions to developers, designers, and stakeholders.
  • Release Management
  • Participate in release planning, smoke tests, and regression testing to ensure stable launches and quick turnaround on hotfixes.
  • Continuous Improvement
  • Analyze QA processes and recommend improvements. Contribute to the creation of best practices, testing standards, and knowledge-sharing sessions within the studio.
  • Collaboration
  • Work closely with Unity engineers, designers, and product managers to align testing strategies with game updates and new features. Provide actionable feedback on design feasibility and testability.
Qualifications
  • 2+ years of experience in game QA or software QA, ideally with at least one live-operated mobile or console title.
  • Proven experience in test automation (e.g., writing scripts or using frameworks such as Selenium, Appium, or Unity test frameworks).
  • Familiarity with Unity-based workflows and the ability to identify issues at the project, scene, or prefab level.
  • Strong understanding of bug life cycle, including root cause analysis, documentation, and prioritization.
  • Excellent communication skillsâ€”able to distill technical defects into clear, actionable items for cross-functional teams.
  • Bonus: Experience with racing or vehicle-based games, performance profiling tools, or network testing for multiplayer scenarios.
Why Join Battle Creek Games?
  • High-Impact Role: Ensure a top-quality experience for millions of racers worldwide.
  • Technical Growth: Hone your automation skills and collaborate with a cutting-edge development team.
  • Collaborative Culture: Work in a supportive environment that values rapid iteration and shared successes.
  • Competitive Compensation: Benefit from comprehensive health coverage, paid time off, and flexible work arrangements.
Ready to Drive Quality Forward?

If you're eager to build robust test automation and champion high-quality releases for a beloved racing title, we want to hear from you. Send us your resume and a brief overview of your QA experience. Join us in ensuring No Limit Drag Racing 2 stays at the pole position of mobile racing games!

  • Monitor the performance of Cultivoâ€™s portfolio of projects, including tracking project costs, funding requirements, and financial covenants throughout the projectsâ€™ lifecycles.

About Cultivo:Â Cultivo is a nature-tech public benefit corporation with a mission to accelerate investment to regenerate 1% of the worldâ€™s land into healthy ecosystems. Cultivo has a diverse, international start-up culture, with employee hubs in New York, San Francisco, London, and Mexico City.Â Visit www.cultivo.land for more information.

Requirements

About the company

Cultivo is a climate-focused fintech company whose mission is to accelerate investment into nature at scale. Cultivo provides institutional-grade products to financial institutions and corporations wanting to invest in natural capital, and partners with NGOs, landowners, project developers and experts to do so. description:
Dear Future Email Marketing Strategist,

Weâ€™re looking for a true strategist â€” someone with a strong history of direct response copywriting who can consistently turn a cold or lukewarm list into a reliable stream of booked calls without burning out the audience in the process.

This role is a top priority at 6 Figure Creative. Why? Because weâ€™re sitting on a 50,000+ person email list thatâ€™s been drastically underutilized. Every week we donâ€™t tap into it the right way, weâ€™re leaving booked calls (and revenue) on the table.

Clients By Design, our flagship coaching program, exists to help creative freelancers solve the biggest bottleneck in their business: getting clients. Everything we build is centered around solving that problem â€” for good.

We joke that our mission is to plunge humanity into chaos by helping all eight billion people become 6 Figure Creatives. The real mission? Helping one freelancer at a time, through real relationships, impactful strategy, and the right message at the right time.

If the idea of owning and optimizing our entire email channel â€” writing with a sharp, human voice, communicating with some of the most talented freelancers in the world (Grammy-winning music producers, high-end designers, etc.), and building campaigns that drive measurable results â€” gets you excited, keep reading.

â€

What You'll Do

As our Email Marketing Strategist, your role is to create, write, and manage a weekly flow of emails that nurture, educate, and book strategy calls â€” all while making sure our list looks forward to hearing from us.

Youâ€™ll manage our email content calendar, plan campaigns around launches and events, write value-packed emails that still drive action, and send weekly reports on whatâ€™s working, whatâ€™s not, and what youâ€™re testing next.

Youâ€™ll own our entire email strategy. That means everything from regular value emails to booked call pushes, live event sequences, re-engagement flows, and segmentation-based testing. If it touches email, itâ€™s in your domain.

Youâ€™ll also work closely with our founder (Brian Hood) to create and deploy better campaigns and resources that support our entire list and sales pipeline.

Your 3 Main Responsibilities:
  1. Strategy & Execution: You own and execute a strategic, data-driven email marketing calendar that warms leads, books calls, and sustains trust long term.
  2. Campaigns & Testing: You proactively test, learn, and iterate on the content and format of our emails to steadily improve conversion and performance.
  3. List Health & Reporting: You monitor and maintain the overall health and performance of our list and report findings clearly each week (qualified booked calls per 10k sends, CTR, Unsubscribes, deliverability, etc).

The emails you write will do more than fill up our sales teamâ€™s calendars â€” they'll spark real change for the freelancers on our email list. Your words will help someone finally land that dream client, raise their rates with confidence, or quit the soul-sucking day job thatâ€™s been holding them back.

Every campaign you write is a chance to move someone forward, not just through strategy, but through belief. Thatâ€™s the real work here â€” and why it matters.

â€

Youâ€™ll be accountable for these KPIs:
  • Qualified* Booked Calls per 10,000 Emails Sent = 1â€“2
  • Monthly Booked Calls from Email** = 50â€“75 baseline, 100+ stretch goal
  • Open Rate = 35â€“45%
  • Clickthrough Rate (CTR) = 2â€“4%
  • Booking Conversion from Clicks = 5%+
  • Unsubscribe Rate = <4% per month (total list churn)
  • Spam Complaints = < 0.01% per email (we currently average 1 to 3 total complaints per email sent)
  • Weekly Email Reporting: Submitted each Monday.

*Qualified = The sales rep has reviewed the call application and accepted it. All unqualified leads are rejected and calls are cancelled.

**A note on call volume expectations: Weâ€™ve done 3 email list promos in the past year that each booked 150â€“200 calls. Those were short-term pushes, but they show whatâ€™s possible with an engaged list. The 50â€“75/month benchmark reflects a realistic, sustainable goal for long-term nurture â€” not just a spike during a promo.

â€

What Success Looks Like

Your #1 Outcome Over the Next Six Months: Youâ€™ve turned our email list into a predictable, high-converting channel that books 50â€“75 qualified booked calls per month, drives real engagement, and becomes one of the most valuable assets in the entire business.

30-Day Targets

  • Email strategy developed and approved
  • Email content calendar built and approved
  • 4+ emails sent with strong tone and CTA alignment
  • Weekly reporting in place

60-Day Targets

  • Strategy has been adjusted based on month 1 results
  • 8â€“12 email send cadence running smoothly
  • Email channel has generated 50+ booked calls in first 60 days

90-Day Targets

  • Consistent 50â€“75 qualified booked calls/month from email
  • "Greatest Hits" library created
  • Open rates >40%, CTR >3%, Unsubscribe < 3.71% per month

180-Day Targets

  • Seasonal campaign calendar mapped ahead of schedule
  • You are leading segmentation and nurture strategy ideas
  • Email becomes a reliable source of 25â€“35% of total monthly booked calls

â€

Who Youâ€™ll Work With

Youâ€™ll report directly to the founder (Brian). Together, weâ€™ll refine how we engage with our audience, scale our nurture system, and turn email into one of the most productive sales channels in the company.

â€

What You'll Learn

Youâ€™re already good â€” this role will sharpen your edge even further. Youâ€™ll have the space to own the entire strategy, test ideas, and build email systems that donâ€™t just drive meaningless numbers, but move real people into action.

Not only will you be affecting the lives and businesses of the people on this list, but you'll also be impacting each and every client they work with as well.

What youâ€™ll gain from this role:

  • A deep understanding of how to communicate with and convert a niche audience of high-performing freelancers
  • Ownership of a revenue-driving channel you can proudly point to in any portfolio or case study
  • The opportunity to architect email systems that scale inside a fast-growing, mission-driven company

If youâ€™re absolutely sick ofâ€¦

  • Writing for companies that feel dead inside
  • Working with founders who ignore your ideas and micromanage execution
  • Pouring strategy and skill into brands that treat email like an afterthought
  • Being underutilized, unappreciated, and creatively boxed inâ€¦

â€¦then this is your chance to lead, experiment, and actually see your work matter. Youâ€™re gonna f*cking love this â¤ï¸

â€

Where You'll Work

Weâ€™re a 100% remote company with a small, tight-knit team of 10 people spread across the globe â€” from Vermont, New Jersey, Nashville, Oregon, Las Vegas, Pennsylvania, and California to Portugal, Romania, and even New Zealand. You can work from wherever you do your best work.

  • Coffee shop? Cool.
  • Your own home office? Even better.
  • Costa Rica for the summer? Send us pics pls.
  • We care more about outcomes than clock-ins.

â€

What 6 Figure Creative Does (and Why)

The reason 6 Figure Creative exists as a company is to help freelancers earn more money without selling their souls.

Our flagship coaching program, Clients By Design, solves the #1 problem holding freelancers back from success: they have no idea where their next client is coming from.

The program is built around creating highly-personalized marketing plans for our clients and coaching them through every single step of the process as they implement each playbook.

We believe that the education system is fundamentally broken. Universities will gladly charge their students $100k+ for a creative degree and never teach them the most important skills and strategies for how to actually get an ROI from their investment.

The coaching program youâ€™ll be promoting exists to help the best creatives in the world change the trajectory of their careers (and lives) by learning the skills universities failed to teach them.

It takes more than passion to succeed, and everything we do is built around giving our clients the strategies, tools, processes, guidance, coaching, and accountability they need to have successful businesses.

I look forward to working with you!

â€

â€“ Brian Hood

Founder

â€

P.S. Hereâ€™s job scorecard for this role.

P.P.S. The PERFECT person for this role would spot the numerous problems with this job description/role and push for changes that help both the company AND themselves. I will not pretend to be the expert here. You are.

â€

Compensation & Structure

Base Retainer

  • Retainer: $4,000+ per month to start (based on experience)
  • This retainer covers all core responsibilities: strategy, execution, reporting, and optimization of the email channel

Performance-Based Bonuses

  • $55 per qualified booked call generated via email campaigns (tracked via Go HighLevel or Hyros)
  • Example: 75 qualified calls = $3,000 bonus for the month

Annual Holiday Bonus

  • We give $$$ bonuses during the holidays, because we actually give a f*ck about you

Requirements

What Weâ€™re Looking For

Required (donâ€™t have these? Please donâ€™t apply.)

  • Proven experience writing email campaigns that drive direct response (booked calls, sales, applications â€” not just opens and clicks)
  • Ability to write in a casual, clear, and emotionally intelligent voice that can resonate with freelancers and creatives (you should get the vibe from this job listing)
  • Strong understanding of list segmentation, nurture sequences, and pacing CTAs for long-term list health
  • Extensive use of email platforms like Go High Level, ConvertKit, ActiveCampaign, or similar (we use GHL)
  • Comfortable interpreting basic performance data (open rate, CTR, booked calls per send, etc.)
  • Organized and self-managing â€” you can run your own calendar, meet deadlines, and report results without being chased
  • Able to think strategically, not just tactically (you bring ideas, not just drafts)

â€

Preferred (Nice to have stuff that sets you apart)

  • Familiarity with the freelance world (music producers, web designers, videographers, etc.)
  • Experience working with coaching, consulting, or service-based businesses
  • Experience with advanced segmentation and personalization (think Brennan Dunn)
  • Experience writing SMS or short-form ad copy is a big plus
  • Strong swipe file or past portfolio of high-performing campaigns
  • Located within 1â€“2 hours of Central Time (not required, but helpful for sync)


About the company

The reason 6 Figure Creative exists as a company is to help freelancers earn more money without selling their souls.

We believe that the education system is fundamentally broken. Universities will gladly charge their students $100k+ for a creative degree and never teach them the most important skills and strategies for how to actually get an ROI from their investment.

It takes more than talent and passion to succeed, and everything we do is built around giving our clients the strategies, tools, processes, guidance, coaching, and accountability they need to have successful businesses.

title: Senior AI Content Marketing Specialist

  • Ability to work with minimal UI and beta-stage tools in a fast-paced, test-and-learn environment.
  • Familiarity with prompt engineering or basic AI prompt tuning for more effective outputs.
  • Understanding of brand tone, messaging consistency, and industry-specific content constraints.
  • Excellent attention to detail, time management, and production efficiency.
  • Experience in telecom, Telecom, B2B marketing, or MarTech ecosystems is a plus.

title: Media Planner
description:
Company Description

EVERSANA INTOUCHâ„¢â€¯is a leading full-service, global healthcare agency serving the life sciences and pharmaceutical industries. We provide next-generation creative and media services, enterprise solutions and data analytics services for clients.â€¯â€¯Â 

We combine the power of world-class creative and digital teams with deep market access, payer, and healthcare communications expertise to provide innovative solutions to life science companies that want to connect with consumers, healthcare professionals, and payers.â€¯ â€¯Â 

We get fired up when people talk about gettingâ€”and stayingâ€”healthy. Thatâ€™s where we find our inspiration: in the very human experiences of patients, doctors, and even each other. Then, we collaborate on ways to make caring for oneâ€™s health more achievable, connecting patients and physicians with the information and tools they need.â€¯â€¯Â 

And as a part of EVERSANA, a pioneer in next-generation commercial services, we connect dots that other agencies canâ€™t, helping drive commercialization success.â€¯â€¯Â 

Across our growing organization, we embrace diversity in backgrounds and experiences. Improving patient lives around the world is a priority, and we need people from all backgrounds and swaths of life to help build the future of the healthcare and the life sciences industry. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive culture that embraces our cultural beliefs.Â  We are deliberate and self-reflective about the kind of team and culture we are building. We look for team members that are not only strong in their own aptitudes but also who care deeply about EVERSANA INTOUCH, our people, clients and most importantly, the patients we serve.Â  Â 



Job Description

WHAT DOES A MEDIA PLANNER DO?

The Media Planner will assist in the development, evaluation, and management of digital and non-digital media plans for pharmaceutical clients to meet their requirements, budgets, and objectives. He or she will develop and manage the RFP process and assist in the evaluation of proposals. This person will maintain a responsive working relationship with external media vendors and internal agency teams with some exposure to client presentations. The Media Planner maintains rapport with media publishers through daily interaction and works closely with the account, project management, media subject-matter-expert and analytics teams to ensure flawless execution of media schedules. The Media Planner must stay abreast of new and emerging technologies and execution opportunities by providing agency POVs on new opportunities as they relate to client objectives on an ongoing basis. He or she will manage the campaign creation, insertion orders, system updates and launch, as well as budgets and invoice process. The Media Planner will also analyze campaign performance and assist in regular pacing, as well as assist with regular campaign reporting.



Qualifications

WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in marketing, advertising, media studies, communications or equivalent education plus professional experience
  • 1-2 years of experience in media planning and buying
  • Online media background
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office, particularly PowerPoint and Excel
  • Experience with media tools such as Prisma, DCM, and/or DoubleVerify strongly preferred
  • Experience with syndicated research tools (e.g., Kantar, MRI) and competitive tracking tools is a plus
  • Detail-oriented
  • Strong presentation and cross-functional communication skills
  • Able to multitask and be a team player in a fast-paced environment


Additional Information

OUR CULTURAL BELIEFS:

Patient Minded I act with the patientâ€™s best interest in mind.Â 

Client Delight I own every client experience and its impact on results.Â 

Take Action I am empowered and empower others to act now.Â 

Grow Talent I own my development and invest in the development of others.â€¯Â 

Win Together I passionately connect with anyone, anywhere, anytime to achieve results.Â 

Communication Matters I speak up to create transparent, thoughtful and timely dialogue.Â 

Embrace Diversity I create an environment of awareness and respect.Â 

Always Innovateâ€¯I am bold and creative in everything I do.

EVERSANA is committed to providing competitive salaries and benefits for all employees.Â The anticipated base salary range for this position is $56,000.00 to $70,000.00 and is not applicable to locations outside of the U.S.Â  The base salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this position. Â Compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). Â More information about EVERSANAâ€™s benefits package can be found atÂ eversana.com/careers. EVERSANA reserves the right to modify this base salary range and benefits at any time.

Our team is aware of recent fraudulent job offers in the market, misrepresenting EVERSANA. Recruitment fraud is a sophisticated scam commonly perpetrated through online services using fake websites, unsolicited e-mails, or even text messages claiming to be a legitimate company. Some of these scams request personal information and even payment for training or job application fees. Please know EVERSANA would never require personal information nor payment of any kind during the employment process. We respect the personal rights of all candidates looking to explore careers at EVERSANA.

From EVERSANAâ€™s inception, Diversity, Equity & Inclusion have always been key to our success. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences, and backgrounds who share a passion for improving the lives of patients and leading innovation within the healthcare industry. Diversity not only includes race and gender identity, but also age, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, religion, and many other parts of oneâ€™s identity. All of our employeesâ€™ points of view are key to our success, and inclusion is everyone's responsibility.

Consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and applicable state and local laws, it is the policy of EVERSANA to provide reasonable accommodation when requested by a qualified applicant or candidate with a disability, unless such accommodation would cause an undue hardship for EVERSANA. The policy regarding requests for reasonable accommodations applies to all aspects of the hiring process. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the interview and hiring process, please contact us atÂ applicantsupport@eversana.com.

title: Conversational AI Designer
description:
Replicant was founded on the belief that machines are ready to have useful, complex conversations that will transform the way they interact with the world, starting with customer service.

As the leader in Contact Center Automation, Replicant helps companies automate their most common customer service calls while empowering agents to focus on more complex and nuanced customer challenges. Replicant's AI platform allows consumers to engage in natural conversations across voice, messaging and other digital channels to resolve their customer support issues, without the wait, 24/7. We are now leading the way in using Large Language Models (LLMs) to transform customer service- again.Â 

If you're excited by AI, ChatGPT, LLMs and want to make an impact with other great technologists and strong go-to-market leaders, then look no further. We've grown our team by 3x, increased revenue by 4x, and were named a top enterprise AI company by The Information. We currently serve Fortune 500 customers, run millions of AI calls per month in production, and are increasing our footprint globally.

As a Conversation Designer, youâ€™ll play a key role in delivering great conversations in Replicantâ€™s AI Agents (conversational AI engines). Each of our AI Agents serves thousands of people every day. Working closely with our customers and engineering teams, youâ€™ll drive conversation design, implementation, and quality to create an exceptional experience for every user. Youâ€™ll also contribute to the roadmap and development of new AI products in our AI Agent platform to ensure that we deliver great conversations at scale and continue to push the boundaries of conversational flexibility and accuracy.

What Youâ€™ll Do

  • Own conversation design for Replicantâ€™s AI Agents, ensuring every call interaction is seamless, intuitive, and engaging, achieving high-quality UX for all personasÂ 

  • Work directly with Replicant customers to discover their callersâ€™ and their own unmet needs, crafting solutions that will help transform their businesses

  • Use Replicant's platform to build the AI Agent that satisfies the defined requirements, making edits where required throughout the implementation lifecycle

  • Partner with Engineers and Engagement Managers to develop requirements, enable integration of systems, and ensure that every AI Agent exceeds customer expectations and delivers the highest possible resolutionÂ 

  • Develop intent taxonomies that blend customer requirements and caller needs, to increase our AI Agentsâ€™ Natural Language Understanding performance, in partnership with our Machine Learning teams

  • Use analytics & visualization tools to measure and improve conversational outcomes, owning the performance of the AI Agent through our Hypercare period

  • Work with your peers to improve Replicantâ€™s conversation design best practices through data-driven experimentation

  • Engage with Replicantâ€™s Product teams to evaluate and integrate new features into AI Agents, including reusable assets and tasks

What You'll Bring

  • Business process modelling: You have experience working with self-service automation technologies and API integrations (e.g., Zapier, UiPath) to comprehensively think through all permutations of variables and pathways required to automate a critical business process inside an enterprise setting

  • Artisan communicator: You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in a client-facing role, and youâ€™re interested in exploring the nuances and aesthetics of conversations and sweat every detail of a script

  • Passion for user experience: You have a great design sense and deep customer empathy, and you enjoy spending the time to craft just the right experience

  • Customer-centric: You put callersâ€™ experiences first and can empathize with their experience & needs

  • Startup mentality: Youâ€™re adaptable, comfortable with ambiguity, and arenâ€™t afraid to roll up your sleeves to engage deeply with our customers and data to get things done

  • Data obsessed: You love digging into the numbers and finding opportunitiesÂ  that others would have missed

  • Systematic thinking: Youâ€™re relentless about optimizing the product and processes to make things easier and better the next time around

  • Experience with Tableau, Looker, PowerBI - bonus if you know SQL or R/Python

  • 2-3 years of experience designing AI-based experiences

  • BS/MS degree in Interaction Design / HCI, Linguistics, Information Systems or another related field

Our Values

Replicant has three core values. It is critical that everyone who joins the team feels excited and moved by these values as every new team member makes an impact on our culture.

Blade Runners: We take ownership and pride to influence the outcomes of our goals. We are successful, and like a Blade Runner, use the tools at our disposal to reach our objectives. With this in mind, we act with objectivity and always remember that we are not our work. There's no perfect science to growing a team or business, but we trust everyone at Replicant to point out our blind spots and humbly admit their own.

title: Product Manager
description:
Are you a passionate and results-oriented Product Manager ready to make a significant impact?
ReSource Pro is seeking a Product ManagerÂ to join our team and be aÂ key driver of our product success, independently leading the development, strategy, and management of a high-impact product.

The Role...Â 
The Product Manager will lead the strategy, development, and management of a high-impact product. This role is an instrumental in understanding client and user needs, conducting market research, and driving business growth through innovative product solutions.Â 

All remote positions are based in the United States,
and candidates must reside within the U.S. to be eligible for consideration.

  • Drive market-led product evolution: Design, test, and launch iterations based on market needs.

  • Inform product strategy by analyzing user behavior and pain points.
What you need to be successful...
  • Minimum 10+ years of total work experience preferably within consulting, outsourcing, insurance or other related field

title: Senior Project and Resource Manager
description:
Overview

ntegrity is a full-service agency with 95% not-for-profit clients. Our mission is to â€œhelp good growâ€. Our clients look to us to give them direction on how to grow their results, grow their team's capabilities and in turn, grow their impact on the world. We're building a diverse and inclusive team, and we actively encourage applications from all backgrounds. We value your unique perspectives and experiences, and are committed to creating a culturally safe workplace where everyone can thrive. To learn more about ntegrity and the team click here!


We are excited to be looking for a new remote Project and ResourceÂ  Manager, based in the Philippines or Malaysia, to join our team. The primary objective of this role is to increase project profitability, velocity and team utilisation through upfront and effective project planning. We are hiring this role with a long term view,Â  beginning as a 12 month contract with the possibility of permanent employment.

What You Will Be Doing:

You will be the central orchestrator of the Leadership team, managing complex project lifecycles and navigating the intricate demands of diverse stakeholders, both internal and external. This role demands a sophisticated understanding of resource allocation, encompassing the dynamic management of incoming new business and the strategic planning of the leadership team's capacity with the rest of the agency. You will ensure seamless project delivery, maintaining meticulous data integrity within HubSpot and Kantata. Furthermore, you will spearhead the comprehensive onboarding of new business, ensuring the precise creation of legal documents, contracts, and critical project documentation, demanding a high degree of accuracy and strategic foresight.

  • Resource Management & Planning: You will drive resource optimisation for the squad, collaborating with stakeholders to understand project demands and implementing effective resource planning within the agency tool(Kantata). This includes managing schedules, and proactively communicating any resource changes to stakeholders. You will contribute to optimising resource planningÂ  by assessing agency capacity and provide the Leadership team with actionable insights on cost reduction, productivity gains and service delivery enhancement.Â 

  • Project Management: You will oversee project setup, including the creation of new projects as needed, manage deadlines, identify potential risks, and lead team meetings to ensure smooth delivery. You will also contribute to the broader agency by supporting Project Manager gaps, setting up new projects, gathering assets, setting kick-off and WIP meetings, and meticulously tracking project health.

  • Client Communication & Delivery: You will manage client communication throughout the project lifecycle, ensuring timely and on-budget deliverables, detailed meeting minutes, and effective meeting attendance. Additionally, you will support agency growth by nurturing new business leads and acting as a key support person for the wider agency.

  • Project Profitability: You'll set billing milestones and track project invoices, ensuring accurate and timely client communication. Additionally, you'll monitor task progress and manage workload to achieve both quality and financial goals.

  • Process Improvement: You'll contribute to agency improvements by collaborating with colleagues to standardise processes, develop project templates, and analyse data to optimise project velocity and revenue.

What We Need You To Have:

  • 8+Â  years of experience in a digital/creative agency.Â 

  • 5 +years of direct resource and project management experience; You are adept at booking and managing resources and prioritising multiple deadlines to deliver top-quality work efficiently via high quality project and resource planning, workflow management and budget planning.Â 

  • 1 year experience using Kantata.

  • Experience working with budgets, timelines, and workflow optimisation to ensure smooth operations.

  • You are comfortable in a fast-paced environment and possess the ability to balance desired output, project scope, and client deadlines.

  • You are experienced in building relationships with multiple C-suite stakeholders and can confidently present deliverables and timelines to clients.

  • You take initiative with proactive problem-solving skills and a keen eye for detail, ensuring high accuracy and consistency in your work.

  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills with high attention to detail.

  • Ability to work Melbourne timezone (AEDT/AEST) and attend client meetings virtually when required.

This Role Wonâ€™t be a Good Fit If:Â 

  • You don't work well under pressure; we have a lot going on - all the time!Â 

  • You like to work at a slower pace;Â  fast turnaround as well as high quality is important.

  • You are not flexible in your approach to processes; project managers need to be precise but they also need to be flexible; we understand its a difficult balance and are looking for others that understand this.Â 

  • You are looking for a short term opportunity only. We are seeking someone who is looking to grow professionally, rather than simply seeking a remote role to fit existing lifestyle needs (donâ€™t get us wrong, we love remote and flexible work, but we stillÂ  maintain high expectations for productivity and commitment and would love someone to grow with us in this role).Â 

Some Great Things About Working at ntegrity

Youâ€™ll help good grow.

Weâ€™re Australiaâ€™s leading for-purpose agency. Our clients include Beyond Blue, Vision Australia and The Salvation Army â€¦ to name a few! No hustling for shady brands. Just work you can be proud of, for brands that do good.Â  We are B Corp certified, a designation confirming we meet high standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency.Â 

Youâ€™ll get to eat challenges for breakfast.

Weâ€™re ambitious and analytical. We revel in hard work, and we obsess over impact. When you solve problems for our clients, you change lives.Â 

Youâ€™ll love your teammates.

Weâ€™re a little biased, but our team is pretty special. Weâ€™re honest, encouraging, and collaborative. We celebrate our work and each other.Â 

Youâ€™ll love your clients.

Our clients are nice! Theyâ€™re some of the most amazing people doing the most incredible work. We show each other mutual respect and build partnerships that stand the test of time.

Youâ€™ll have a stake in our growthâ€”and weâ€™ll have one in yours.Â 

We are growth-focused. The proof is in the numbers: 30% annual growth, 95% client retention. But we donâ€™t just care about our growth; weâ€™re invested in yours. Youâ€™ll co-create company strategy, and weâ€™ll put real time and $$ into a personalised development plan so you can grow with us.Â 

Youâ€™ll be part of a team that cares about the whole you.

We take mental health seriously. (Weâ€™ve been featured by Worksafe and beyond blue for it.) We work hard and go home â€“ late nights and weekends are not the norm. We offer flexible work arrangements. And we take time to invest in each other

title: Customer Support Specialist
description:
About HighnoteÂ 

Founded in 2020 by a team of leaders from Braintree, PayPal, and Lending Club, Highnote is an embedded finance company that sets the standard in modern card platform management. As an all-in-one card issuer processor and program management platform, we provide digital-first organizations with the flexibility to seamlessly issue and process payment cards, embed virtual and physical card payments, and integrate ledger and wallet functionalitiesâ€”empowering businesses to drive growth and profitability.

Weâ€™ve raised $145+ and have grown our team to 125+ employees. Headquartered in San Francisco, weâ€™ve managed to build one of the most advanced payments teams in the industry, with team members in 25+ US states.Â 

Operating through our core values of customer obsession, executional excellence, intentional inclusion, weâ€™re helping businesses grow for the future by creating the payment products demanded by tomorrow, with the ability to solve for use cases that donâ€™t exist yet.

We are fast-moving, hands-on, and strongly believe everyone deserves a seat at the table. We believe weâ€™re unlocking incredible opportunities that can change the future of payments, as long as we have the right people to make it happen.Â 

Job Description

We are looking for an organized and detail-oriented Customer Support Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for managing daily customer inquiries, coordinating issue resolution across departments, and maintaining accurate records of support activities. This role will work closely with the Head of Customer Support to implement process improvements, automate tasks, and keep the system aligned with business needs. The ideal candidate has strong technical expertise in Zendesk, problem-solving skills, and a proactive approach to system management and support.

What youâ€™ll be doing:
  • Manage and triage support tickets in Zendesk, ensuring timely resolution and escalation as needed
  • Manage Zendesk configuration, workflows, and integrations to meet business needs
  • Review and update internal documentation and knowledge base content to keep resources current and accurate

What we are looking for:
  • 5+ years of experience on a Customer Support team with a focus on payments, card issuance, or fintechÂ

  • Attention to detail to ensure content accuracy, consistency, and usability
  • Project management abilities to coordinate and track initiatives, including AI tool implementation
  • Technical aptitude and adaptability to support AI integration and leverage new tools

What it takes to be successful:Â 
  • Strong communication skills to develop and perform processes and reporting and to communicate issues, solutions and recommendations.
  • Positive, enthusiastic, highly organized with an excellent work ethic and a desire to be â€œhands-onâ€ while also creating a best in class function from the ground up.Â Â 
  • Ability to tackle problems and queues efficiently, while still maintaining a high-level of accuracy needed to service our customers.Â 
  • Maintain a strong and healthy sense of curiosity. You have a desire to understand the root-cause to any problem, evaluate explanations provided, and perform due diligence to validate your understanding. This spans across all aspects of your work.Â 
  • Ability to set/achieve goals and own deliverables with little supervision.
Why Highnote?
  • Weâ€™re a startup that allows for our employees to truly build from the ground up and impact every layer of our organization.Â 
  • Weâ€™re a team of payments obsessed individuals. While some of us come from the fintech world, some of us donâ€™t. We value the varied backgrounds and the diverse perspectives of our employees.Â 
  • Weâ€™re small on hierarchy and big on growth. Weâ€™re a flat organization that allows everyone to have direct exposure to our leadership team. We are looking for builders who thrive in ambiguity.Â 
  • Weâ€™re backed by Oak HC/FT, Costanoa Ventures, Adams Street Partners, Westcap, and Pinegrove Venture Partners. Angel Investors include Bill Ready (CEO at Pinterest) and Renaud Laplanche (Co-Founder & CEO of Upgrade).
Highnote benefits
  • Flexible Paid Time OffÂ 
  • 100% healthcare coverage + 75% coverage for dependents
  • 401k program
  • Paid Parental Leave: Up to 16 weeks paid leave for the birth parent, and up to 6 weeks paid leave for the non-birth parent
  • Equity in Highnote
  • Stipend to build out your home office; internet and phone reimbursement
  • At Highnote we have built a total rewards philosophy that includes fair, equitable, geo-based compensation that is performance and potential based. Our compensation packages are competitive based on robust market research and are a combination of a cash salary, equity, and benefits. In compliance with the Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the annual salary range for applicants is $70,000-95,000.

Highnote is a diverse and inclusive company committed to growing a diverse and inclusive team. We invite people from all backgrounds and identities to apply. We do not discriminate based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by US federal state or local laws, or the laws of the country or jurisdiction where you work. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing â€” and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.

Working at Samsara means youâ€™ll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team thatâ€™s shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, youâ€™ll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term.

About the role:

The Safety team at Samsara is the anchor point from which we have built a great business extending AI into physical operations. We build intelligent systems that combine computer vision, sensor data, road context, and behavioral patterns to detect risk and prevent accidents before they happen for some of the largest fleets in the world.Â 

In this role, you'll be all about using AI to understand the world and the risk it poses so that vehicles have safety critical information readily available before they arrive at a certain location. Examples of this include: detecting changes in weather to update driving risk and policies, understanding locations of construction zones and their details to alter driving behavior accordingly, understanding what intersections pose the highest risks and why, etc. Samsara is currently saving hundreds of lives every year, and by better understanding the patterns of risk, we hope that you will help us take this to the next level!

This is a remote position open to candidates residing anywhere in Canada. Relocation assistance will not be provided for this role.

You should apply if:

  • You want to impact the industries that run our world: Your efforts will result in real-world impactâ€”helping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, reduce emissions, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely.
  • You are the architect of your own career: If you put in the work, this role wonâ€™t be your last at Samsara. We set up our employees for success and have built a culture that encourages rapid career development, countless opportunities to experiment and master your craft in a hyper growth environment.
  • Youâ€™re energized by our opportunity: The vision we have to digitize large sectors of the global economy requires your full focus and best efforts to bring forth creative, ambitious ideas for our customers.
  • You want to be with the best: At Samsara, we win together, celebrate together and support each other. You will be surrounded by a high-calibre team that will encourage you to do your best.Â 
In this role, you will:Â 
  • Own the strategy, roadmap, and execution of the AI Safety Patterns product area, balancing speed of delivery with long-term value.
  • Work with our talented engineering teams to launch new products to help drive a fast-growing, at-scale business with $1 Billion+ in ARR.
  • Collaborate closely with customers to deeply understand their business, their product feedback, and inform our roadmap.
  • Identify new product opportunities and own them from concept to launch.
  • Act as a product owner, ensuring every detail of the user experience meets high standards.
  • Lead by example in using AI tools to accelerate product development, customer research, and decision-making
  • Partner with our Sales team to help close strategic customer accounts as needed.
  • Champion, role model, and embed Samsaraâ€™s cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices

Minimum requirements for the role:

  • 8+ years of product management experience or other relevant experience, with a proven track record of launching 0-to-1 products and driving business outcomes.
  • Strong B2B SaaS background, with experience working directly with enterprise customers.
  • Hands-on approach, with the ability to dive into details, from defining features to demoing products and supporting sales.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, with a knack for simplifying complex problems and focusing on customer impact.
  • Technical aptitude, with the ability to work closely with technical teams and understand how to deliver high-quality solutions.
  • Strong ownership mentality, with a willingness to go above and beyond to deliver exceptional results.
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to present ideas clearly to customers and internal teams.
  • Strong business acumen.

An ideal candidate also has:

  • Technical background, such as a degree in engineering, computer science, or related fields.
  • Experience with hardware and software product development, particularly in safety-focused domains.
  • Knowledge of industries such as transportation, logistics, or industrial operations.
  • Proven ability to manage pricing, revenue accountability, and go-to-market strategy for new products.
  • Entrepreneurial experience or background in high-growth environments.

#LI-Onsite

The range of annual base salary for full-time employees for this position is below. Please note that base pay offered may vary depending on factors including your city of residence, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
$138,550â€”$179,300 CAD

At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, and other characteristics protected by law. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems and want to ensure that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

Benefits

Full time employees receive a competitive total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at ourÂ Benefits site to learn more.

AccommodationsÂ 

Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or click here if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.

Flexible WorkingÂ 

At Samsara, we embrace a flexible working model that caters to the diverse needs of our teams. Our offices are open for those who prefer to work in-person and we also support remote work where it aligns with our operational requirements. For certain positions, being close to one of our offices or within a specific geographic area is important to facilitate collaboration, access to resources, or alignment with our service regions. In these cases, the job description will clearly indicate any working location requirements. Our goal is to ensure that all members of our team can contribute effectively, whether they are working on-site, in a hybrid model, or fully remotely. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individualâ€™s ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company and in the specified work location, if applicable.

Fraudulent Employment Offers

Samsara is aware of scams involving fake job interviews and offers. Please know we do not charge fees to applicants at any stage of the hiring process. Official communication about your application will only come from emails ending in â€˜@samsara.comâ€™ or â€˜@us-greenhouse-mail.ioâ€™. title: Clinical Recruiting Coordinator
description:
About Pair Team:

Pair Team is on a mission to improve the wellbeing of underserved communities by connecting them to high-quality care.

Pair Team cares for the highest-need Medicaid recipients through a community-led model. We build local partnerships with shelters, food pantries, and other community-based organizations to turn them into a site of care. As a support system for the community, we provide wraparound clinical services, up-skill CBO staff to become Community Health Workers, and utilize our proprietary data-driven technology platform, Arc, for care coordination. Through Medicaid MCOs, we provide healthcare for hard-to-reach, high-need individuals, while sharing healthcare dollars with community groups to expand their social support programs.

Our Values:
  • Lead with integrity: We keep our commitments and take responsibility for our actions. We are dependable and choose authenticity over perfection.
  • Embrace challenges: We leave our egos at the door and step forward into discomfort instead of back into safety. We help each other to learn and provide feedback using candor and kindness.
  • Break through walls: We go the extra mile for our patients, partners and one another, and we run toward hard things. We are resilient in our push for consistent improvement and challenge the status quo.
  • Act beyond yourself: We build each other up and respect boundaries. We seek first to understand and assume positive intent.
  • Care comes first: We hold ourselves to the highest standards for our patients. We are relentless in the pursuit of our mission, and ensure that we are taking care of ourselves in order to care for others.

In the News:
  • Forbes: For Pair Team, Accessibility Is About Delivering Healthcare To Those Who Need It The Most
  • TechCrunch: Building for Medicaidâ€™s regulatory moment with Neil Batlivala from Pair Team
  • Axios: Pair Team collects $9M for Medicaid-based care


About the Opportunity:

As a Clinical Recruiting Coordinator at Pair Team, youâ€™ll play a key role in supporting our high volume clinical recruiting team. This role goes beyond interview scheduling â€” you'll also support sourcing efforts, help candidates through onboarding, and keep an eye on our talent operations to flag bottlenecks or inefficiencies. Youâ€™ll partner closely with recruiters and hiring managers to create a seamless and efficient hiring process, while also bringing a detail-oriented, data-aware mindset to help improve how we work.

This is a fully remote role that requires you to work in the Pacific Time Zone.

Â 

What Youâ€™ll Do:

  • Identify process delays or bottlenecks and flag them to the recruiting team for action
  • Provide timely, clear communication to candidates and internal teams
  • Support recruiters and hiring managers with special projects or ad-hoc recruiting needs

Â 

What Youâ€™ll Need:Â 
  • 2+ years in a recruiting coordination, talent operations, or high-volume recruiting role
  • Experience with Greenhouse ATS (required)
  • Prior sourcing experience, especially in high-volume or clinical environments, is a plus
  • Strong attention to detail â€” you're the type who triple-checks calendars and catches small errors
  • A strong sense of urgency â€” you donâ€™t let scheduling sit for more than a few hours
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Comfortable juggling multiple roles and priorities in a fast-paced, evolving environment
  • Proactive mindset â€” you donâ€™t just spot process issues, you flag them and suggest improvements
  • Passion for supporting underserved communities, including individuals experiencing homelessness, serious mental illness, or substance use disorder
  • Flexibility to work PST hours, regardless of your location
Because We Value You:
  • Competitive salary: $55,000 - $70,000 (depending on experience)
  • Equity compensation package
  • Flexible vacation policy â€“ take the time you need to recharge
  • Comprehensive health, vision & dental insurance
  • 401k
  • Work entirely from the comfort of your own home
  • Monthly $100 work from home expense stipendÂ 
  • We provide the equipment needed for the role
  • Opportunity for rapid career progression with plenty of room for personal growth!

Â

title: Azure Cloud Operations Engineer
description:
Azure Cloud Operations EngineerÂ 
Â 
JOB OVERVIEW
JOB TITLEAzure Cloud Operations Engineer
DIVISION/DEPARTMENTIT
LOCATIONRemote

JOB SUMMARY
We are seeking a skilled Azure Cloud Operations Engineer to join our development team and take ownership of the infrastructure, performance, security, and compliance of our cloud-based applications hosted in both Azure Commercial and Azure Government environments.

This role spans the management of Azure services, cloud cost optimization, regulatory compliance, and support for DevOps pipelines. The ideal candidate is hands-on, detail-oriented, and experienced in securing and maintaining highly available systems that serve federal and commercial clients.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
The Azure Cloud Operations Engineer will:
  • Monitor and manage Azure cloud environments and services including, but not limited to, VMs, App Services, Redis, Service Bus, Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and storage accounts.
  • Optimize performance, scalability, and cost across both single-tenant and multi-tenant deployments.
  • Implement and enforce security best practices; monitor and respond to vulnerabilities and incidents.
  • Ensure and maintain compliance with current standards (e.g., SOC2) and support the implementation of future frameworks (e.g. FedRamp).
  • Support CI/CD processes in Azure DevOps, including both creation and maintenance of pipelines.
  • Execute application deployments as part of the release process, following established schedules and procedures.
  • Collaborate with developers and stakeholders to ensure system reliability, scalability, and secure configuration.
  • Maintain accurate documentation for infrastructure, processes, and compliance requirements.
  • Occasionally provide after-hours support for critical deployments or incident resolution.
EDUCATION & CERTIFICATIONS
  • Bachelor's Degree in a technical field or equivalent work experience is preferred.
KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE
Primary Skills
  • U.S. Citizenship and U.S. residency required.
  • 3â€“5+ years of Azure experience, including at least 1â€“2 years working in Azure Government environments.
  • Strong hands-on experience with core Azure services and Azure governance tools.
  • Solid knowledge of cloud security and compliance practices in regulated environments.
  • Experience working with .NET-based applications in Azure environments.
  • Proficiency with scripting and infrastructure-as-code tools (PowerShell, ARM/Bicep, or Terraform).
  • Familiarity with Redis, Azure Service Bus, Azure Functions, and Logic Apps.
  • Experience supporting both single-tenant and multi-tenant architectures.

Preferred Skills
  • Azure Administrator or Azure DevOps Engineer certifications.
  • Experience with SOC2 audits, FedRAMP compliance, or other regulatory frameworks.
  • Background in supporting applications in federal or government contractor settings.
SKILLS & ABILITIES
  • Need to have the capacity to break down complex problems into smaller, manageable components and analyze the root causes and potential solutions.
  • Have the aptitude to work effectively with others, seek input and feedback and leverage collective knowledge and skills to solve problems as a team.
  • The skill to think outside the box, generate new ideas and approach problems from unique perspectives to find innovative solutions.
  • The capability to assess available options, weigh their pros and cons and make informed decisions that best address the problem at hand.
  • Be ambitious and self-directed with excellent communication skills.
