title: Digital CX Brand Specialist
description:
Who We're Looking For - Digital CX Brand Specialist

Clearlink partners with the worldâ€™s leading brands to create unique consumer engagements that attract, acquire, and develop brand advocates while driving revenue and retention. Weâ€™ve partnered with several industry leaders to help manage and grow their digital customer engagement programs. The Digital CX Brand Specialist serves as a key player on the social media â€œbrand loveâ€ dream team, embracing the brand, voice, and tone on behalf of our client partners to create the ultimate customer experience (CX).Â 

The Impact You Will Make

Core Focus:

  • Drive positive and unique customer experiences through crafting social engagements on behalf of the brand partner, with the intent of raising brand awareness, fostering brand adoption, increasing customer satisfaction, and deepening brand loyalty.
  • Serve as a leader on customer relationship management by representing the brand partner (and their respective products/services), in line with brand voice and tone, product knowledge, corporate guidelines, and training, while also developing a strong understanding and comprehension of trends, preferences, and pain points of current and potential customers. Â 
  • Provide memorable, unique responses at scale to cultivate impactful brand relationships with customers via social media channels and other designated digital touchpoints.
  • Identify and source social opportunities to surprise and delight (S&D) users by sending them swag/promotional items/products. Own the process from start to finish, from locating and qualifying opportunities (based on client guidelines) to fulfillment and follow up with recipients.Â 

Role and Responsibilities:

  • Reply to brand engagement-related social media consumer posts (including Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook) on behalf of client partner, adhering to client-specific social media playbook and guidelines including engagement protocol, voice/tone, and escalation procedures, during designated support business hours.
  • Maintain a consistently high standard of brand responses as well as productivity in the day-to-day of the role.
  • Proactively research, locate, surface, and potentially engage in timely and brand-appropriate sharable user-generated content (UGC) to recommend for repost across client-owned social channels. Â 
  • Support and expand proactive social listening to:
    • Identify opportunities to create more personalized, near real-time customer- influenced engagement replies and content.
    • Pinpoint emerging customer trends in real-time to elevate as wider call-to-action / user-generated brand engagement opportunities.
    • Locate and support â€œnewsjackingâ€ opportunities; i.e. flagging potentially relevant trending hashtags, social, and/or cultural moments for engagement and/or content creation inspiration.
    • Track consumer response to GTM roll-outs and competitive insights as requested.
  • Proactively recommend new content or effective brand engagement solutions, based on observations, trends, and information gathered from results of digital engagements and additional community insights
  • Ensure escalations are processed correctly and in a timely manner using the appropriate and necessary tools and processes.

title: Senior IT Engineer
description:
About Mainstay

Are you ready to be a part of something groundbreaking? Mainstay is the leading market intelligence platform purpose-built for buying, managing, and selling homes in the single-family rental industry. We empower informed decision-making and unlock opportunities for owners, operators, and residents by aggregating and standardizing data from over 50 unique sources. Originally founded within Opendoor, Mainstay launched as an independent company in 2024, driven by our mission to simplify the complex and bring clarity and trust to the single-family rental ecosystem. Join us as we reshape the future of the industry!

About the role

Weâ€™re looking for a Senior IT Engineer to jump in on two high-priority projects: migrating Mainstay to its own Slack workspace and standing up a secure authentication system (most likely Okta). This work is part of our ongoing transition away from Opendoor, and both systems need to be in place over the next few months.

This is a hands-on, full-time contract role expected to last 3 to 6 months. You'll lead these projects end to end, from planning and configuration to rollout and communication - working closely with key stakeholders across the company.

In this role, you will:

  • Set up and launch a new Slack workspace for all Mainstay employees, including user provisioning, channel structure, and integrations

  • Stand up a secure authentication solution with multi-factor authentication and identity management, including integrations with tools like Google Workspace and Rippling

  • Help coordinate change management and communications for both rollouts

  • Pitch in on related IT tasks as needed during the transition

We're looking for someone with:

  • Has 6+ years of IT experience, ideally with a mix of system administration, SaaS tools, and infrastructure projects

  • Has implemented Okta or a similar IAM solution from the ground up

  • Knows their way around Slack migrations, Google Workspace, Jamf, Apple Business Manager, and Rippling

  • Can troubleshoot and figure things out without a lot of hand-holding

  • Communicates clearly and works well with both technical and non-technical teammates

  • Thrives in a fast-paced, remote-first environment

Mainstayâ€™s compensation varies by U.S. geographic market to align with local labor costs. For most locations, the pay range for this position is $53 - $70 per hour, while the hourly range for roles based in the SF Bay Area, Seattle, and New York City Metro area is $66 - $77. Pay is based on location, skills, and experience, and your recruiter will confirm the specific range for your job location. Please note that remote roles are available in all U.S. states except Hawaii, Alaska, Montana, and U.S. Territories.

#LI-AW

Mainstay Built on Trust

At Mainstay, trust is at the core of everything we do. We build trust with everyone -- from candidates to employees to partners. We believe in fairness and openness throughout our hiring process, evaluating candidates based on qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. Our privacy practices describe how we handle applicant information, you can find the policy details for California residents here.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, religious beliefs, or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you require assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please contact us at mainstay-recruiting@opendoor.com

description:
Where Trust Leads, Bold Ideas Grow, and Community Thrives

Paulaâ€™s Choice, a global skincare leader founded in 1995, empowers individuals to define beauty on their own terms through science-backed products. Our mission comes to life through four core values that guide our actions, decisions, and impact:

  • Build Trust:Â We set the standard for skincare, transparency, and shared knowledge.

Our team spans North America, Australia/New Zealand, Europe, and the broader APAC region, collaborating globally to drive innovation. We offer space to thriveâ€”personally, professionally, and through our comprehensive benefits package designed to support your well-being at every stage:

Our culture encourages continuous learning and is by connection, curiosity, and cross-functional collaboration. Whether onsite, remote, or hybrid, we stay connected through shared initiatives that bring our teams together. If youâ€™re inspired by transparency, driven to make an impact, and eager to help foster community, weâ€™d love to have you join us.

Â 

Â 

Â 

Â 

Â 

Â 

Â

Â 

How youâ€™ll have an impact at Paulaâ€™s Choice: We are seeking a highly skilled Item Master Data Manager to join our dynamic team in the consumer products industry. This role is responsible for the management and governance of master data for finished goods, components, and packaging materials, to support business operations and decision-making. You will build and enhance processes, collaborate with and coach team members across departments and markets, and ultimately, be fully accountable for the completeness, accuracy, and integrity of item master data across systems.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Data Governance: Develop and implement data governance policies, procedures, and standards.

As the Global Item Master, a typical day might include a mix of the following:

  • Leading or participating in projects which involve item master data, such as annual pricing updates, launch of new subsidiaries, large scale item re-design, or integration of a new distribution center
  • Championing Item Master best practices, including influencing the organization around design, attributes, product hierarchy, product lifecycle management, and giving visibility to gaps and risks
  • Creating and designing reports to ensure master data is meeting organizational requirements
  • Responding to inquiries from stakeholders, including auditors
  • Other responsibilities as assigned by your manager

Hours: Typical PDT business hours, some flexibility required to support international meetings

Physical requirements: Ability to handle both sitting and screen time for long periods of time

Travel requirements: Up to 5%, may vary

What youâ€™ll bring to the table:

  • 3+ Years as a Data Steward and/or engaged with Data Governance, including prior experience in merchandise hierarchy development and governance, including new item setup process
  • Excellent analytical skills, including the ability to envision item data flow across systems and operations

title: Product Support Engineer
description:
In the minute it takes you to read this job description, Bluecore has launched over 100,000 individually personalized marketing campaigns for our retail ecommerce customers!

Job Title: Product Support Engineer (PSE)

Location: Remote

About Us:

At Bluecore, we are revolutionizing the digital marketing space. As a Product Support Engineer (PSE), you will help our customers optimize their use of our platform by resolving technical issues, setting up campaigns, and ensuring they get the most value from the tools and features we offer.

Who You Are:

What Youâ€™ll Do:

  • Campaign Management: Assist clients in configuring, optimizing, and troubleshooting email/SMS campaigns, including segmentation, automation, and reporting.

  • Collaboration & Knowledge Sharing: Collaborate with Product, Engineering, and Technical Support teams to escalate and resolve complex issues. Share patterns, trends, and learnings with your team to help improve the overall customer experience.

  • Continuous Learning: Develop your technical skills through hands-on experience with our tools and contribute to our internal knowledge base. Share insights and best practices with the team.

Why Join Us?

More About Us:

Bluecore is a multi-channel personalization platform that gives retailers a competitive advantage in a digital-first world. Through Bluecoreâ€™s dynamic shopper and product matching, brands can personalize 100% of communications delivered to consumers through their shopping experiences, anywhere.

This comes to life in three core product lines:

  • Bluecore Siteâ„¢ an onsite capture and personalization product
  • Bluecore Advertiseâ„¢ a paid media product

Bluecore is credited with increasing lifetime value of shoppers and overall speed to marketing for more than 400 brands, including Express, Tommy Hilfiger, The North Face, Teleflora and Bass Pro Shops. We have been recognized as one of the Best Places to Work by Fortune, Crain's, Forbes and BuiltIn as well as ranked on the Inc. 5000, the most prestigious ranking of the nationâ€™s fastest-growing private companies.

Â 
We are proud of the culture of flexibility, inclusivity and trust that we have built around our workforce. We are a remote first organization with the option to potentially work in our New York headquarters on occasion moving forward. We love the opportunity to come together â€“ but employees will always have the option on where they work best.Â Â 
Â 
At Bluecore we believe in encouraging an inclusive environment in which employees feel encouraged to share their unique perspectives, demonstrate their strengths, and act authentically. We know that diverse teams are strong teams, and welcome those from all backgrounds and varying experiences.Â  Bluecore is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, familial status or veteran status.Â

title: Senior Endpoint Security Engineer
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Senior Endpoint Security Engineer to join our Information Security team. This role will be primarily responsible for managing and enhancing the protection of our endpoint and perimeter defenses through platforms including SentinelOne EDR/XDR, Cloudflare WAF, and our enterprise SIEM solution.

You will work closely with IT Systems Engineering, Compliance, and Application Owners across the enterprise to ensure robust and adaptive security controls, policy enforcement, and real-time threat response in a regulated healthcare environment.

As a Senior Endpoint Security Engineer, you will:
  • Own and maintain the configuration and lifecycle management of SentinelOne EDR/XDR platform across all endpoints.
  • Administer and tune policies in Cloudflare WAF to protect external-facing applications from OWASP Top 10 threats and targeted attacks.
  • Manage and optimize SIEM platform integrations, log sources, parsing rules, alert logic, and storage.
  • Design and implement custom detection rules, behavioral policies, and threat intelligence feeds for SentinelOne and SIEM.
  • Monitor and triage real-time alerts from EDR/XDR, WAF, and SIEM.
  • Coordinate with IT and application owners to validate findings, assess impact, and drive containment or mitigation activities.
  • Conduct detailed investigations of valid security events and incidents using forensic and log analysis techniques.
  • Draft and deliver post-incident reports, including timeline of events, root cause analysis, containment/remediation steps, and lessons learned.
  • Work closely with IT Systems Engineering on endpoint hardening, policy enforcement (GPO/MDM), and software deployment strategy.
  • Partner with GRC to support audit readiness and maintain alignment with HIPAA, HITRUST, and NIST CSF requirements.
  • Support DevOps and business teams in secure application delivery and infrastructure security reviews.
  • Proactively enhance detection logic and reduce false positives through continuous tuning.
  • Develop automated workflows and playbooks to streamline response using SOAR or scripting where applicable.
  • Assist in the development of security standards, SOPs, and hardening guides within the Endpoint Security area of ownership..
You should get in touch if:
  • You have 5+ years in detection engineering, cyber defense, or endpoint security engineering role or equivalent experience.
  • You have deep hands-on experience with EDR/XDR tools (SentinelOne preferred), Cloudflare, and SIEM platforms
  • You have strong knowledge of endpoint security architecture, WAF rulesets, log correlation, and threat detection methodologies.
  • You have experience in incident response, digital forensics, and technical reporting.
  • You are familiar with regulatory and compliance frameworks (HIPAA, HITRUST, NIST).
  • You are proficient in scripting (e.g., Python, PowerShell) for automation (highly desirable).
  • You have relevant certifications (e.g., GCED, GCIH, CEH, or vendor-specific).

Benefits Overview:Â 

  • Financial Well-Being: Our commitment to attracting and retaining top talent begins with a competitive base salary and equity opportunities. Additionally, we offer a performance-based bonus program, 401k matching, and regular compensation reviews to recognize and reward exceptional contributions.
  • Physical Well-Being: We prioritize the health and well-being of our employees and their families by providing comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage. Your health matters to us, and we invest in ensuring you have access to quality healthcare.
  • Mental Well-Being: We understand the importance of mental health in fostering productivity and maintaining work-life balance. To support this, we offer initiatives such as No-Meeting Fridays, monthly company holidays, access to mental health resources, and a generous flexible time-off policy. Additionally, we embrace a remote-first culture that supports collaboration and flexibility, allowing our team members to thrive from any location.Â 
  • Professional Development: Developing internal talent is a priority for Clover. We offer learning programs, mentorship, professional development funding, and regular performance feedback and reviews.

Additional Perks:

  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) offering discounted equity opportunities
  • Reimbursement for office setup expenses
  • Monthly cell phone & internet stipend
  • Remote-first culture, enabling collaboration with global teams
  • Paid parental leave for all new parents
  • And much more!

About Clover: We are reinventing health insurance by combining the power of data with human empathy to keep our members healthier. We believe the healthcare system is broken, so we've created custom software and analytics to empower our clinical staff to intervene and provide personalized care to the people who need it most.

We always put our members first, and our success as a team is measured by the quality of life of the people we serve. Those who work at Clover are passionate and mission-driven individuals with diverse areas of expertise, working together to solve the most complicated problem in the world: healthcare.

From Cloverâ€™s inception, Diversity & Inclusion have always been key to our success. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences, perspectives, opinions, and backgrounds, who share a passion for improving people's lives. Diversity not only includes race and gender identity, but also age, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, religion and many other parts of oneâ€™s identity. All of our employeeâ€™s points of view are key to our success, and inclusion is everyone's responsibility.

title: Director of Supply Chain Finance
description:
As a family of brands, it is Our Home's ethos to create and provide delicious, wholesome snacks to communities throughout the U.S. at a great value. We strive to create snacks that offer nourishment and a warm and welcoming sense of familiarity. Our Home is not just the house we live in, but the communities of which we are a part. We are seeking a seasoned and strategic Director of Supply Chain Finance to lead a multi-layered, geographically dispersed team supporting manufacturing accounting, supply chain FP&A, and fixed asset management. This role will be responsible for end-to-end financial oversight of the company's supply chain network, including plant operations across multiple U.S. locations.Â 

The ideal candidate will have deep experience in cost accounting, inventory and fixed asset accounting, financial planning and analysis, and team leadership in a CPG manufacturing environment.Â 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead and mentor a team of finance professionals including plant accountants, financial analysts, and senior managers across accounting and FP&A functions.Â 
  • Drive cost visibility and accountability across a multi-site manufacturing network, supporting both operations leadership and corporate finance.Â 
  • Own and continuously improve costing methodologies, inventory controls, variance analysis, and cost of goods sold (COGS) reporting.Â 
  • Implement a standard costing approach for manufacturing processes, establishing consistent cost benchmarks for raw materials, labor, and overhead to improve budgeting, forecasting, and variance analysisÂ 
  • Oversee plant-level accounting teams ensuring accuracy, compliance, and timeliness of site-level reporting.Â 
  • Direct the annual budget, forecast, and long-range planning processes for the full supply chain and operations footprint.Â 
  • Oversee capital spend tracking, project ROI analysis, and fixed asset lifecycle accounting across all locations.Â 
  • Establish and report on supply chain KPIs and performance dashboards to support data-driven decision-making.Â 
  • Ensure effective internal controls, accounting policies, and audit readiness, especially across distributed plant teams.Â 
  • Partner cross-functionally with Operations, Procurement, and IT to drive financial and operational efficiencies.

Requirements

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field; CPA or MBA strongly preferred.Â 
  • 10+ years of finance experience in manufacturing or CPG, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.Â 
  • Experience managing large, distributed finance teams including both accounting and FP&A functions.Â 
  • Strong working knowledge of cost accounting, plant operations, inventory management, and fixed assets.Â 
  • Ideally, expertise in implementing standard costing methodologies and managing bill of materials (BOM) in a manufacturing environment, preferably in food or consumer goodsÂ 
  • Demonstrated ability to lead through complexity and influence cross-functional teams.Â 
  • Exceptional leadership, communication, and organizational skills.Â 
  • Proficiency with ERP systems and planning tools; NetSuite preferredÂ â€¯Â 
  • Some travel willÂ be required, estimated up to 10%Â 
  • Fully Remote

Benefits

  • Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
  • Retirement Plan (401k)
  • Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)


About the company

Weâ€™re all about plant-based snacking with clean labels and ingredients you can read! Aiming to serve up a trusted family of brands that deliver more of what you love, want, and need!

title: Staff UX Researcher
description:

Youâ€™ll collaborate closely with product, design, engineering, data science, and other disciplines to move quickly, learn deeply, and build with purpose. title: Solutions Analyst
description:
About Us:

YipitData is the market-leading data and analytics firm. We analyze billions of data points every day to provide accurate, detailed insights across industries, including consumer brands, technology, software, and healthcare.

Our insights team uses proprietary technology to identify, license, clean, and analyze the data that many of the worldâ€™s largest investment funds and corporations depend on. We raised $475M from The Carlyle Group at a valuation over $1B, further accelerating our growth and market impact.

We have been recognized multiple times as one of Incâ€™s Best Workplaces. As a fast-growing company backed by The Carlyle Group and Norwest Venture Partners, YipitData is driven by a people-first culture rooted in mastery, ownership, and transparency.

With offices in New York, Austin, Miami, Denver, Mountain View, Seattle, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Beijing, Guangzhou, and Singapore, we continue to expand our reach and impact across global markets.

About The Role:

YipitDataâ€™s Corporate team collaborates directly with organizations like Traeger, FanDuel, Uber, and Harbor Freight to help them make sense of the vast amounts of external data available. We source, clean, organize, and contextualize data to support our clients answer their key business questions. We are expanding our Solutions team within the Corporate practice by welcoming a Solutions Associate to develop and deliver data-driven insights products for our clients.Â 

This is a fantastic opportunity for someone with 2-4 years of experience who wants to enhance their data analysis skills, gain exposure to executives, have a meaningful impact on the businesses we support, and get in on the ground floor of a rapidly growing team at YipitData. Solutions Associates will collaborate closely with Marketing, Sales, and Data Product teams to create and communicate data-driven insights leveraging a variety of data sources to inform client decision making.Â 

You could be a good fit if you are comfortable with understanding, manipulating, visualizing, and articulating data to tell compelling business stories with immediately actionable recommendations.

This is a remote-friendly opportunity that can sit in NYC (where our headquarters is located), or anywhere in the US.Â 

As a Solutions Associate, youâ€™ll gain experience in:

  • Product & Service Delivery:Â  Data and product delivery for corporate accounts. Responsible for quality assuring data products, engaging with clients onÂ  technical/product oriented questions, and fulfilling ad hoc solution requests. Our team collaborates closely with our central data team to refine and improve our data when issues are identified with the data or when ad-hoc prompt the need for new data features.
  • Customer Engagement & Impact:Â  At the end of the day, all our efforts aim to provide actionable insights with a measurable positive impact on our customerâ€™s business. Solutions team members consult with the client to uncover business opportunities and provide actionable insights that guide decision-making. Driving towards and documenting impact stories ensures stickiness and ROI.
  • Product Innovation:Â  Developing dynamic and scalable products to onboard and launch new clients and contribute to the enhancement, expansion and design of our core products for brands and retailers.Â  We encourage experimentation and through the evolution of new analytic techniques to serve customer business needs youâ€™ll help grow customer value.

You Are Likely To Succeed If You Have:

3-5 years of experience in business analytics or consultingExperience working for or collaborating with brand manufacturers and/or retailers with a strong understanding of their business needs

  • A talent for data-driven storytelling
  • A passion for data analysis; SQL and/or Python experience is preferred, not necessary, but must have a willingness to learn
  • Ability to work collaboratively in an innovative, entrepreneurial, and dynamic environment

What We Offer:

Our compensation package includes comprehensive benefits, perks, and a competitive salary:

  • The annual base salary for this position is anticipated to be $125,000~$150,000. The final offer may be determined by a number of factors, including, but not limited to, the applicant's experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal team benchmarks.
  • This role may be performed fully remotely within the United States. Please note that our US headquarters are located in NYC. We also have office hubs in Austin, Miami, Denver, Mountain View, and Seattle. If the remote work is performed outside of these offices, income may be subject to New York State tax withholding.
  • We care about your personal life and we mean it. We offer flexible work hours, flexible vacation, a generous 401K match, parental leave, team events, a wellness budget, learning reimbursement, and more!
  • Your growth at YipitData is determined by the impact that you are making, not by tenure, unnecessary facetime, or office politics. Everyone at YipitData is empowered to learn, self-improve, and master their skills in an environment focused on ownership, respect, and trust.

Please note that for this position, we are not able to consider candidates who currently or in the future will require visa sponsorship.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer.

title: QA Manager
description:
Bitwarden is the trusted identity security leader for millions of users worldwide, empowering enterprises, developers, and individuals to securely manage and share sensitive information anywhere. Bitwarden makes it easy for all users to extend robust security across their devices with password management, secrets management, and passwordless and passkey innovations. The company is headquartered in Santa Barbara, California. Learn more atÂ bitwarden.com.Â 

As the QA Manager, you will lead the QA team, define and implement quality assurance strategies, and collaborate closely with engineering, product, and design teams. You will be responsible for ensuring our software meets both functional and performance standards and that releases are reliable and bug-free.

WHAT YOU BRING TO BITWARDEN

WHAT TO EXPECT IN THE INTERVIEW PROCESS

A FEW REASONS TO WORK WITH US

  • Become an expert. Youâ€™ll get immersed in the prominent technology markets of security and open source software.
  • We are dedicated to building a diverse and talented team. Work remotely with motivated and supportive team members across the world.
  • Learn and grow. Take on new challenges with the support of your team, and join our #growth-club to continue personal and professional development.Â 

Â 

In the United States, the starting base compensation range for this role is $130,000 - $190,000. title: Corporate & Technical Accounting Manager
description:
About Us

At SentinelOne, weâ€™re redefining cybersecurity by pushing the limits of whatâ€™s possibleâ€”leveraging AI-powered, data-driven innovation to stay ahead of tomorrowâ€™s threats.

What Are We Looking For?

We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Corporate & Technical Accounting Manager to join our team. This individual will also be critical in ensuring proper, efficient and effective financial and accounting operations and will play a key role in the automation of processes, while formalizing and supporting corporate governance through internal controls. What Will You Do?

What Skills and Knowledge Should You Bring?

Why Us?

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Altamira is a software development outsourcing company. We provide solutions that make a tangible impact on our clientâ€™s growth and productivity. With domain knowledge across product and technology development, we aim to provide cost-efficient solutions without compromising quality. We are driven to deliver the best, every single time.Â

In terms of industry verticals, we are focused on EdTech, Fintech, eCommerce, and Pharma.

We are looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer for our client.Â This B2B marketplace connects brands, distributors, and retailers across the globe, with a focus on simplifying the ordering of goods and products. The platform mainly serves Africa and Latin America, regions where offline processes still dominate, leading to slow, inefficient transactions. Recently, the platform has also expanded into the United States.

The core of the project is currently built on Magento, with an ongoing migration to VTEX. There is also a .NET-based module responsible for payment processing, alongside several internal side projects. The goal is to create a user-friendly, globally accessible platform that integrates a wide variety of popular payment systems from different countries. Additionally, the product is being enhanced with AI-driven features to optimize the user experience further.

As a DevOps Engineer, youâ€™ll be part of a Cloud-native platform team delivering B2B solutions across emerging markets. You will help maintain and improve DevOps practices, develop CI/CD pipelines, and resolve production issues and performance challenges. You will also play a key role in enabling automation and metrics-driven operations to reduce manual workloads and improve system reliability.

What you will be doing:

  • Building and setting up new development tools and infrastructure

  • Ensuring systems are secure and protected against cyber threats

  • Diagnosing technical issues and developing updates and fixes

  • Monitoring production environments, analyzing metrics, and fine-tuning system performance

  • Optimizing performance to anticipate and meet evolving customer needs

  • Collaborating with development teams on release and testing processes

  • Participating in platform design, infrastructure planning, and system scalability

  • Maintaining clear service level objectives while balancing delivery speed and reliability

  • Supporting secure access (PKI knowledge is a plus)

  • Troubleshooting using AWS, Linux, and Windows logs

  • Maintaining and evolving monitoring and reporting systems

Technical Requirements:

  • Experience with CI/CD using GitHub and Jenkins

  • Hands-on with AWS CodeDeploy, CloudFormation, PowerShell

  • Comfortable working with Linux and Windows servers

  • Familiarity with AWS services: Lambda, Cognito, SNS, Secrets Manager, CloudWatch

  • Knowledge of MySQL and MSSQL

  • Scripting experience in T-SQL, PowerShell, Bash, or Groovy

What Else Weâ€™re Looking For:

  • Strong teamwork and communication skills

  • Proficiency in scripting and automation

  • Excellent problem-solving abilities

  • Detail-oriented with good time and task management

  • Solid understanding of DevOps methodologies

Preferred Knowledge:

  • Background in e-commerce, logistics, or FMCG

  • Familiarity with payment systems, especially in Africa or Latin America

  • Experience designing distributed systems

  • Exposure to platforms like Magento, VTEX, or Shopify

Â 

Â Our transparent recruitment journey usually takes up to 2 weeks and includes a few stages:

  1. Recruiting Interview -> 30-45 min
  2. Technical Interview -> 1-1,5h
  3. Client Interview (optional) -> up to 1h
  4. Pre-Offer Call -> 15min
  5. Reference Check
  6. Offer
We offer:
  • Competitive salary, room for development and growth;
  • Possibility toÂ work inÂ the Bratislava and Kyiv office orÂ fully remotely;

  • Medical insurance (optional);
  • English courses;
  • Technical equipment providing;
  • Paid vacations 20Â workdays, paid sick leave, regular salary reviews;
  • Flexible schedule and ability toÂ manage your working hours;
  • Support your personal growth and skills upgrading;
  • The great environment inside the team, support ofÂ initiatives, and ability toÂ contribute toÂ the common goal.

WeÂ doÂ believe that the success ofÂ altamira.aiÂ isÂ impossible without the success ofÂ our Talents and the success ofÂ our Clients!

description:

title: Head of Product Marketing
description:
About GreyNoise

GreyNoise Intelligence is a mission driven security startup focused on helping organizations understand and mitigate risks from Internet scanning and exploitation. GreyNoise provides real-time, verifiable intelligence on all actors scanning the Internet and how some of them are attempting to exploit vulnerabilities on assets connected to corporate networks. The intelligence is highly trusted because itâ€™s generated from a global fleet of thousands of purpose built sensors observing the Internet. Advanced data science techniques and AI are used to process millions of observed events into real-time intelligence for customers.

The GreyNoise Global Observation Grid observes and analyzes unique threat data at-scale that no one else can. GreyNoise provides the most actionable threat intelligence against perimeter threats, so that no attack works twice.

Â 

All positions are fully remote within the US, with optional office attendance at our DC area headquarters, unless otherwise specified. Applicants must have US work authorization.Â 

Â 

The Role

We are looking for a seasoned Product Marketing professional to join our team. You will be responsible for helping to define and execute the go-to-market strategy for GreyNoise's products. You will work closely with our executive, product, sales, and marketing teams to ensure our products are well-positioned, have compelling messaging, and our field teams are well-trained on how GreyNoise solves customer pain-points. The ideal candidate has a strong background and deep understanding of the security market, and the threat intelligence market specifically. They also have a proven track record of driving successful product launches, marketing campaigns, and sales enablement initiatives.

Â 

What You Will Do
  • Market Analysis and Strategy:
    • Develop and refine product positioning, messaging, and value propositions that resonate with our customers and prospects.
    • Define and execute go-to-market strategies for new product launches and feature updates.
    • Conduct market research to identify customer needs, market trends, and competitive landscape.
  • Product Launch and Management:
    • Lead cross-functional teams to ensure successful product launches, including coordinating with product management, sales, marketing, and other teams.
    • Develop and manage comprehensive product launch plans in collaboration with other teams. Tactics might include content marketing, demand generation, event strategy public relations, analyst relations, and more.
    • Define and execute a freemium strategy for converting free GreyNoise users into paying customers.
    • Monitor product performance and customer feedback to inform product development and marketing strategies.
  • Sales Enablement:
    • Create and maintain sales enablement materials, including sales presentations, product trainings, sales playbooks, competitive battle cards, and more.
    • Collaborate with the sales team to understand their needs and support them with the necessary tools and information to close deals effectively.
  • Content and Communications:
    • Develop compelling top and middle-of-funnel content that articulates the benefits and differentiators of GreyNoise's products, such as product data sheets, white papers, customer testimonials, blog posts, webinars, and more.
    • Manage external communications related to product updates and launches, including press releases, analyst relations, social media announcements, and website updates.
  • Customer Engagement:
    • Regularly gather feedback from customers to inform product and GTM strategy.
    • Act as a spokesperson for GreyNoise at industry events, conferences, and webinars.

Â 

What You Will Bring
  • Experience:
    • Minimum of 5 years of experience in security product marketing, content marketing, product management, or sales engineering. Prior experience marketing to SOC, vulnerability, or CTI teams is strongly preferred.
  • Skills, competencies, and traits:
    • Deep understanding of cybersecurity technologies, market trends, and customer pain points.
    • Proven track record of successfully launching and marketing technical products.
    • Excellent communication (both written and oral) and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts in a clear and compelling manner.
    • Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills.
    • Ability to work independently, set own priorities, and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
    • Experience with marketing automation tools, CRM systems, and analytics tools is preferred.
    • Results-oriented with a strong focus on achieving goals that drive business growth.
    • Collaborative team player with a proactive and positive attitude.
    • Passionate about cybersecurity and committed to staying current with industry trends and best practices.

Â 

This role will report to the Chief Marketing Officer.

Â 

Â 

Benefits

ğŸ’µ Equity in a high-growth, Series-A startup

ğŸ‘©â€âš•ï¸ 100% covered health, dental, vision, and life plans for all employees

6ï¸âƒ£ Competitive 401k employer match of 6%, which is special for a startup. This will be 100% matched and vested from day 1

ğŸ– Flexible paid time off. To encourage time off from work and ensure overall employee health and wellness, GreyNoise strongly recommends each employee to take at least 120 hours of PTO (3 weeks) annually, including at least five consecutive business days

ğŸŒ Remote-first culture. While we are headquartered in the Washington DC area, we have a distributed workforce -- with the majority of our team working remotely from across the country

ğŸ’» Equipment budget. Every new employee gets $3,000 to spend on equipment, so you can pick whatever works best for you

ğŸ‘¼ Paid family leave for all employees.Â We offer 4 months of paid leave (birth or adoption), plus 2 months of optional unpaid leave, so new parents have time to adjust to the new life (and work) schedule

ğŸ“š Learning & development budget. All employees receive an annual $1,500 towards professional development related to their job function. The stipend can be applied to tuition, books, conferences, and more

ğŸŒ´ Company offsites and monthly local hangouts to encourage team bonding

Â 

GreyNoise Culture
The hallmark of any great company is a palpable and viscous culture. The most important pillars of our culture are:
  • Be transparent, honest, and objective. This is what it means to be â€œclinicalâ€
  • Empathize with customers, partners, and each other
  • Learn from mistakes and share the knowledge
  • The way feedback is delivered to one another matters as much as the feedback itself
  • Good work-life balance is the key to sustained productivity
  • The measure of a team memberâ€™s effectiveness is how well the rest of the team operates in their unexpected absence
  • No such thing as a million dollar idea, only million dollar execution
  • Out-innovate our previous selves
Check out our (work-in-progress)Â longform culture document.
Â 
Explainability

Any security product that is a â€œblack boxâ€ that asks you to blindly trust it should raise red flags - we believe the same is true of your place of work. We obviously think GreyNoise is doing something unique, but donâ€™t take our word for it - ask any of our 150+ enterprise customers, investors,Â thousands of happy users, orÂ dozens of journalistsÂ who have cited GreyNoise over the past few years.

Â 

Why You Should Work at GreyNoiseÂ 
  • You enjoy identifying and solving hard problems
  • You are comfortable taking an idea from concept to customer
  • You are open to both explaining your stance and questioning others in a clinical, open-minded, and respectful manner
  • You want to directly impact users
  • You want to grow beyond your current skill set

Â 

Apply for the job

Do you want to join our team? Then we'd love to hear about you!

title: Product Marketing Specialist
description:
Shape How We Launch & Grow Products That Matter

At Acuity Insights, weâ€™re expanding our Product Marketing team to support our companyâ€™s growth and transformation.Â 

Two Product Marketing Specialist roles are now open on the team.

One is focused on our Assessment products (Casper, Formative, and others in development), and the other on our Program Experience products (One45 and Analytics). Youâ€™ll have the opportunity to learn about both areas through the hiring process and explore where your skills, interests, and experience align best.

This is more than a launch role.Â 

Itâ€™s a chance to help build launch excellence at a company scaling with intention. Youâ€™ll shape stronger product stories, equip revenue teams with the tools and confidence they need, and contribute directly to business growth.

Youâ€™ll join a collaborative, thoughtful, and mission-driven team where curiosity, clarity, and continuous improvement are core to our work. If you thrive in cross-functional environments, communicate with empathy and precision, and get energized by solving messy problems in smart, scalable ways, this may be a great work environment for you.

This fully remote role gives you the flexibility to work from anywhere in Canada, and youâ€™ll report to our Manager, Product Marketing while collaborating with partners in product, sales, customer success, enablement, and marketing.Â 

Whether your product marketing experience lies in go-to-market execution, EdTech, assessments, or youâ€™re ready to grow into a new domain, this is your opportunity to contribute meaningfully while deepening your craft.

Your Role & Impact

This year, weâ€™re focused on building our launch excellence muscle and youâ€™ll be at the center of that effort. Youâ€™ll drive the execution of go-to-market activities for new product and feature launches, improve how we communicate value internally and externally, and help the company build confidence and excitement in how we go to market.

Youâ€™ll support the full launch lifecycle, from messaging to post-launch learnings, and play a visible role in creating scalable product marketing systems across the company.

What Youâ€™ll Do

Execute Go-to-Market Plans

  • Collaborate with Product Managers to plan and lead launches
  • Turn product capabilities into clear, compelling messaging and value propositions
  • Create sales and customer-facing materials like one-pagers, objection-handling guides, and pitch decks
  • Facilitate launch coordination across teams, ensuring alignment and momentum

Strengthen Our Launch Approach

  • Contribute to refining our internal launch playbook
  • Help reimagine how we handle release communications and internal enablement
  • Learn from each launch and help us build a cycle of continuous improvement

Partner with Product & Revenue Teams

  • Participate in product discovery activities like customer interviews and design reviews
  • Work with Enablement to deliver effective training for Sales and CS
  • Contribute ideas and input for marketing campaigns, blog posts, webinars, and guides
  • Surface buyer insights by reviewing Gong calls or speaking with customer-facing teams

Drive Alignment Across Products

  • Ensure your productâ€™s messaging connects to our broader platform story
  • Help unify positioning and value communication across teams and touchpoints
  • Participate in working groups and planning cycles related to your product area
Business OutcomesÂ 

Your work will shape how Acuity Insights shows up in the market and how our teams rally behind each product launch. Youâ€™ll help us communicate value more clearly, enable revenue teams to operate with greater confidence, and contribute to stronger product growth. Beyond individual launches, youâ€™ll play a key role in building a more connected, aligned, and confident go-to-market engine across the company.

Hereâ€™s how your work will make a difference:

  • Stronger, more strategic launches that generate excitement, alignment, and early traction
  • Sales and CS teams that feel confident and equipped to speak to our products and value
  • Clearer, more compelling messaging that resonates with buyers and differentiates us from competitors
  • Improved cross-functional collaboration that leads to smoother execution and smarter decisions
  • More scalable launch operations, making it easier to go to market faster and more effectively as we grow
  • Tighter feedback loops between the market-facing, product, and go-to-market teams helping us learn and improve over time
What You Bring

We care more about what youâ€™ve done and how you show up than how many years youâ€™ve done it. You can be a great fit if you bring a mix of experience, capability, and mindset, such as:

  • Taking at least one product or major feature to market, from planning through execution, in a B2B SaaS environment
  • Contributing to messaging, positioning, and sales collateral that helped teams communicate value clearly and confidently
  • Collaborating cross-functionally with teams like Product, Sales, CS, Enablement, or Marketing to bring ideas to life
  • Making launches simpler, more effective, or more strategic, whether through coordination, messaging, enablement, or process
  • Applying (or excited to learn how to apply) AI tools like ChatGPT to improve both quality and efficiency
  • Approaching new domains or complex products with curiosity, fast learning, and resilience in the face of ambiguity
  • Taking pride in producing clear, high-quality work and embracing feedback as a tool for growth
  • Communicating with empathy, adapting messages for different audiences, and listening well in cross-functional settings

You may also bring, or be eager to grow in:

  • Understanding of the EdTech space, assessments, or education program management
  • Supporting Sales and CS teams with tailored enablement content and deal support
  • Participating in product discovery or conducting win/loss interviews to surface buyer insights
  • Building out scalable product marketing processes in a growing or evolving company
How We Support You

Compensation & Growth

  • Equitable and transparent salary. The annual salary for this role is between $85,000 - $100,000 CAD, determined by experience, expected contributions, market alignment and internal equity.Â Â 
  • Investment in your future. Access employee stock options and share in long-term value creation.
  • Expanding your skills. Use a $3,000 annual learning budget for professional and personal development.

Flexibility & Well-Being

  • Work your way. Enjoy fully remote work within Canada, plus up to 6 weeks of international work per year.
  • Take meaningful breaks. Benefit from a two-week company-wide closure at year-end, self-directed vacation (most take 4-6 weeks per year), and an extra Friday off monthly from February to November.
  • Support your health. Access comprehensive benefits for you and your family from day one through Equitable Life of Canada and Nivati.
  • Plan for retirement. Join our GRSP matching program with contributions matched up to 2% of your salary.
Family & Community
  • Parental leave. Receive a 16-week top-up beyond EI benefits, regardless of your role in expanding your family.
  • Leaders and culture that prioritize people. Work in a caring, inclusive environment that values and encourages work-life balance and continuous learning.Â Â 
Selection & Interview Process

Whether you apply directly, are referred, or connect with a recruiter or hiring manager, youâ€™ll receive equal consideration.

We carefully review every application, considering your experience, abilities, and motivation, along with the human qualities we value most and that help people thrive here: caring, curiosity, drive, resourcefulness, and resiliency.Â 

We do not use AI to review your application, but you may be automatically screened out if you do not meet baseline requirements, such as country residency and valid work authorization.

To ensure accuracy and fairness, AI is used for automatic note-taking during some of our live conversations, but all evaluations and decisions are made by real people.

Our process is a two-way conversation. We want to learn about and understand your career, abilities, and interests and make sure you have all the information you need to decide if this opportunity is right for you.

Here are steps to expect:

  1. Application Review & Response. A human reviews your application for potential and fit. No matter the outcome, youâ€™ll receive an update via email.Â 
  2. Recruiter Conversation. A 60-minute call to explore your career story and goals, while giving you a deeper look into our company, products, culture, and team.
  3. Manager Conversation & Launch Walkthrough. A 60-minute conversation to dive into your product marketing experience. Youâ€™ll walk through a launch youâ€™ve led, reflecting on your role, process, and outcomes. Visual aids are welcome but optional.
  4. Team Conversations. Youâ€™ll meet future peers and collaborators from across the company. Each will focus on a key theme â€” technical or behavioural â€” to understand how you think and work. Youâ€™ll also hear about their experience at Acuity Insights.
  5. Wait For a Decision. The Hiring Manager consolidates and evaluates feedback from the team to make a hiring decision. This typically takes 2-4 days.
  6. Offer & Reference Check. If we find a mutual match, we'll invite you to an offer conversation. The offer is contingent on completing a reference check.Â 
The Future Weâ€™re Building

At Acuity Insights, we believe everyone has incredible potential, and our mission is to help uncover and nurture it.

Imagine a world powered by everyoneâ€™s full potential. Weâ€™re working to create that future by building tools and insights that support holistic success for students, educators, and institutions around the world.

Our journey began with a bold idea: to improve how we assess people, not just by academic metrics, but by who they are. In partnership with McMaster University, we developed Casper in 2004 to measure the durable, human skills that matter in health professions and beyond. That vision came to life with the founding of Altus Assessments in 2014.

Meanwhile, One45 started in 1998 at the University of British Columbia helping medical education programs digitize complex processes like curriculum management, scheduling, and assessment. Over time, it became a trusted partner to programs across North America and beyond.

In 2021, Altus Assessments acquired One45, and in 2022, we unified as Acuity Insights, a single, growing organization with a shared purpose and broader vision.

What started as two distinct products is now one integrated mission supported by our Analytics platform, which delivers actionable insights to drive continuous improvement across the learner journey.

Today, our solutions support students and institutions from admissions to graduation across North America, the U.K., Australia, and Saudi Arabia.Â 

As we continue to grow, weâ€™re committed to being more than a software provider. Weâ€™re trusted thought leaders and valued advisors in higher education, offering practical solutions, strategic insights, and guidance that help our partners make confident, informed decisions.

Life at Acuity Insights

At Acuity Insights, youâ€™ll be part of a team of 130+ professionals. While we primarily collaborate virtually, we foster strong social connections and opportunities for in-person co-working.

Our core values - caring, curious, and driven - guide how we work. We listen actively, collaborate openly, and embrace challenges with integrity, creativity, and a commitment to continuous improvement.Â  Above all, we believe in purposeful work that makes a real difference.

We are deeply committed to inclusion and belonging. We respect and value diverse perspectives and recognize that different experiences drive innovation and success.Â 

Our workplace policies are designed to promote equity, flexibility, and well-being.

We encourage applicants from all backgrounds, especially those from underrepresented groups, to apply.

Thanks for considering Acuity Insights as your next employer!



About the company

Acuity Insights is a purpose-led company on a mission to create a world served by exceptional professionals. We help schools select, nurture and graduate the most well-rounded students with technical and social skills, ensuring that when they enter the workplace as physicians, teachers, or any other professional, they are equipped to serve our communities with social intelligence and cultural competency.

title: Head of Product Design
description:
About Ethos

Ethos was built to make it faster and easier to get life insurance for the next million families. Our approach blends industry expertise, technology, and the human touch to find you the right policy to protect your loved ones.Â 

We leverage deep technology and data science to streamline the life insurance process, making it more accessible and convenient. Using predictive analytics, we are able to transform a traditionally multi-week process into a modern digital experience for our users that can take just minutes! Weâ€™ve issued billions in coverage each month and eliminated the traditional barriers, ushering the industry into the modern age. Our full-stack technology platform is the backbone of family financial health.

We make getting life insurance easier, faster and better for everyone.Â 

Our investors include General Catalyst, Sequoia Capital, Accel Partners, Google Ventures, SoftBank, and the investment vehicles of Jay-Z, Kevin Durant, Robert Downey Jr and others. This year, we were named on CB Insights' Global Insurtech 50 list and BuiltIn's Top 100 Midsize Companies in San Francisco. We are scaling quickly and looking for passionate people to protect the next million families!Â 

About the Role

Ethos is looking for a Head of Product Design to help build the worldâ€™s best, and most profitable, direct-to-consumer life insurance purchase experience. At Ethos, you will not only work with talented team-mates to build delightful experiences, but also raise the bar for UX design, company wide.

You should be a pioneer who is not afraid to experiment, invent, and occasionally fail. You should be energized by building from the ground up, designing moments and experiences that drive business value and make customers smile.

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Hold your team accountable for exceptionally high quality design work that drives outcomes for customers and the business. We expect most design critique to come from this candidate.
  • For certain projects, play the role of an individual contributor. Partner with peers in Product, Copy, and Engineering to build stellar products.
  • Lead UX Design hiring, and build a world-class design team to help Ethos fulfill our mission.
  • Managing a team of designers by mentoring and creating growth opportunities for those on your team.
  • Develop UX guiding principles to help agile teams operate quickly and autonomously, but maintain high design standards and consistency from ad to post-purchase.
  • Define and optimize our process of going from consumer problem to MVP design, which includes initial concept design, user research, usability testing, and refinement. Coach IC designers to follow best practices.
  • Refine our UX design career ladder to set clear expectations, hold team members accountable for high performance, and facilitate career growth.

Qualifications and Skills:

  • 10+ years of UX design experience , with 5+ years experience leading or managing a design team.
  • 4+ years of direct-to-consumer design experience, driving conversion rate gains in a fast-paced environment.
  • Demonstrated mastery of beautiful and functional visual and interaction design, typography, and hierarchy. You are an exceptional individual contributor in addition to design leader.
  • Ability to excel at at high-level concepts, and show meticulous attention to detail.
  • Experience partnering with product and engineering peers to drive strategy, vision, and execution.
  • Experience attracting and hiring design talent.
  • Experience collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders such as Brand to balance short- and long- term outcomes.
  • A portfolio of relevant design work, executed either by yourself or a team that you led, that conveys an ability to ship successful products that people love.
  • Excellent communication (verbal, written, visual); openness to collaboration, hearing different perspectives from team members, and driving towards the best outcome for customers and the business.

#LI-Remote #LI-JA1

title: Creative Director
description:
About the Company

Hi, we're Ondo Finance. Our mission is to provide institutional-grade, blockchain-enabled investment products and services. We have both a technology arm that develops decentralized finance technology, and an asset management arm that creates and manages tokenized funds. We were the first company to tokenize exposure to US Treasuries, and have since expanded into several other assets. We are also focused on incubating protocols that can support both tokenized real-world assets and traditional crypto.

Founded by folks from Goldman Sachs Digital Assets Team, weâ€™re backed by some of the best investors in the world including Founders Fund, Coinbase Ventures, Pantera Capital, Tiger Global, and more. We are currently the leaders in the space in terms of AUM and are well capitalized to continue to grow the firm. We're fully remote, with team members across the U.S.

About the Role

Ondo is looking for an experienced Creative Director. You will hands-on execute and drive the creative direction for Ondoâ€™s brand and assets, including the development of Ondoâ€™s brand architecture, design system, brand strategy, and execution, including visual elements and content. The Creative Director will play a key role in bringing the strategic vision of Ondo Finance to life and communicating its value proposition to the world.Â  You are able to direct design strategy as well as roll up your sleeves to independently execute designs through channels like social media, graphic design, and more. This is a unique opportunity to shape the design function at Ondo Finance and lead the team of designers that bring Ondoâ€™s vision to life.

What Youâ€™ll Achieve:

â€¢Execute and Lead: You will both create and provide art direction to build awareness and grow our presence across audience touch points, products, and local markets
â€¢Drive a design system that aligns with our brand and ensure consistency across Ondoâ€™s products and marketing channels
â€¢Develop the creative strategy, visual language, voice, and personality of creative, with a focus on awareness and integrated campaign work
â€¢Build relationships with cross functional team members and executives to effectively manage process, deliverables and design needs
â€¢Deliver outstanding art direction, web designs, photography and video direction, design, typography and campaign systems and support creation of assets for sales enablement, presentations, and digital storytelling needs
â€¢Create organization and project management processes that scale; processes should work well cross-functionally to other teams to meet their creative needs
â€¢Identify gaps in our capabilities - when we need to build and when we need to source specialists and agencies, if needed
â€¢Ensure the quality of creative output is world-class

What we're looking for:

â€¢At least 7+ years of professional experience leading design teams at an agency or an in-house design team
â€¢A compelling digital portfolio, preferably gaining from traditional finance and blockchain companies
â€¢Expertise: Experience designing in blockchain, web3, DeFi, financial services categories
â€¢Willingness to be hands-on. This individual will be required to create and execute, as well as lead.
â€¢Extensive technical knowledge of branding systems is a plus
â€¢Understands high-quality output and is deeply obsessed with all work being in-line with brand systems and visual identities
â€¢Resourceful to get things done quickly and efficiently
â€¢Extensive experience onboarding the right agency partners for the right objectives
â€¢Ability to lead by influence; inspired teams to deliver their best work
â€¢Partial (5hr) daily overlap with EST â€” typically this means you're located in the Americas unless you're willing to work unusual hours

What We Offer

â€¢Competitive compensation including salary, future token rights, and/or equity (according to your preferences) â€” we're well-funded and believe that great talent deserves great compensation
â€¢Full benefits (medical, vision, and dental) and flexible vacation policy (PTO)
â€¢Small remote-first team across many countries â€” you'll be an early team member helping shape our vision, culture, and design practices
â€¢A+ colleagues â€” our team includes alumni from: Goldman Sachs, Blackrock, Two Sigma, Bridgewater, SpaceX, AWS, Meta, Google, McKinsey, Circle, Uniswap
â€¢Best-in-class investors â€” we are proud to be backed by leading crypto experts and VCs, including Pantera Capital, Founders Fund and Coinbase Ventures
salary: competitive compensation including salary, future token rights, and/or equity

title: Data Engineer
description:
Runway is an applied research company pioneering new tools for human imagination. Runway has been at the forefront of multi-modal AI systems ensuring that the future of media creation is accessible, controllable and empowering for creatives. Runwayâ€™s mission is to ensure that anyone anywhere can tell their stories. We believe that deep learning techniques applied to audiovisual content will forever change art, creativity and design tools.

Runway is leading a shift to generative media that is unlocking an unprecedented level of creative potential. The invention of the camera 200 years ago forever changed our world â€“ AI is a new kind of camera that will reshape storytelling forever.

About the role

We're looking for a Data Engineer to help lead Data Engineering and Analytics at Runway. We're seeking someone curious and collaborative, who thrives in fast-paced, high-ownership environments. This role will work closely with our engineering, research, and business teams to build out robust analytics infrastructure that powers model training and business insights across the organization.

What youâ€™ll do

  • Design, implement, and maintain a modern data warehouse architecture using industry best practices

Runway strives to recruit and retain exceptional talent from diverse backgrounds while ensuring pay equity for our team. Our salary ranges are based on competitive market rates for our size, stage and industry, and salary is just one part of the overall compensation package we provide.

Lastly, the provided range is the expected salary for candidates in the U.S. Outside of those regions, there may be a change in the range, which again, will be communicated to candidates.

These rights may be subject to legal limitations.Â To exercise your data privacy rights outside of the United States, please contactÂ globaldpo@lyrahealth.com.Â For more information about how we use and retain your information, please see ourÂ Workforce Privacy Notice."

title: Head of Research & Development (AI / Computer Vision)
description:
Location: United States
Compensation: $300-400k/year salary + equity
Commitment: Full-time


About Panoptyc

At Panoptyc, we're on a mission to revolutionize loss prevention. Using visual AI and manual reviewers, we help retailers detect theft in over 15,000 markets across the United States. From Fortune 500 giants to local businesses, our impact is far-reaching. As a fully remote, rapidly growing team, we're excited to invite top talent worldwide to join us in reshaping the future of retail security.

We're looking for a technical trailblazerâ€”a hacker, builder, and visionary leader who can turn bold ideas into working systems. As our Head of R&D, you'll lead the charge on building next-gen AI and computer vision products from 0 to 1, managing a lean team of engineers while still getting your hands dirty on high-impact technical work.

Youâ€™ll prototype quickly, validate in the field, and guide the evolution of our most ambitious productsâ€”starting with theft detection in retail environments used by thousands of stores.

What Youâ€™ll Do

  • Lead and manage a small team of engineers to prototype and productize computer vision and AI systems

  • Personally build and own early-stage proofs-of-concept, rapidly iterating and validating in the real world

  • Define and prioritize the technical R&D roadmap in collaboration with product and business leads

  • Architect scalable systems that transition from lab to production (edge and/or cloud)

  • Vet new models, data architectures, and hardware deployments

  • Be a key thought partner in setting technical direction for entirely new product lines

What Weâ€™re Looking For

  • 8+ years in engineering roles with deep experience in AI, ML, and computer vision

  • Proven track record of building 0 â†’ 1 products or technical breakthroughs that went to market

  • Strong hands-on skills with ML frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow), video analytics (e.g., OpenCV), and deployment tooling (e.g., ONNX, Triton, containers)

  • Comfortable leading and scaling small engineering teams

  • Hacker energy: fast, creative, scrappy, and resourceful

  • Experience creating data pipelines for and categorizing vast sets of video training data.

  • Bonus: Experience with edge computing, streaming pipelines, or hardware deployment in retail, robotics, or surveillance settings

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
DevSecOps Engineer â€“ Industrial AI Platform Role Summary
You'll own security implementation across our AI deployment pipelines - from AWS EC2 development environments to air-gapped industrial sites. This hands-on role combines security engineering, infrastructure automation, and operational reliability for a platform deploying mission-critical ML models at the edge.

Key Responsibilities
Infrastructure Security Automation

  • Develop and maintain OpenTofu modules for consistent VM provisioning across environments
  • Harden EC2 and on-prem VM templates with Ansible security playbooks
  • Implement least-privilege IAM policies and secure network configurations
  • Design secure bootstrapping processes for production environments


Kubernetes Deployment Security

  • Secure our K3s clusters with proper pod security policies and network isolation
  • Implement robust RBAC models with granular permissions
  • Design secure inter-service communication patterns
  • Build security monitoring for cluster components and workloads


CI/CD Pipeline Hardening

  • Integrate automated security scanning into build pipelines (container scanning, SCA, SAST)
  • Implement secure artifact management with signing and verification
  • Build proper secrets management for deployment pipelines
  • Establish secure container base images and build processes


Operational Security & Reliability

  • Design secure update mechanisms for air-gapped environments
  • Implement monitoring, alerting and incident response automation
  • Build comprehensive logging and audit trails across environments
  • Develop metrics for tracking security and reliability KPIs


Security Reporting & Governance

  • Create security dashboards for visibility into system security posture
  • Build automated compliance validation for industrial requirements
  • Develop practical security documentation and runbooks
  • Run internal security reviews and share findings with engineering teams


Tech Stack

  • Kubernetes (K3s for edge deployment, Kind for local dev, EKS for cloud)
  • OpenTofu (planned) and Ansible for infrastructure automation
  • AWS EC2 for development/test environments, on-prem for production
  • GitHub Actions for CI/CD pipelines
  • Docker for containerisation
  • Python and Bash for security tooling and automation
  • SvelteKit for frontend

Requirements
Essential Skills & Experience:

  • Strong experience with infrastructure-as-code security (Terraform/OpenTofu, Ansible)
  • Hands-on Kubernetes security implementation (networking, RBAC, policies)
  • Experience securing containerised workloads and build pipelines
  • Practical security monitoring and alerting implementation
  • Experience with Linux security controls including AppArmor profile development and enforcement
  • Comfort working with Python, shell scripts, and CLI tooling
  • Ability to balance security requirements with practical engineering trade-offs
  • Experience with log aggregation and operational monitoring

Desirable Skills:

  • Experience with industrial or air-gapped deployments
  • Knowledge of ML/AI deployment security considerations
  • Familiarity with regulated environments (finance, healthcare, industrial)
  • Experience with zero-trust networking concepts
  • Experience with Linux hardening for edge deployments

About You

  • You're hands-on - you code solutions rather than just pointing out problems
  • You find pragmatic security solutions that work in the real world
  • You can explain complex security concepts to people who don't live in that world
  • You balance "secure by default" with "needs to actually work"
  • You're comfortable diving into unfamiliar codebases to find and fix issues

title: Director of Technology & Digital Platforms
description:

IONITY is leading the high-power charging revolution across Europe. As the EV industry moves beyond early adoption toward mass-market scale, we are at a pivotal moment - one that demands innovation, speed, and vision. Originally created by a consortium of major OEMs to support electric vehicle rollout, IONITY is now transforming into a fully independent, technology-led player, extending our reach into new parts of the EV charging value chain: energy optimization, digital services, smart fleet solutions, and more.Â

You will define and execute a modern technology roadmap that moves us beyond infrastructure and into an intelligent ecosystem of energy digital services, and customer-centric innovation.   • Platform & Product Innovation

    • Accelerate the rollout of software platforms that integrate seamlessly with OEMs, fleets, mobility services, and energy markets.

    • Represent IONITYâ€™s technical vision to our shareholders, OEMs, commercial partners, and external stakeholders.
    • Lead technology governance and architecture decisions to balance speed, reliability, and long-term scalability.
Your profile

  • A visionary tech leader with 10+ years in senior technology roles, ideally in fast-scaling digital, energy, or mobility environments.Â 
  • Proven track record in building and scaling platformsâ€”cloud-native, modular, API-driven, and data-rich.Â 
  • Demonstrated ability to lead agile teams and apply lean principles to product and tech development.Â 
  • Deep technical fluency in backend architecture, system design, and modern software practices.Â

  • Strong communicator and collaboratorâ€”able to align diverse teams around a bold technology vision, who inspires teams and works collaboratively across business functions.Â 
  • A hands-on, entrepreneurial leader who thrives in high-growth, fast-changing indsutry, willing to roll up your sleeves while inspiring teams to move with urgency, ownership, and creative problem-solving.Â 
  • Passionate about sustainability, innovation, and creating exceptional user experiences.Â 
Our Mission

There should be no borders when it comes to electric travel. Thatâ€™s why we are building, operating, and constantly growing our network of high-power charging stations along highways in 24 European countries. All charging stations are open to electric vehicles of any brand. With several charging points at each location. With ultra-fast charging stations that recharge your vehicleâ€™s batteries for the next stretch of your journey in the shortest time possible. Â And as we provide 100% renewable energy everywhere in our network, charging at IONITY means carbon-neutral driving.
