Why Mozilla?

Mozilla Corporation is the non-profit-backed technology company that has shaped the internet for the better over the last 25 years. We make pioneering brands like Firefox, the privacy-minded web browser, and Pocket, a service for keeping up with the best content online. Now, with more than 225 million people around the world using our products each month, weâ€™re shaping the next 25 years of technology and helping to reclaim an internet built for people, not companies. Our work focuses on diverse areas including AI, social media, security and more. And weâ€™re doing this while never losing our focus on our core mission â€“ to make the internet better for people.Â 

The Mozilla Corporation is wholly owned by the non-profit 501(c) Mozilla Foundation. This means we arenâ€™t beholden to any shareholders â€” only to our mission. Along with thousands of volunteer contributors and collaborators all over the world, Mozillians design, build and distribute open-source software that enables people to enjoy the internet on their terms.Â 

About the role:

The Internal Communications Manager will play a crucial role in driving communication programs that keep the Mozilla employee community informed, engaged, and aligned with the companyâ€™s strategy and goals. Working closely with company execs, senior leaders and cross-functional teams, you will support the development, refinement and execution of communication strategies that strengthen Mozillaâ€™s internal culture during a period of significant change.Â 

This role is part of the Communications team within Marketing and will report to the Director of Internal Communications.Â 

Key responsibilities:

Communications leadership: Drive awareness and alignment around our corporate and product strategies along with company-wide initiatives helping Mozillians cut through the noise and focus on whatâ€™s most important. Align internal messaging with the companyâ€™s mission, operating values, and strategic priorities.

  • Executive and leadership communications: Work directly with senior leadership to craft key messages, including executive talking points, internal presentations, and company-wide emails. Embed with functional teams to ensure continuity of communicating those key messages.
  • Program management: Own the production and execution of high-visibility internal communications such as the monthly internal employee newsletter, Life@Mozilla blog, some of the all-company meetings and other employee engagement initiatives.
  • Change management: Lead internal communication efforts during periods of organizational change, ensuring transparency and engagement.
  • Cross functional collaboration and relationship-building: Collaborate on projects to drive employee engagement with programs, campaigns and initiatives.Â 
  • Communication calendar: Partner with the Director of Internal Communications to maintain an internal communications plan, including a content calendar and recommended channels, and deliver compelling and cohesive narratives to support Mozillaâ€™s initiatives.
  • Maintain current internal communication practice: Maintain our baseline internal communication channels and platforms, including intranet (Confluence) and newsletters, to ensure employees stay informed. Document processes, plans and templates to ensure an accurate history is maintained and new plans can be initiated quickly.
  • Improve and/or scale to stay aligned with emerging best practices: Keep up with tech and global news including what/how peer group companies are communicating to their employees. Implement methodologies and innovative thinking, considering new uses for old channels, and the creation of new forms of communications, to ensure the right messages hit at the right time.

Key qualifications:

  • Experience: 5+ years of progressive communications experience, preferably in a global or remote-first environment. Experience managing communications during significant organizational change is a plus. You know how to lead with empathy while building a culture of high performance.
  • Leadership: Proven ability to lead strategic communication execution and provide guidance across departments. Comfortable advising senior leaders on complex communications issues.
  • Project management: Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines while working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Collaboration: Excellent interpersonal skills with a strong ability to collaborate across different teams, influence without authority, and drive cross-functional initiatives.
  • Adaptability: Demonstrated success in navigating ambiguity and leading through change while keeping employees informed, engaged, and aligned.
  • Storytelling: Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas clearly and effectively to diverse audiences. A creative thinker who can craft compelling narratives that resonate with employees at all levels.
  • Ethical and low ego: You engender confidence and trust while also fostering respect and credibility. Able to maintain strictest discretion on sensitive topics as they arise.Â 

What youâ€™ll get:

  • Rich medical, dental, and vision coverage
  • Generous retirement contributions with 100% immediate vesting (regardless of whether you contribute)

About MozillaÂ 

When you work at Mozilla, you give yourself a chance to make a difference in the lives of web users everywhere. And you give us a chance to make a difference in your life every single day. Join us to work on the web as the platform and help create more opportunity and innovation for everyone online.Â  Weâ€™re not a normal tech company. The things we create prioritize people and their privacy over profits. We exist to make the internet a healthier,Â  happier place for everyone.

Commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion

title: Growth Lead
description:
About Atticus

At any given time, 16 million Americans are experiencing a crisis that requires urgent help from our legal system or government. The right assistance could transform their lives. But today, most never get it.Â 

Atticus makes it easy for any sick or injured person in crisis to get the life-changing aid they deserve. In the last 6 years weâ€™ve become the leading platform connecting people with disabilities to government benefits. We also help victims of accidents, misconduct, and violence get compensation from insurance. So far, weâ€™ve gotten thousands of people access to over $4B in life-changing aid, and weâ€™re just getting started.

We've helped more than 110,000 people in need (see our 13,000+ five-star reviews) and raised more than $100 million from top VC firms like Fika, Forerunner, GV (Google Ventures), and True Ventures. (We closed our Series C round in April 2025, so we're well-funded for the foreseeable future.) We're a small but growing team â€” we expanded from 89 to over 151 members last year, and we anticipate further growth in 2025.

The Job

Growing the number of clients we serve at Atticus is one of the hardest and most rewarding things we do. Because the legal marketing space is highly competitive and heavily regulated, we seek innovative ways to reach our clients during the biggest crises of their lives while also setting Atticus apart from sketchy billboard lawyers and sell-your-info schemes. The Growth Lead role mixes traditional marketing and acquisition (testing new platforms, managing campaigns, gathering and analyzing data) with responsibilities unique to a quickly scaling a tech company (developing partnerships, working with product leaders to tailor our UX to different audiences, creative briefing, and building our data infrastructure). In a typical week, you might do any or all of the following:

  • Partner with Creative to drive our paid social creative process, from concept development & briefing to test roadmap creation

  • Leverage contractors or creative agencies as needed to augment our internal capabilities

  • Work with Product and Engineering teams to tailor client product experience to the needs of our unique audience

The role is a rare opportunity to join a fast-growing Series B startup in a position that mixes growth marketing execution and innovation, encourages mentorship from leaders across a variety of disciplines, and prioritizes autonomy to shape our acquisition strategy as we scale.

Qualifications:

Required:

  • Youâ€™re an ambitious self-starter. You thrive in ambiguous environments and enjoy a strategic challenge.

  • You have a demonstrated commitment to doing good and helping people.

Bonus / Nice-to-Have:

  • Experience using Looker, SQL, Google Analytics, and Google Tag Manager

  • Experience using Google and Meta Ads and have a track record of improving paid media campaigns.

  • Experience using digital marketing platforms (e.g., Google and Meta Ads) and have a track record of improving paid media campaigns

  • Experience designing and producing digital ads

  • We are strongly committed to building a diverse team. If youâ€™re from a background thatâ€™s underrepresented in tech, weâ€™d love to meet you.

Salary and Benefits

This is a rare opportunity to join a startup that has strong traction (substantial funding, well-respected backers, tremendous growth, and many happy customers) but is still small enough that you can have a huge impact and play a role in shaping our culture.

Weâ€™re a certified B Corporation tackling a critical social problem. Our mission to help people in need drives everything we do, and your work here will touch many lives.

We offer competitive pay â€” including equity â€” and generous benefits:

  • Medical and dental insurance with 100% of employee premiums covered

  • 15 vacation days & ~19 paid holidays each year (including two weeks at end-of-year)

  • Free membership to OneMedical

  • $600/year reimbursable stipend for internet service

  • $1,000 reimbursable stipend for education and training outside of work

  • Up to $1,200/year student loan repayment assistance

  • 401(k) and optional HSA/FSA

  • Humble, thoughtful, smart, fun colleaguesÂ 

We anticipate the base salary band for this role will be between $130,000 to $155,000 in addition to equity and benefits. The salary at offer will be determined by a number of factors such as candidateâ€™s experience, knowledge, skills and abilities, as well as internal equity among our team.

Location

This job is fully remote and weâ€™re committed to empowering everyone with flexibility. Live wherever, work remotely, and travel to LA (on the company dime) as needed to be with your colleagues â€”somewhere between quarterly and yearly. We care a lot about building a great culture and we think some interactions need to happen in person, so we put a lot of thought into retreats, offsites, and other ways to gather.

title: Design Engineer
description:
FlutterFlow is a leading visual development platform that revolutionizes the way teams create, design, and deploy applications. With over 2M users across 200+ countries, FlutterFlow enables teams to build apps without extensive coding knowledge. With an intuitive visual interface, granular control over app experience and cross-platform deployment capabilities, FlutterFlow is trusted by startups and Fortune 500 companies alike to accelerate their product development and deliver innovative digital solutions quickly and efficiently.

Perks & Benefits
We are a globally distributed company - 15 countries and counting! While our benefits offering varies from country to country, our goal is to provide competitive and comprehensive benefits to every member of our team, no matter where they live and work.

title: Contract Product Designer
description:
Contract Product Designer (Remote)

Gifted Savings is looking for a freelance product designer to help shape and evolve our app experience while our founding designer is on paternity leave.

About Gifted Savings

Gifted Savings is a nonprofit organization gifting investments to change young peopleâ€™s lives. By gifting students a $1,000 investment portfolio along with the knowledge to make it grow, we empower them to take control of their financial futures. We create meaningful opportunities for high school students to explore the value of investing, equipping them with real-world skills and experiences that last a lifetime.

The Gifted Savings high school program is facilitated through a custom-built web app, which allows students to track their gifted investment portfolios while delivering bite-sized, interactive lessons on investing education. As students progress through the program, they document their journey by sharing short video testimonials, offering insights into their personal growth and the impact of their new financial knowledge. The goal is to help students see the long-term power of saving and holding investments while fueling a growing conversation about financial well-being.

Gifted Savings has created a simple, scalable way for donors to gift investment assets directly to a large cohort of individual recipients (like all the students in a high school). On the recipient side, we make it simple for young people, many of whom may not otherwise have the chance to own appreciating assets, to hold and grow wealth.Â 

Gifted Savings is a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit founded by serial entrepreneur, Farhad Mohit, with over $1B in exits â€” Flipagram (now TikTok), Shopzilla, and BizRate.Â 

What Youâ€™ll Work On

  • Refine and evolve product flows â€” across both school-based and F&F experiences, including onboarding, user engagement, landing funnels, and learning moments.

  • Design and test new features â€” from first-touch experiences to lesson plan UX, in collaboration with product and engineering.

  • Support our upcoming school launches â€” help us ship clean, engaging experiences as we go live in 5 schools at the start of the academic year.

  • Contribute to the financial education journey â€” support the evolution of our online lesson plan and how it integrates with product flows and learning milestones.

  • Support marketing and communication needs â€” design flyers (Spanish and English), educator guides, social media templates, FAQs, and other assets as needed across both school and F&F initiatives.

  • Collaborate across teams â€” work closely with PMs, engineers, and leadership to move fast and stay grounded in user needs.

  • Adapt quickly to shifting priorities â€” jump in on fast-moving product or content needs that arise as we scale and test in real time.

What Weâ€™re Looking For

  • A strong, detail-oriented visual thinker who brings ideas to life with intention.

  • Comfortable designing across both product UX and communication design.

  • Experienced in Figma, Framer, and Adobe Creative Suite.

  • Able to think strategically and execute across multiple experience types (product, content, brand).

  • Startup or agile experience preferred â€” someone who thrives in ambiguity and iteration.

  • Self-directed and collaborative â€” async-friendly but comfortable joining weekly check-ins (e.g., Wednesdays at 4pm PT / 7pm ET).


Why you should join

  • Impact: Work on something that will radically advance financial inclusion - and philanthropy - in America and beyond.

  • Small Team: Join as an early team member, shaping an idea that can change the world for good.

  • Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom of a remote work environment. This role requires 20-40 hours per week.

Other Important Information

The pay rate for this remote contractor position is $45 to $65 per hour. This is a 20-40 hour per week contract position.Â  This range reflects the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. The hourly rate will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant experience, skills, seniority, education, qualifications, certifications, and organizational needs. We reserve the right to modify this pay range at any time.

We are not considering candidates currently based outside of the US, so please only apply if you are physically located in the US. Unfortunately, we are not able to provide sponsorship for any of our roles at this time.

Note: Gifted Savings is the sister nonprofit organization to GoodParty.org. Applications will be received through GoodParty.org's jobs page and you may receive emails from an @goodparty.org email address regarding next steps.

Apply or spread the word

We hope you'll apply!

If you know anyone else who may be interested, please share this posting â€“ thanks!

Contract Details

  • Start date: Mid June, 2025

  • End date: Around October 1, 2025

  • Time commitment: 20â€“40 hours/week

  • Location: Remote (U.S.-based only)

This is a temporary role to fill in while our founding designer is on leave. It wonâ€™t lead to a permanent position, but itâ€™s a meaningful opportunity to contribute to a fast-moving, socially impactful organization.

title: Lead Product Manager, AI
description:
This is Product at Lattice

The Lattice Product team is on a mission to make work meaningful for companies across the world. Lattice is a unified people platform that includes both a modern HRIS and a comprehensive Talent Management suite that offers performance reviews, engagement surveys, real-time feedback, weekly check-ins, goal setting, and career and compensation planning. This allows companies to centralize employee data and drive development, growth, and engagement from a single system â€” leading to stronger retention, performance, and business impact. Since launching in 2016, weâ€™ve grown to support over 5,000 customers globally.

What You Will Do

As a Lead Product Manager for our AI initiatives, you will be at the helm of transforming and expanding our AI-powered experiences across the Lattice platform. This is a high-impact role where you will have the autonomy to innovate and drive the strategic vision, ensuring that Lattice's AI capabilities remain at the cutting edge of HR technology.

  • Strategize closely with senior leadership and cross-functional teams to shape the future of Lattice's AI strategy and roadmap.

  • Establish and monitor key AI product KPIs and metrics, evaluating performance to guide continuous improvement and ensure AI experiences meet quality, safety, and ethical standards.
  • Drive cross-functional collaboration with design, engineering, AI/ML, user research, product marketing, security, and legal teams to deliver sophisticated AI solutions that align with business goals.
  • Maintain a deep understanding of AI/ML technology trends and competitive landscape, positioning Lattice as a thought leader in AI-powered HR solutions.
What You Will Bring to the Table
  • Minimum 7 years of progressive experience in product management, with specific expertise in AI/ML product development, preferably in B2B SaaS environments.
  • A track record of success in leading AI product development from 0-to-1, with demonstrated business impact and customer adoption.
  • Strong leadership skills, with experience mentoring other product managers and guiding cross-functional teams through complex AI initiatives.
  • Deep understanding of AI/ML technologies, including generative AI, LLMs, and how they can be applied to workflow-heavy products.
  • Strategic thinking with the ability to navigate complex tradeoffs across UX, data availability, AI reliability, technical complexity, and business priorities.
  • Excellent communication skills, adept at articulating complex AI concepts to diverse audiences and influencing at all levels of the organization.
  • Robust analytical skills, skilled in using data and metrics for decision-making.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset, thriving in ambiguity and taking ownership in a dynamic environment.

Â 

The estimated annual cash salary for this role is $179,000 - $223,500. This position is also eligible for incentive stock options, subject to the terms of Latticeâ€™s applicable plans.

Benefits: The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: Medical insurance; Dental insurance; Vision insurance; Life, AD&D, and Disability Insurance; Emergency Weather Support; Wellness Apps; Paid Parental Leave, Paid Time off inclusive of holidays and sick time; Commuter & Parking Accounts; Lunches in the Office; Internet and Phone Stipend; One time WFH Office Set-Up Stipend; 401(k) retirement plan; Financial Planning; Learning & Development Budget; Sabbatical Program; and Invest in Your People Fund

Compensation may vary based on (a) location, as Lattice factors in specific location when benchmarking compensation for most roles; (b) individual candidate skills and qualifications; and (c) individual candidate experience.

Additionally, Lattice leverages current market data to determine compensation, so posted compensation figures are subject to change as new market data becomes available. title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Here at Shippo, we are the shipping layer of the internet and we consider ourselves to be one of the core building blocks of e-commerce.Â 

Our mission is to make merchants successful through world class shipping. With our products and solutions, we level the playing field by providing our customers with best-in-class solutions that otherwise wouldnâ€™t be available to them. Through Shippo, e-commerce businesses, marketplaces, platforms and a variety of logistics infrastructure providers are able to connect to shipping carriers around the world from one API and dashboard. At the same time, fraud is rapidly increasing in the shipping industry, and we are building fraud detection and prevention systems to protect ourselves and our customers from bad actors. This means, through our remote-first program, â€œShippos Everywhereâ€, our roles can be based anywhere in the US with the exception of Delaware, Nevada, Ohio, Oregon, Hawaii, New Mexico and West Virginia and many roles can be based internationally.

title: Frontend Engineer
description:
The Company
Â 
Capital Markets Gateway LLC (CMG) is a financial technology firm, uniquely focused on the equity capital markets (ECM), connecting investors and underwriters via a neutral platform. CMG delivers integrated ECM data and analytics, unrivalled transparency into deal flow, and workflow efficiencies for an otherwise fragmented and inefficient process. Providing a digital system of record for firm-wide deal activity, CMG helps clients make more timely, better-informed decisions. Launched in 2017 by a team of ECM practitioners, CMG has completed two successful fundraising rounds and is backed by a group of the worldâ€™s most prestigious financial institutions. The CMG platform is currently relied upon by nearly 150 buy-side firms representing $40 trillion in AUM and 20 global investment banks. For more information, please visit www.cmgx.io.
Â 
The Role
Â 
Weâ€™re looking for a Front-End Engineer to join our team to help build efficient, elegant, and intuitive user interfaces for enterprise solutions in the financial industry.As a Front-End Engineer, you will play a critical role in crafting user-centric, performant, and scalable interfaces that power our enterprise financial solutions. You will collaborate closely with product managers and back-end engineers to bring intuitive and responsive user experiences to life, translating complex business requirements into clean, maintainable code. Youâ€™ll contribute to front-end architecture decisions, help establish best practices in UI development, and champion design consistency and accessibility. Your work will directly influence the usability and visual polish of our products, ensuring high-quality, high-impact user experiences with every release.
Â 
Our Engineering Team
Â 
The CMG engineering team consists of domain experts who work collaboratively within a culture of cross-domain knowledge sharing. We value engineers who are passionate about modern technologies and best practices.Our engineers are willing to challenge the status quo and are constantly seeking improvement and efficiency in our code-base and platform. CMG engineers are empowered to explore solutions and bring recommendations to the table. We are in a period of making impactful engineering decisions. As part of our process, we believe in taking the time for research and prototyping - this is critical in making the right decisions.Given the experience of our team, we have naturally adopted best practices from local development, through code review and into production rollouts. Besides the standard pull requests, test automation, code coverage tracking, containerization, and one-click deployments we are constantly reviewing these foundational components to develop new best practices.



Key Responsibilities
  • Develop and maintain complex user interfaces for web applications using React.
  • Collaborate with product teams to translate UI/UX wireframes and mockups into functional, high-quality code.
  • Collaborating with back end engineers and engineering managers to ensure that the overall product meets all requirements and specifications.
  • Write clean, maintainable, well-tested, and well-documented code while participating in regular code reviews and team discussions.
  • Contribute to overall quality through E2E Tests.
  • Stay current with emerging front-end technologies and trends, continuously improving development practices and tooling.



What We're Looking For
  • English level - C1 or C2
  • React: 3+ years
  • Software engineering: 5+ Years
  • JavaScript state management (i.e. redux, mobx, context, unidirectional data flow)
  • JavaScript build tools (i.e. CRA, webpack, gulp)

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
About Telgorithm: Telgorithm is a cutting edge messaging API provider specializing in 10DLC text messaging. We enable software providers to send high-volume business text messages at the highest delivery rates in the industry, 99%+ on average. Telgorithm combines timely customer support, expert-level messaging compliance guidance and patent-pending technology that proactively and automatically manages businessâ€™ Carrier rate limits for the most effective 10DLC API experience. Say goodbye to compliance rejections, error codes and poor deliverability causing your customersâ€™ complaints to pile up. Telgorithm allows software and application providers to successfully send compliant 10DLC messages by the millions daily. To learn more, visit www.telgorithm.com.Â 

About Us: Telgorithm was founded on the principles of transparency, customer experience, responsibility, education, and empathy. Our team is committed to providing our customers with the guidance and support needed to be successful in the evolving A2P landscape. Weâ€™re growing quickly and looking for team members that are committed to contributing to our mission of changing the A2P 10DLC ecosystem for the better.Â 

When faced with challenges, we seek out creative solutions and workarounds. As a startup, our work and team are fast-paced; weâ€™re extremely collaborative yet unafraid to make decisions and change course later if needed. If you thrive as a both a team player and an individual contributor, are interested in solving problems, and motivated to make the world of telecom more fun â€“ Telgorithm might be the company for you.

Reporting to: CTO, Yury Semerikov

Location and Language: This is a remote position for which we are accepting applicants in GMT + 3 time zones with preference for candidates in: the European Union (excluding Germany), Serbia, and Poland. All candidates must be able to provide proof of identity and work authorization to work as a contractor in their country of residence. Telgorithm is based in the United States and English is the primary language used at work. Proficiency with Russian is a must have because we have a Russian-speaking development team.Â 

The Role:

We're looking for a hands-on, systems-minded DevOps Engineer with strong experience supporting .NET applications in production to take ownership of Telgorithm's cloud infrastructure, deployment pipelines, observability stack, and internal tooling. You'll play a critical role in ensuring the performance, reliability, and scalability of our telecom platform as we continue to grow.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a small, high-impact team, enjoys deep technical challenges, and is confident working across the entire DevOps stack â€” from Kubernetes and CI/CD to dotnet performance tuning and memory diagnostics.

You'll collaborate closely with our engineers and product team, maintaining the systems that power our real-time messaging infrastructure. From upgrading Kubernetes clusters to writing custom Grafana dashboards or debugging .NET GC issues in production, you'll be the technical lead for making sure everything runs smoothly and securely.

What You'll Do:

As our DevOps Engineer, you'll play a critical role in shaping the infrastructure behind Telgorithm's real-time, cloud-native telecom platform. We're solving complex, time-sensitive challenges in a fast-moving industry, and your work will be central to making that possible.

This isn't a "keep the lights on" type of DevOps role. You'll be deeply involved in evolving the systems that keep our platform stable, scalable, and observable as we grow. You'll collaborate closely with engineering teams to manage infrastructure across multiple environments.

Youâ€™ll lead the charge in keeping our Kubernetes clusters running smoothly and efficiently. At Telgorithm, observability isnâ€™t just a checkbox - itâ€™s a priority. Youâ€™ll have the freedom to build custom Grafana dashboards and create meaningful SQL-based metrics that help us stay ahead of issues and make better decisions, faster.

Beyond that, youâ€™ll take ownership of our alerting systems and design a thoughtful, reliable backup strategy that gives the whole team peace of mind. Youâ€™ll play a key role in keeping our platform secure by managing critical integrations, and ensure our development cycles stay fast and clean by maintaining build and versioning pipelines for our .NET and Node.js apps.Â 

This role touches nearly every part of our platform and gives you the opportunity to own, build, and continuously improve the systems that keep everything running smoothly.

What youâ€™ll bring

  • Hands-on experience with public cloud providers (AWS preferred, GCP or Azure a plus)
  • Strong knowledge of Kubernetes (EKS/GKE/k3s) and Docker
  • Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform preferred)
  • Familiarity with GitOps tools like Flux or ArgoCD
  • Proficient with CI/CD systems like GitHub Actions, Jenkins, or GitLab CI/CD
  • Experience with Helm and Helm chart customization
  • Solid scripting skills with Bash
  • Familiarity with dotnet and Node.js build tooling (msbuild, vite, webpack)
  • Experience troubleshooting complex dotnet app issues: memory leaks, performance, GC, etc.
  • Strong understanding of networking: DNS, TCP/IP, HTTP
  • Experience with logging and monitoring stacks (EFK, ELK, Loki/Promtail, Prometheus, Grafana)
  • Understanding of VPN technologies (OpenVPN, IPSec, WireGuard)
  • You have a Bachelorâ€™s degree or higher in a technical field
  • Bonus: experience with custom metric orchestration via SQL, HAProxy rate-limiting, or Slack bot scripting

Join Our Team:

Being human isnâ€™t about checking every box on a list. Itâ€™s about the experiences we have, the people we meet, and the perspectives we share. So, if you have the skills but are hesitant to apply because of your background, apply anyway. We need amazing people like you to help us challenge the conventional and think differently about the problems that weâ€™re solving. Weâ€™re in this together.

What We Offer:

Joining our team isnâ€™t a job switch, itâ€™s a career accelerator. Hereâ€™s how weâ€™ll support you in doing some of the most impactful work of your career:

  • Fully remote work arrangement
  • Flexible time off; including paid vacation and sick leave
  • Employee stock options

Telgorithm is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We truly believe that the intersection of our individual differences help to create a better workplace, a better product, and a better world. We do not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, age, disability, pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical condition), genetic information, protected military or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Telgorithm does not accept unsolicited resumes from individual recruiters or third-party recruiting agencies in response to job postings. No fee will be paid to third parties who submit unsolicited candidates directly to our hiring managers or HR team.

Hiring Scams Are on the Rise

Please be aware of false email domains, solicitations, or employment offers from suspicious sources. Please note that employment offers and any requests for information will always be made by a Telgorithm employee with an @telgorithm.com email address.Â All legitimate job openings are posted on our careers page at https://job-boards.greenhouse.io/telgorithm.Â 

Telgorithm never asks job seekers to make any payment as part of the recruiting process. If you have any questions or concerns about the authenticity of the Telgorithm recruitment process or an offer that you have received, please contact us by email at peopleops@telgorithm.com.Â 

If you have provided monies or other sensitive personal information and suspect you are the victim of fraud, please contact your local authorities or the Federal Trade Commission at 1-877-382-4357 or online at ftc.gov/complaint.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Data
description:
About us

We are a fast-growing team on a mission to reimagine analytics and make data accessible to all.

The Count canvas combines the power of data notebooks with the collaborative workflow of digital whiteboards. Weâ€™re often referred to as the â€œFigma for dataâ€ because of the way Count transforms the way data teams work with the wider business through greater transparency and trust.

Since launching in September 2022 we have seen the canvas concept explode, with Count empowering some of Europeâ€™s leading tech companiesÂ â€” including Cleo, BeautyPie, TooGoodToGo and OmnipresentÂ â€” to revolutionise how their teams understand and work with data.


What you'll do

Weâ€™re looking for an exceptional software engineer to help shape Countâ€™s next stage of growth. You'll own technical projects at the intersection of software development, data engineering, analytics and DevOps infrastructure, playing a key role in automating and scaling processes that empower every team across the organisation. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Scaling our Go-To-Market (GTM) stack: Work closely with our GTM team to automate our go-to-market activities, by integrating our marketing, sales and finance tools with our CRM and product.

  • Owning Countâ€™s analytics: Develop and maintain our core data infrastructure and data models to ensure the marketing, customer success and product teamsÂ have access to meaningful and accurate metrics.

  • Driving operational efficiency via automation and AI: Build scalable processes powered by AI agents and automation tooling. Continuously remove manual intervention from workflows to drive outsized outcomes across the business.


We'd love to hear from you if you:

  • Have at least 4 years of professional experience as a backend/platform engineer

  • Have deep expertise in Python and building reliable data-focused backend services

  • Have hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure (GCP/AWS/Azure), infrastructure-as-code (Terraform), containerisation (Docker/k8s) and data pipelines (SQL, dbt, Airbyte)

  • Love automation, process improvement and finding ways to help others work efficiently

  • Are comfortable working autonomously and taking responsibility for the delivery of large technical projects

  • Are eager to learn from others and collaborative in helping others learn


Our interview process will cover:

  • An initial discussion (30-45 mins) for you to ask any questions you have about Count and for us to learn more about your experience and interests

  • A working session with two engineers (90-120 mins), where we'll dive into the stack and work with you through a technical challenge that we have faced recently

  • A final meeting with our founders (45-60 mins)

The working session and final meeting will take place either virtually or in London, depending on where you're based.


Life at Count

Count is a remote-first company. Most of our team is based in the UK and we use our office in London as base to meet and collaborate. However we believe great work can happen anywhere and weâ€™re happy to consider candidates from elsewhere in Europe.

Our work is important to us, and we know we work best when we actively maintain a good work-life balance. We're backed by some of Europe's best investors allowing us to offer a competitive employment package. Some of the benefits of working at Count include:

  • Competitive salary, pension and share options

  • Flexible working hours

  • 28 days of holiday (plus public holidays)

  • Private health care

  • Generous parental leave

  • An annual working from home allowance and co-working budget

  • Quarterly meetups with the team to relax and brainstorm, each time in a different city

We're committed to building a diverse team. Whatever your race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability, we want to hear from you.

title: Data Quality Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Data Quality Engineer to join our Data Engineering team. In this role, you will work alongside Data Engineers as the champion of data quality and quality engineering practices, ensuring high standards from ingestion to presentation across our data ecosystem.

Youâ€™ll take a hands-on role in the design, development, and scaling of automated data quality frameworks, contributing to improved data reliability, testing coverage, and observability across our pipelines and systems. You will work to shift quality left, embedding quality-focused thinking early in the development lifecycle, and foster a culture of shared quality ownership across teams.

Your day-to-day will involve validating data transformations and pipelines, developing tests to catch anomalies, monitoring and refining data taxonomy structures, identifying issues early, and collaborating with stakeholders to proactively improve data systems and processes.

Expected travelling time (UK and USA):: 0%-15%, varies according to project.

Requirements

What You'll Do:

  • Serve as the voice of data quality within the Data Engineering team.
  • Design and implement automated testing and alerting frameworks to monitor data pipelines.
  • Drive quality from data ingestion through to data presentation layers.
  • Collaborate with data engineers and stakeholders to ensure quality is built-in from the start.
  • Analyze complex datasets to identify inconsistencies, trends, and areas for improvement.
  • Enhance and maintain proprietary and standardized taxonomies.
  • Ensure performance and reliability across data systems and pipelines.
  • Promote and apply best practices for testing with data in mind across the broader engineering community.

What Weâ€™re Looking For:

5+ years of experience in Data Engineering or Data Quality Engineering roles in fast-paced environments.

Deep understanding of data flows, patterns, and common error sources in large-scale environments.

description:

title: Senior Recruiter
description:
About the role

We are seeking a Senior Recruiter to manage the complete recruitment lifecycle. This role requires expertise in sourcing, engaging, and placing top talent while building strong relationships with clients. The ideal candidate will have proven experience in full-desk recruiting, a deep understanding of recruitment strategies, and the ability to drive results in a remote environment.

Responsibilities:

  • Execute the full recruitment cycle, including sourcing, screening, interviewing, and onboarding candidates.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with clients, understanding their hiring needs and delivering tailored recruitment solutions.
  • Proactively source and engage passive and active candidates using various platforms, tools, and methods.
  • Manage a portfolio of job requisitions across different industries and job levels.
  • Present qualified candidates to clients with detailed summaries of their skills, experience, and suitability.
  • Coordinate and manage the interview process between clients and candidates, ensuring timely communication and feedback.
  • Negotiate offers and close candidates, ensuring alignment with client expectations and candidate career goals.
  • Track and document recruitment activity using an Applicant Tracking System (ATS) or similar tools.
  • Stay updated on industry trends, talent market conditions, and recruitment best practices.
  • Provide guidance to clients and candidates regarding market conditions, salary expectations, and hiring trends.

Required Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in full-desk recruiting, staffing, or talent acquisition.
  • Proficiency in Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and recruitment tools such as LinkedIn Recruiter, Indeed, and other sourcing platforms.
  • Demonstrated success in managing the full recruitment cycle, including sourcing, screening, and closing candidates.
  • Strong understanding of sourcing techniques, including Boolean searches and passive candidate outreach.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present candidates effectively.
  • Ability to thrive in a remote work environment and manage time efficiently.

Desired Qualifications:

  • Experience recruiting for specialized roles in industries such as technology, engineering, or healthcare.
  • Proven ability to manage high-volume recruitment while maintaining quality and candidate experience.
  • Knowledge of employment laws and compliance regulations related to hiring.
  • Experience working with CRMs or advanced recruitment automation tools.
  • Track record of building and maintaining long-term client relationships.

title: Implementation Subject Matter Expert
description:
Job Description

CSCI is seeking an Implementation Subject Matter Expert (SME) Â to provide specialized support, analysis, and research related to complex enterprise technology and business process challenges within a Federal or Department of Defense (DoD) environment. This role supports the successful implementation, sustainment, and enhancement of Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) systems and related enterprise tools. The SME will serve as a technical resource on executive-level project teams, providing expert guidance, interpreting requirements, and evaluating innovative solutions. This is a non-key, intermediate-level role ideal for candidates with strong Oracle EBS functional knowledge and proven experience supporting implementation and sustainment efforts within a shared services context.

Responsibilities
  • Provide subject matter expertise for the full lifecycle of Oracle EBS implementations, including planning, configuration, testing, and post-production support
  • Serve as a functional expert across Oracle EBS R12.2.5 or higher modules
  • Deliver advanced technical and functional support for implementation and sustainment efforts, using tools such as Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) and Oracle Enterprise Data Quality (EDQ)
  • Analyze and solve exceptionally complex functional and system-related problems with innovative, actionable solutions
  • Collaborate with executive-level stakeholders, technical teams, and cross-functional staff to interpret business needs and align them with IT capabilities
  • Contribute to the development of new methodologies, concepts, and standards that improve the delivery and performance of enterprise solutions
  • Act as a technical resource on major development and upgrade projects, ensuring compliance with DoD and federal business process standards
  • Communicate clearly and effectively through written reports, presentations, and technical documentation
Minimum Requirements
  • Minimum of four (4) years of experience supporting DoD or Federal Oracle shared service providers
  • Active Federal Secret Security Clearance
  • Demonstrated experience with Oracle E-Business Suite R12.2.5 or higher
  • Strong understanding of federal and DoD business processes
  • Experience with Oracle EDQ and ODI tools related to system implementation and sustainment
  • Ability to work independently, manage priorities, and contribute to long-term project goals
  • Creativity and adaptability in problem-solving
  • Ability to work with clients to understand their needs
  • Strong organizational and time-management skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Professional presence
Preferred Skills
  • Experience in a federal or DoD implementation environment
  • Knowledge of one or more IT domains such as enterprise architecture, systems integration, software development, security, or network systems
  • Functional expertise in finance, logistics, or operations research within a government context
  • Experience working in secure environments with sensitive data
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills for advising users and collaborating with IT teams
  • Knowledge of compliance standards related to data storage and access (e.g., HIPAA, FISMA, or similar)
  • Ability to work in a team environment, as well as independently
  • Strong customer and vendor relationship skills
  • Demonstrated ability to comply with data standards and policies
  • Motivation to learn new technologies and methodologies that demonstrate value
  • Past experience working with a federal agencyÂ 
  • Department of Defense experience is a plus!

At CSCI, work and fun arenâ€™t diametrically opposed!

At CSCI, our goal is to hire people with proven track records and retain them with an energizing, diverse company culture. CSCI seeks the best and brightest in the industryâ€”those who are ready to move their lives and career forward. Join us today and get excited about Mondays again!

Â

title: Senior Manager, Data Modernization
description:

title: Nocturnist Physician
description:
Included Health is looking for a remote nocturnist physician who enjoys management of all health conditions and who is passionate about raising the standard of healthcare for everyone. The Physician will care for patients of all ages, maintaining accurate and current patient records, and working collaboratively with our provider and support teams.

  • Request consultation or referral with other health care providers

title: Senior Medical Economics Manager
description:
About TailorCare

TailorCare is transforming the experience of specialty care. Our comprehensive care program takes a profoundly personal, evidence-based approach to improving patient outcomes for joint, back, and muscle conditions. By carefully assessing patients' symptoms, health histories, preferences, and goals with predictive data and the latest evidence-based guidelines, we help patients chooseâ€”and navigateâ€”the most effective treatment pathway for them every step of the way.

TailorCare values the experiences and perspectives of individuals from all backgrounds. We are a highly collaborative, curious, and determined team passionate about scaling a high-growth start-up to improve the lives of those in pain. TailorCare is a remote-first company with our corporate office located in Nashville.Â 

About the Role

Weâ€™re looking for a Senior Medical Economics Manager to lead high-impact, exploratory analytics that help shape how care navigation improves clinical outcomes and reduces medical costs. This is a hands-on, highly collaborative role where youâ€™ll partner directly with Clinical and Operations leadership to uncover opportunities to improve care quality, patient outcomes and cost of care.

Youâ€™ll bring deep experience working with healthcare dataâ€”especially claims, clinical and operational data â€” and a passion for surfacing insights that drive strategic decision-making in a value-based care environment. Your work will help define and evaluate episodes of care, analyze provider-level outcomes, and identify patient cohorts, engagement channels and care pathways that help create personalized care navigation strategies.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Partner cross-functionally with clinical, actuarial, growth, finance, and operations teams to evaluate medical cost management initiatives and optimize population health efforts.
  • Lead cohort and episode-level analyses to assess patient journeys, treatment variation, and care outcomes over time.
  • Develop provider performance profiles to identify high-value partners and opportunities for clinical improvement.
  • Analyze claims, operational, and third-party data to track cost and utilization trends, surface actionable insights, and evaluate program impact.
  • Build models and frameworks to segment patients, predict engagement and outcomes, and support personalized care navigation strategies.
  • Create metrics, analyses, reports and dashboards that make complex insights accessible and actionable to both internal stakeholders and external partners.
  • Support value based care contract performance analysis and reporting efforts
  • Work closely with leadership to support strategic initiatives and communicate findings to potential customers, payers, and investors.
  • Contribute to building a data-driven culture and help scale analytics best practices in a high-growth, early-stage environment.

Qualifications

  • 10+ years of experience in healthcare analytics, preferably in value-based care, health tech, or payer/provider settings.
  • Strong understanding of medical claims data, healthcare utilization patterns, and cost drivers.
  • Proven experience with cohort analysis, episodes of care, and provider-specific outcomes measurement.
  • Skilled in SQL and fluent in at least one analytics or statistical tool (Python, R, etc.).
  • Experience collaborating directly with Engagement, Clinical and Operations teamsâ€”you know how to translate data into action.
  • Comfort working in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment, with the ability to self-direct and prioritize.
    Strong communicator with the ability to explain complex concepts clearly to non-technical audiences.
  • Bachelor's degree in business analytics, economics, statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, public health, health informatics, healthcare administration, finance or related field or equivalent experience
  • Masterâ€™s degree preferredÂ 

SkillsÂ 

  • Background in MSK, specialty care, or population health.
  • Experience supporting payer relationships or demonstrating value to external stakeholders.
  • Familiarity with risk adjustment, value-based payment models, or care pathway analytics.

What's In It For You

  • Meaningful Work: We are dedicated to our mission and deeply value our patients and each other. Each day offers the opportunity to make a positive impact.
  • Work Environment: We operate as a remote-first company with options for a hybrid work model in Nashville.
  • Time Off: Our generous paid time off (PTO) and holiday plans ensure you have ample time to rest and recharge.
  • Family First: We offer paid parental leave and support a healthy work-life balance, encouraging flexibility and autonomy. We love talking about our family and pets!Â 
  • Comprehensive Benefits: From Day 1, employees enjoy medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance, wellness resources and an employer HSA contribution.
  • Fair Compensation: We are committed to equitable pay for all team members and support your future goals with a 401k plan that includes employer matching.
  • Community: We foster an inclusive environment where you can rely on your teammates, share honest feedback, and feel comfortable being your authentic self at work each day.Â 

TailorCare seeks to recruit and retain staff from diverse backgrounds and encourages qualified candidates to apply. TailorCare is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, color, race, creed, national origin, ancestry, religion, marital status, political belief, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, military, or veteran status.

title: SEO Blog Writer
description:
We're seeking a fun, creative, and SEO-savvy blog writer to produce engaging, search-optimized content in the dating and lifestyle space. You'll work directly with the client to refresh outdated blogs, write new pieces, and help maintain consistent content updates across a large portfolio of city landing pages. The ideal candidate understands SEO deeply and can write in a voice that's witty, cheeky, flirty, and on-brand for dating audiences.

This role is perfect for someone who has experience writing for sites like Bustle, AskMen, or Elite Dailyâ€”or someone who can match that tone effortlessly. You'll have flexibility to suggest topics based on search volume and write content that boosts visibility and traffic for a well-established matchmaking website.

Scope and Duration
  • 20hrs/month, possibility to increase
  • 6 month contract
Responsibilities
  • Write 1+ SEO-optimized blog per week (approx. 1,000 words each)
  • Refresh and rewrite existing blogs to align with SEO best practices and recent Google updates
  • Create compelling, relevant content for 20+ city-specific landing pages
  • Pitch timely and high-volume keyword-driven content ideas (e.g., "5 Date Night Ideas in [City]")
  • Optimize content structure, including titles, headers, and metadata
  • Collaborate with the client to match tone and voice; adapt to informal but polished dating/lifestyle writing
  • Write a downloadable booklet
  • Optionally create LinkedIn captions for blog posts or company updates

Must-Have Qualifications
  • Strong knowledge of SEO content writing (including on-page optimization and refreshing strategy)
  • Proven experience writing in a conversational, playful tone (dating/lifestyle focus preferred)
  • Ability to pitch and validate topics using keyword research tools (e.g., Ubersuggest, SEMrush, or Google Keyword Planner)
  • Comfortable with light editorial direction and able to work independently with minimal oversight
  • U.S.-based and able to communicate during business hours when needed
  • Ability to work quickly and meet deadlines.

Preferred Qualifications
  • Past work with dating or relationship blogs
  • Experience writing for media sites like Bustle, AskMen, Elite Daily, etc.
  • Familiarity with AI tools and ability to prompt effectively (a plus, not required)
  • Comfortable with quick onboarding and potentially scaling hours as needed

About Our Client

Our client runs a premium matchmaking and dating service based in Washington, D.C., with a nationwide reach. She specializes in connecting selective singles and building an engaging online presence through SEO-driven content. Known for her energetic, candid style, she seeks a writer who can produce playful, witty, and search-optimized blogs and landing pages. The writer will collaborate directly with a knowledgeable client who values creativity, fresh ideas, and consistent quality.

title: Quality Engineer
description:
Company Description

Whether youâ€™re working from home or on your way to the office, chances are youâ€™re probably reading this because youâ€™re seeking a new adventure, or youâ€™re up for a new challenge. GROW Inc might just be that for you!Â 

So, who is GROW Inc?Â 
Founded in 2016, weâ€™re the Australian FinTech success story you probably havenâ€™t heard about. Weâ€™re solving big problems in the Superannuation and Managed Funds industry. The administration platforms (the software that tracks everything to do with your super) are built on things you or your parents would recognise from the glory days of 90â€™s computing.

How are we doing it?
Weâ€™re solving this by disrupting the wealth management industry with DLTA, our platform built on Distributed Ledger Technology which improves the financial wellbeing of Australians. Weâ€™re making Super more timely and information more accessible whilst enabling wealth management companies to offer more cost effective solutions.

Weâ€™re rebels with a cause. Weâ€™re authentic, diverse, and embrace our differences as we continue to put a dent in the universe. We know diversity of thought helps us to build better solutions for our customers which is why we encourage the entire GROW team to bring their whole selves to work each and every day.Â 



Job Description

Engineering @ Grow Inc.

We are passionate technologists with an appreciation for clean code and fault tolerant systems. Our team is distributed across Australia and the Philippines, with engineers collaborating across regions. We believe in leveraging different perspectives and backgrounds because that makes our team and product stronger.

We look for teammates who are:

  • Curious and aim to understand things deeply.

  • Advocates for best practice.

  • Respectful and inclusive.

  • Comfortable sharing the grunt work.

What you will do

  • Use a data driven approach to:

    • Decide what needs to be manual vs automated.

    • Improve our QA process and practices.

  • Build and own self-service testing platforms and tools to empower teams to test their code effectively and efficiently. E.g. frameworks for functional, performance, and resilience testing.

  • Augment engineering teams and help them uplift their quality practices using the frameworks you build.

  • Write clean code, perform code reviews and produce documentation.

  • Advocate for and implement CI/CD practices that integrate quality checks into every stage of the software delivery pipeline.

  • Drive a shift-left approach by embedding quality practices early in the development lifecycle, enabling faster feedback and reducing defects downstream.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify test scenarios and acceptance criteria that align with the quality strategy.

  • Drive operational excellence by contributing to run books, incident response protocols, and reliability improvement initiatives.

  • Proactively identify opportunities to improve our software engineering practices.

  • Foster a culture of collaboration and knowledge across product, design and engineering.



Qualifications

  • A healthy curiosity, autonomy and a strong sense of accountability.

  • Strong desire to perform and grow as an engineer.

  • Demonstrated technical initiative and a penchant for clean code.

  • 4+ years of experience of testing complex applications.

  • Fluency in a modern programming language. We use Typescript.

  • Strong experience in test automation of UI using frameworks like Playwright (or similar).

  • Strong experience in test automation of API and Event driven services.

  • Strong experience with modern CI/CD processes and related tools like BuildKite.

  • Good knowledge of:

    • Cloud architecture principles.

    • Microservices and resiliency patterns.

  • Experience with performance testing tools like k6, Artillery or Gatling.

  • Experience working with AWS.

  • Experience working with databases (SQL or NoSQL).

  • Experience working with containerisation tools such as Docker.

  • Experience working with observability tools like Elastic or Sentry.

  • Experience working with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform.

Nice to have

  • Experience with performance testing of web applications.

  • Experience with Chaos Engineering.

If you think you have what it takes but donâ€™t meet every point described above, please still apply! Weâ€™d love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.



Additional Information

Why youâ€™ll love working at GROW

  • ME Days - Take an additional 3 days of leave off per year for wellness!

title: Senior Compensation Consultant
description:
About the Team

The Compensation team designs and manages programs to motivate and retain top talent and enable our Pay for Performance philosophy. Our work impacts every employee globally through the programs we administer. As part of the Total Rewards function, the Global Compensation team strives to provide a consistent and inclusive experience for all DoorDash employees, regardless of their location, background, or job responsibility.

The Compensation Consultant will play a key role in the development, implementation, and management of DoorDash's compensation strategy to help us shape our future. You will provide leadership in scaling compensation programs for one of our core business areas, and contribute to the development of initiatives for the unique employee populations on these teams. Youâ€™re excited about this opportunity becauseâ€¦

  • You will identify opportunities to leverage AI and machine learning applications to improve and find efficiencies in compensation processesÂ

Weâ€™re excited about you becauseâ€¦

We expect this position to be filled by 7/1/2025.

title: Local Finance Officer
description:
PayDo, a leading Electronic Money Institution (EMI) authorised by the FCA in the UK, FINTRAC in Canada, and MFSA in Malta, operates in 140 countries and over 25 industries. Offering multicurrency IBANs, merchant solutions, and mass payment options, PayDo provides premium and convenient payment services. With all features available through one platform and contract, PayDo is a preferred solution for local and international payments.Â 

Â 

We're thrilled to be expanding our operations into a new market, having recently received a Maltese licence. Education

  • A Masterâ€™s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field is preferred

What's In It For You
At PayDo, specialists are at the heart of our innovation and success. Joining our team means accessing unparalleled opportunities to grow, contribute, and thrive in a dynamic FinTech environment.

  • Empowerment Through Professional Development:
    • Monthly investment in your English learning

  • Unlock Your Potential:

Our Values:
At PayDo, we live by principles that drive us to excellence:

  • Ownership & Initiative: Specialists who take charge and make a difference
  • Collaboration & Communication: Together, we achieve more by sharing ideas and insights

Become part of a global team redefining FinTech. Your expertise, passion, and ideas will shape the future of payments with PayDo!

title: Site Reliability Engineer

title: Senior Systems Administrator
description:
Cority is the global enterprise EHS software provider creating industry-leading technology to empower those who transform the way the world works.
Â 
For over 35 years, Cority has been powered by the spirit of innovation, deep domain expertise, and a commitment to integrity that enables higher levels of operational and sustainable performance with the most comprehensive, human-centered, and secure SaaS platform to help workers and businesses thrive in 100 countries around the world.
Â 
The company enjoys the industryâ€™s highest levels of client satisfaction and has received many awards for its strong employee culture and outstanding business performance. To learn more, visit www.cority.com.

WHATâ€™S IN IT FOR YOU?
Â 
At Cority, we keep abreast of the changing labour market to ensure that our employees are paid based fairly and equitably based on their skills, years of experience, education and functional experience. Employee health and well-being are at the core of what we do. Competitive health benefits, dental plans, fitness allowance, health care spending account, retirement savings plan, work from home, as well as subsidized internet provide employees and their families support and flexibility.
Â 
We pride ourselves on our values-driven, performance oriented, dynamic and growth focused culture. The leadership team strives to create a meaningful work experience for employees through challenging work projects and employee recognition. Our HR team ensures our employees have opportunities to get social through corporate volunteering and social happy hours both in office and virtually.
Â 
Job enrichment, employee development and career planning are our priority. Cority ensures that employees have their skills and certifications up-to-date with our annual training allowance. Internal Recruitment, Departmental Conferences, Group Training Programs, and High Talent Programs are some of the ways that we hone skills and grow talent within the company.

Position Summary:
As part of the Production Engineering team, the Senior Systems Administrator administers and maintains customer-facing SaaS infrastructure including services running in both public cloud and datacentre environments. You will provide support, troubleshooting, and management expertise for our growing application platforms while working closely with developers, DBAs, and other internal teams to ensure that the system is stable, secure and scaling to meet demand. You will work on platform migrations, recommend and implement upgrades, improve our current processes, and introduce new technology.
Â 
You have administered Windows Server in the datacentre or cloud, been responsible for SaaS applications, and are familiar with a variety of compute and infrastructure services including AWS, Azure, IIS, SFTP, SMTP, VMware, load balancers, firewalls, database servers, and related technologies. With an automation mindset, you default to building automated processes to replace repetitive manual work and ensure predictable, repeatable outcomes. Youâ€™ve worked primarily with Windows Server but may have some experience with Linux too. You will help ensure the smooth operation of our production environments, contribute to our continuing improvement, and assist in architecting our platforms. You possess excellent communication, teamwork, and interpersonal skills.Â 


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Ensure critical systems are available 24x7x365
  • Deploy, administer, and troubleshoot SaaS applications, primarily running on Windows servers
  • Deploy new services and infrastructure to AWS, Azure, and datacentres
  • Automate manual processes
  • Work with the DBA team to ensure that database servers are stable and secure
  • Proactively monitor application and infrastructure performance; recommend and implement additional resources as needed
  • Contribute to and extend our Infrastructure as Code to perform resource creation and management across our environments
  • Ensure that regular operational hygiene tasks are performed on schedule, including patching, automated backups, certificate renewals, and security reviews.
  • Develop secure deployment and configuration guides as new technology is implemented.
  • Monitor and enforce compliance with Cority internal information security controls.
  • Assist with internal audits and other information security related tasks
  • Enable more efficient and smarter business processes and implement analytics for meaningful insights


    • COMPETENCIES AND TECHNICAL SKILLS:
  • 5 years of hands-on experience in design, implementation, configuration, and support of production Windows workloads, including SaaS applications
  • In-depth knowledge of the Windows server operating system, including Internet-facing IIS workloads
  • Proven experience with automating manual processes
  • Experience with observability and APM tools like ELK, New Relic, or Datadog
  • In-depth understanding of application scalability, performance and reliability
  • Familiarity with VMware or other virtualization technologies
  • Good understanding of TCP/IP networking and common Internet-facing services
  • Some experience administering MS SQL Server, PostgreSQL, or other database platforms
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure or AWS
  • Practical experience with Linux
  • Excellent problem-solving skills to troubleshoot and resolve server related issues
  • Excellent written and verbal communications skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Ability to work independently as well as within a team
  • Strong time management skills and attention to detail in documentation
  • Experience with containerized applications would be an asset
  • Note: Incumbent will work regular business hours, but may require evenings and weekends to complete projects, monitor system/network alerts or perform maintenance on systems.


    • EDUCATION and PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATIONS:
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in IT, Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent experience required.
  • Azure, AWS, or VMware certifications are desirable but not required.

    • Cority is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. Cority is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, nationality, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, age, disability or any other legally protected status. For applicants who would like to request for accommodation please send an email to hr@cority.com.

title: DevOps Engineer Identity Management
description:

  • Excellent pension plan: 23% total contribution, with KPN covering 16% and you contributing 7%

Ready to Make an Impact?

We believe in the power of technology, especially combined with human connection. Thatâ€™s why we would love to meet you!

Please note; for this role we do not consider candidates based outside of the Netherlands.

title: MLOps Engineer
description:

Itâ€™s no wonder that the values that inspire and drive our #CognigyCrew are our 4Ts - Team, Trust, Transparency, Technology.


Your new role â€“ MLOps Engineer

Location: On-site in DÃ¼sseldorf or remote in Germany

We are looking for a skilled and ambitious MLOps Engineer to join our Engineering team and take ownership of building and operating scalable, secure infrastructure for Large Language Models (LLMs). You will support our Machine Learning, Product, and SRE teams in deploying and maintaining production-grade AI workloads on Kubernetes using cutting-edge technologies like KubeRay.

Youâ€™ll help ensure optimal performance, reliability, observability, and cost-efficiency of Cognigyâ€™s AI infrastructure, automating processes and championing modern MLOps best practices.


Your responsibilities will include

  • Build & Operate LLM Infrastructure â€“ Design and maintain scalable LLM-serving systems using Kubernetes and KubeRay.
  • Automate & Optimize â€“ Automate deployments, rollbacks, and scaling of LLMs while optimizing resource usage and performance.
  • Enhance Observability â€“ Ensure robust monitoring, logging, and alerting for LLM operations (Prometheus, Grafana, etc.).
  • Support AI Teams â€“ Empower ML and product engineers with self-service pipelines and scalable infrastructure.
  • Prioritize Security â€“ Enforce secure deployments, compliance practices, and robust incident response strategies.
  • Improve Documentation â€“ Create and maintain technical documentation to streamline knowledge sharing and onboarding.
  • Drive Innovation â€“ Evaluate, adopt, and integrate the latest MLOps and LLM-serving technologies.
  • Reduce SRE Toil â€“ Eliminate repetitive tasks and improve operational efficiency across the platform.

Growth Potential

At Cognigy we are committed to your professional growth. This role offers significant opportunities for career development, including access to ongoing training, and involvement in high-impact projects allowing you to showcase and advance your unique skills and experience.

Requirements

About you
  • Hands-on experience running production ML or LLM workloads in Kubernetes
  • Familiarity with distributed ML frameworks such as KubeRay, Ray Serve, or similar
  • Deep understanding of Kubernetes internals, especially GPU scheduling, autoscaling, and multi-tenant environments
  • Proficiency with CI/CD systems for ML models, and versioned deployment strategies
  • Strong experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure), networking, and security best practices
  • Skilled in monitoring and observability for ML workloads (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana)
  • Passion for automation, performance tuning, and cost optimization for LLM workloads
  • Clear communicator and proactive team player who thrives in fast-paced, cross-functional environments
  • MLOps or DevOps certifications (nice to have)

Benefits

Life at Cognigy - What we offer you

We are an ambitious andâ€¯international tech company with aâ€¯great culture,â€¯and we make sure that everyone feels welcome. Our excellent benefits make us a fantastic place to work - these include

  • Company Pension Scheme
  • 25 days paid leave, plus 5 floating days, plus public holidays

  • One paid â€˜Giving Back Day' each year, so you can volunteer for a charity or community activity of your choice

Â 

Equal Opportunity Employer Statement - Cognigy does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

title: Senior Product Manager - In-Vehicle Experience
description:
Who we are

Samsara (NYSE: IOT) is the pioneer of the Connected Operationsâ„¢ Cloud, which is a platform that enables organizations that depend on physical operations to harness Internet of Things (IoT) data to develop actionable insights and improve their operations. At Samsara, we are helping improve the safety, efficiency and sustainability of the physical operations that power our global economy. Representing more than 40% of global GDP, these industries are the infrastructure of our planet, including agriculture, construction, field services, transportation, and manufacturing â€” and we are excited to help digitally transform their operations at scale.

Working at Samsara means youâ€™ll help define the future of physical operations and be on a team thatâ€™s shaping an exciting array of product solutions, including Video-Based Safety, Vehicle Telematics, Apps and Driver Workflows, Equipment Monitoring, and Site Visibility. As part of a recently public company, youâ€™ll have the autonomy and support to make an impact as we build for the long term.

About the role:

The Safety team at Samsara is the anchor point from which we have built a great business extending AI into physical operations. We build intelligent systems that combine computer vision, sensor data, road context, and behavioral patterns to detect risk and prevent accidents before they happen for some of the largest fleets in the world.Â 

In this role, youâ€™ll be leading our in-vehicle experience. Drivers face an increasing amount of challenges on the road, and itâ€™s our job to help them stay safe. We do this by analyzing everything that happens on the road and then alerting drivers to any dangers we can detect in real-time. This will be your job, to take the driver experience and safety to the very next level!

This is a remote position open to candidates based in the US. Relocation assistance will not be provided for this role.Â 

You should apply if:

  • You want to impact the industries that run our world: Your efforts will result in real-world impactâ€”helping to keep the lights on, get food into grocery stores, reduce emissions, and most importantly, ensure workers return home safely.
  • You are the architect of your own career: If you put in the work, this role wonâ€™t be your last at Samsara. We set up our employees for success and have built a culture that encourages rapid career development, countless opportunities to experiment and master your craft in a hyper growth environment.
  • Youâ€™re energized by our opportunity: The vision we have to digitize large sectors of the global economy requires your full focus and best efforts to bring forth creative, ambitious ideas for our customers.
  • You want to be with the best: At Samsara, we win together, celebrate together and support each other. You will be surrounded by a high-calibre team that will encourage you to do your best.
In this role, you will:Â 
  • Own the strategy, roadmap, and execution of the In-Vehicle Experience product area, balancing speed of delivery with long-term value.
  • Work with our talented engineering teams to launch new products to help drive a fast-growing, at-scale business with $1 Billion+ in ARR.
