  • Lead by example in using AI tools to accelerate product development, customer research, and decision-making.
  • Partner with our Sales team to help close strategic customer accounts as needed.
  • Champion, role model, and embed Samsaraâ€™s cultural principles (Focus on Customer Success, Build for the Long Term, Adopt a Growth Mindset, Be Inclusive, Win as a Team) as we scale globally and across new offices

Minimum requirements for the role:

  • 8+ years of product management experience or other relevant experience, with a proven track record of launching 0-to-1 products and driving business outcomes.
  • Strong B2B SaaS background, with experience working directly with enterprise customers.
  • Hands-on approach, with the ability to dive into details, from defining features to demoing products and supporting sales.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, with a knack for simplifying complex problems and focusing on customer impact.
  • Technical aptitude, with the ability to work closely with technical teams and understand how to deliver high-quality solutions.
  • Strong ownership mentality, with a willingness to go above and beyond to deliver exceptional results.
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to present ideas clearly to customers and internal teams.
  • Strong business acumen.

An ideal candidate also has:

  • Technical background, such as a degree in engineering, computer science, or related fields.
  • Experience with hardware and software product development, particularly in safety-focused domains.
  • Knowledge of industries such as transportation, logistics, or industrial operations.
  • Proven ability to manage pricing, revenue accountability, and go-to-market strategy for new products.
  • Entrepreneurial experience or background in high-growth environments.
The range of annual base salary for full-time employees for this position is below. Please note that base pay offered may vary depending on factors including your city of residence, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
$127,925â€”$215,000 USD

At Samsara, we welcome everyone regardless of their background. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, and other characteristics protected by law. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems and want to ensure that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

Benefits

Full time employees receive a competitive total compensation package along with employee-led remote and flexible working, health benefits, Samsara for Good charity fund, and much, much more. Take a look at ourÂ Benefits site to learn more.

AccommodationsÂ 

Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please email accessibleinterviewing@samsara.com or click here if you require any reasonable accommodations throughout the recruiting process.

Flexible WorkingÂ 

At Samsara, we embrace a flexible working model that caters to the diverse needs of our teams. Our offices are open for those who prefer to work in-person and we also support remote work where it aligns with our operational requirements. For certain positions, being close to one of our offices or within a specific geographic area is important to facilitate collaboration, access to resources, or alignment with our service regions. In these cases, the job description will clearly indicate any working location requirements. Our goal is to ensure that all members of our team can contribute effectively, whether they are working on-site, in a hybrid model, or fully remotely. All offers of employment are contingent upon an individualâ€™s ability to secure and maintain the legal right to work at the company and in the specified work location, if applicable.

Fraudulent Employment Offers

Samsara is aware of scams involving fake job interviews and offers. Please know we do not charge fees to applicants at any stage of the hiring process. Official communication about your application will only come from emails ending in â€˜@samsara.comâ€™ or â€˜@us-greenhouse-mail.ioâ€™. For more information regarding fraudulent employment offers, please visit our blog post here.

title: Senior Angular Frontend Developer
description:
Company Description

MyTime is a fully integrated scheduling, payments, and automated marketing platform, specializing in large multi-location chains and franchises. Our mission critical software -- which includes in-store scheduling and online booking, client record management, email and SMS marketing, and a full point of sale for handling payments -- is used in every aspect of the customer journey. Our customers rely on their service businesses to remain competitive in the age of Amazon, and they need a next generation POS to help them achieve this growth. We aspire to be the â€œoperating systemâ€ of their business.

We also made it easy to plug our online booking, payments and messaging capabilities into the places customers are found today, including Google Search, Facebook, Instagram, and the merchantsâ€™ own websites and mobile apps. Upon adopting MyTime, our customers see average revenue growth of up to 30% through improved operational efficiency, greater customer retention, and access to new customer acquisition channels.

Our product is used at over 14,000 locations across the globe, ranging from single-location sole proprietors to multi-billion dollar Fortune 500 chains. As a completely cloud-based solution, MyTime is designed for quick and easy deployments. Itâ€™s lauded for its ease-of-use and short ramp-up time, having won numerous awards such as the Best Commerce Product of 2017 from the Local Search Association.

Youâ€™ll also help in other aspects of building a new company: Designing features, making good product decisions, and building a culture of excellence. While we work independently, we support each other through frequent code and design reviews, daily stand-ups, and pair programming which facilitates learning and reducing friction in our nightly release schedule. Responsibilities:

  • Motivate and educate team members on coding standards and best practicesÂ both within the team and as part of the architecture group.



Qualifications
  • 5+ years of Angular experience, including Angular.js and Angular2+

  • Comfortable writing frontend unit tests

  • Detail oriented and conscientious in implementing designs
  • Self motivator with strong communication skills
  • Degree in computer science or a related field is preferred, but not required
  • While not mandatory, having experience with CoffeeScript and webpack is preferred.
  • Experience with Bootstrap orÂ Tailwindcss is a bonus.


Additional Information

MyTime is an incredible place to work and grow your expertise!Â  We provideÂ a competitive base salary, performance bonus, startup equity, and healthcare benefits.Â  We offer a transparent and exciting startup culture that is singularly focused on empowering people to make an impact in their jobs. Weâ€™re growing fast and solving a big problem, providing our employees the opportunity to make the tremendous impact that leads to true professional fulfilment. If you're interested, we'd love to talk!
salary: competitive base salary, performance bonus, startup equity

title: Recruitment Coordinator
description:
Job Title: Recruitment Coordinator
Position Type: Contract, Full-Time, Remote
Working Hours: 4pm to 1am PKT

About Pavago:

Pavago is looking for a Recruitment Coordinator, where you will be an integral part of our HR team, supporting recruitment efforts across various clients. You will manage candidate communication, scheduling, and ensure a streamlined hiring process using tools like Workable and Asana.

Responsibilities:

  • Candidate Management: Schedule and coordinate candidate interviews. Communicate professionally and promptly with candidates throughout the hiring process.
  • Recruitment Operations: Assist in job posting on relevant platforms and sourcing potential candidates. Maintain our applicant tracking system (ATS) to ensure accurate candidate records.
  • Onboarding Support: Collaborate with HR and hiring managers to facilitate smooth onboarding processes for new hires. Prepare and distribute onboarding materials and conduct orientation sessions as needed.
  • Administrative Support: Handle administrative tasks such as processing expense reimbursements and maintaining recruitment-related documentation.

What Makes You a Perfect Fit:

  • Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with a strong ability to engage with candidates and internal stakeholders.
  • Organization: Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail to manage multiple tasks efficiently.
  • Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and adjust priorities as needed.
  • Team Player: Collaborative mindset with a willingness to assist team members and contribute to a positive work culture.
  • Proactive: Take initiative in problem-solving and identifying opportunities to improve recruitment processes.
  • Empathy: Demonstrate understanding and empathy towards candidates, ensuring a positive candidate experience throughout the recruitment journey.

.

Required Experience & Skills:

  • Industry Background: Experience in a recruitment agency setting is highly valued. Familiarity with the fast-paced nature of agency recruitment and the ability to handle multiple client demands concurrently is advantageous. However, experience in corporate HR departments or related fields will also be considered.
  • Experience Level: Minimum 1 year of experience in a recruiting coordinator or similar role, preferably within a recruitment agency or corporate HR environment. Familiarity with using ATS/HRIS systems such as Workable, Asana, or similar platforms to manage recruitment processes.
  • Technical Expertise: Proficiency in utilizing recruitment software and tools like Workable, Asana, or other ATS/HRIS systems. Basic understanding of HR metrics and reporting related to recruitment activities. Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies and software updates relevant to the recruitment function.

Interview Process:

  • Initial Phone Call: Engage in a brief conversation to understand your experience and suitability for the role.
  • Video Interview: Delve deeper into your professional background and assess your skills in a 30-minute call.
  • Practical Assessment: Showcase your creative abilities through practical tasks relevant to the role.
  • Final Interview: Have a comprehensive discussion with our client to ensure mutual alignment.
  • Background Checks: Conduct swift verification of your references and past employment details.

What Does a Typical Day Look Like?

In the role of Recruitment Coordinator, each day is a proactive orchestration of talent acquisition activities. Beginning with meticulous scheduling of interviews and managing candidate communications, they ensure a smooth and organized recruitment process. They collaborate closely with hiring managers to understand staffing needs, source qualified candidates, and maintain ATS records accurately. Continuously optimizing job postings and candidate sourcing strategies, they enhance recruitment efficiency and candidate quality. Their dedication to detail and candidate experience fosters a streamlined hiring process and supports the company's growth objectives.

Ready to Apply?

If you thrive in a fast-paced recruiting environment and are dedicated to streamlining hiring processes while ensuring exceptional candidate experiences, we invite you to join our team and contribute to our growth and success in talent acquisition.



About the company

At Pavago, we redefine the boundaries of talent recruitment. Dive into a world where your geographical location doesn't restrict your career aspirations. As a distinguished international recruitment agency, we specialize in connecting remote talents with companies eager to tap into global expertise.

ğŸŒŸ Why Consider Opportunities Through Pavago?

Competitive Pay: Command the salary you deserve, regardless of where you reside.

Broad Horizons: Unlock a wide array of remote positions spanning diverse industries and regions.

Skill Enrichment: Work alongside international teams, contribute your unique insights, and amplify your career trajectory.


Whether you're a seasoned professional hunting for a novel global venture or a budding talent keen on leaving an international imprint, Pavago is your conduit to businesses that appreciate and seek out worldwide perspectives.

Embrace a realm where opportunities transcend borders. Together, let's pioneer the next era of remote work. ğŸš€

Explore global opportunities with us today!"

title: Operations - Special Projects Manager

About the company

Skylight is a technology startup based out of Los Angeles and San Francisco. Our mission is to make technology that brings families together. We think often about the millions of smiles we are able to put on our customersâ€™ faces each day, and it fills our hearts with purpose. title: Senior Solutions Delivery Manager
description:
At Amperity, our AI-powered Customer Data Cloud empowers organizations to delight their customers and create differentiated experiences. About You

title: Head of Channel & Strategy Operations
description:
Maven is the world's largest virtual clinic for women and families on a mission to make healthcare work for all of us. Maven's award-winning digital programs provide clinical, emotional, and financial support all in one platform, spanning fertility & family building, maternity & newborn care, parenting & pediatrics, and menopause & midlife. To learn more about Maven, visit us at mavenclinic.com.Â

The Head of Channel Strategy & Operations is a senior member of the Channel Growth team and reports to the Chief Commercial Officer.Â  You will be critical in efficiently driving growth through Mavenâ€™s commercial agreements with Health Plans, PBMs, and other channel partners while building out scalable processes to ensure the Channel Growth team runs effectively to drive increased revenue and profitability. Your scope will include ownership over the teamâ€™s core day-to-day functioning, performance tracking and management, channel enrollments, and the delivery of our contractual obligations to our payer partners.

As Head of Channel Strategy & Operations, you will:

  • Develop and execute against a scaled channel service models varied by type of partnership that drive increased revenue generation and higher operating margins
  • Report on key financial and operational metrics at the aggregate and individual channel levels, so that internal teams and executives at Maven understand the health of each channel partnership, including ownership of the channel steering committee
  • Oversee channel enrollments across all lines of business with support from the Channel, Client Success, Marketing, and Product teams
  • Partner with internal channel leaders and other internal stakeholders to identify, develop actions, and project manage improvement strategies for under performing channelsÂ 
  • Establish cross-channel operations, pricing, and contracting strategies, including but not limited to enrollment marketing related obligations, performance guarantees, and product related integrations
  • Ensure Maven is meeting its contractual obligations, working with teams to deliver on performance guarantees, SLA reporting, and other commitments
  • Scope and define adjacent partner relationships in categories like healthcare experience, brokers & consultants, and similar
  • Act as the primary point of contact to other Growth functions as well as Product, Engineering, Clinical, and Operations for market insight translation, non-standard projects and integrations, and channel team support needs
  • Ensure knowledge transfer and standardization across channel growth team members by maintaining and training on account management functions
  • Partner with the Product Marketing team to establish and maintain library of channel marketing materials and RFP responses

Weâ€™re looking for you to bring:

  • 10+ years relevant experience that includes
    • Experience working for or with health plans or PBMsÂ 
    • A track record of working with high-performing Growth teams
    • Building and scaling systems and processes in high-growth, fast-paced, high-performing environments
    • Demonstrated ability to develop meaningful cross-functional relationshipsÂ 
  • Is a strong executive communicator, partner and teammate
  • Is effective at navigating ambiguity and leading through change

Preferred candidates have:

  • Operationalized complex partnerships in the payer and/or provider spaces, including benefit administration
  • Experience across multiple areas of the healthcare continuum (e.g. provider, value-based care, digital health)
  • Startup experienceÂ 

For candidates in NYC, CO, or CA, the base salary range for this role is $200,000 - $240,000 per year. You will also be entitled to receive stock options and benefits. Individual pay decisions are based on a number of factors, including qualifications for the role, experience level, and skillset.

Maven embraces a flexible hybrid work model. This role is open to candidates based in the New York Metropolitan area, or remote from within the US. For those in our New York City office, we encourage in-person collaboration by requiring team members to work onsite three days a week (Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday). This policy aims to balance remote work flexibility with the benefits of face-to-face interaction.

This role requires active work authorization in the US.

At Maven we believe that a diverse set of backgrounds and experiences enrich our teams and allow us to achieve above and beyond our goals. If you do not have experience in all of the areas detailed above, we hope that you will share your unique background with us in your application and how it can be additive to our teams.Â 

Benefits That Work For You

Our benefits are designed to support your health, well-being and career development, helping you thrive both personally and professionally. We remain focused on providing a competitive benefits package for our employees. On top of standards such as employer-covered health, dental, and insurance plan options, we offer an inclusive approach to benefits:

  • Maven for Mavens: access to the full platform and specialists, including care for mental health, reproductive health, family planning and pediatrics.

  • Annual professional development stipend and access to a personal career coach through Maven for Mavens
  • 401K matching for US-based employees, with immediate vesting

These benefits are applicable to Maven Clinic Co., US-based, full-time employees only. 1099/Contract Providers are ineligible for these benefits.Â 

Maven is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information. title: Director, Builder Sales
description:
Our MissionÂ Â 
SPAN is enabling electrification for all âš¡

We are a mission-driven company designing, building, and deploying products that electrify the built environment, reduce carbon emissions, and slow the effects of climate change.

  • Decarbonization is the process to reduce or remove greenhouse gas emissions, especially carbon dioxide, from entering our atmosphere.

  • Electrification is the process of replacing fossil fuel appliances that run on gas or oil with all-electric upgrades for a cleaner way to power our lives.

At SPAN, we believe in:

  • Enabling homes and vehicles powered by clean energy

  • Making electrification upgrades possible

  • Building more resilient homes with reliable backup

  • Designing a flexible and distributed electrical grid

The RoleÂ

Building a new home is the perfect time to include SPAN in the project and can increase home value and sellability for home builders. We are looking for someone with leadership, passion, and experience selling to national and regional builders. This role will sit within the Builder Channel and benefit from the demand generation and sales efforts across the new home construction ecosystem - installers, distributors, and specifiers. The Director of Builder Sales will be part of the team focused on building the SPAN Builder channel from the ground up.

About You

Required Qualifications

  • Demonstrated ability for the art of technical sales: driving urgency, consultative selling, and closing business

  • Past experience building out a new vertical for a company, including managing a team

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Positive mindset and attitude, and a passion for rapidly scaling residential electrification and renewable energy solutions

  • Up to 70% travel required

Bonus Qualifications

  • Experience working at a national or regional homebuilder

Life at SPAN

Headquartered in San Franciscoâ€™s vibrant SoMa neighborhood, we are an eclectic group of creative thinkers who value open communication, teamwork, and a â€˜make it happenâ€™ approach to addressing complex challenges.Â 

SPAN embraces diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.Â 

Weâ€™re hiring talented individuals who are driven by success and are passionate about shaping the future of renewable energy. If that sounds like you, weâ€™d love for you to consider joining the rapidly growing team at SPAN.

The Perks:

âš¡ Comprehensive benefits: 100% employee premiums for base plans on medical, dental, and vision with options for additional coverage.Â  Parental leave up to twenty four (24)Â  weeks, depending on eligibility

title: Partner Marketing Lead
description:
About Ondo Finance
Â 
Hi, we're Ondo Finance. Our mission is to provide institutional-grade, blockchain-enabled investment products and services. We have both a technology arm that develops decentralized finance technology and an asset management arm that creates and manages tokenized funds. We were the first company to tokenize exposure to US Treasuries and have since expanded into several other assets. We are also focused on incubating protocols that can support both tokenized real-world assets and traditional crypto.
Â 
Founded by folks from Goldman Sachs's Digital Assets Team, weâ€™re backed by some of the best investors in the world, including Founders Fund, Coinbase Ventures, Pantera Capital, Tiger Global, and more. We are currently the leaders in the space in terms of AUM and are well-capitalized to continue growing the firm. We're fully remote, with team members across the U.S.
Â 
About the Role
Â 
Ondo is looking for a Partner Marketing Lead to support our go-to-market strategy and lead co-marketing initiatives within the growing Ondo ecosystem. This role works closely with Partnerships and Sales to support sales enablement, GTM planning and execution, and ongoing co-marketing campaigns alongside companies like layer 1 and 2 blockchains, exchanges, fintech applications, DeFi protocols, Neobanks, service providers, and institutional partners. This role is key in driving awareness and growing the adoption of Ondoâ€™s products across web3 ecosystems.
Â 
What Youâ€™ll Achieve:
Â 
â€¢Be the primary marketing contact for the GTM execution and ongoing co-marketing with Ondoâ€™s new and existing partners
â€¢Identify and launch co-marketing campaigns that support awareness and adoption of Ondoâ€™s products within the ecosystems of other blockchain and fintech companies
â€¢Support the partnerships and sales teams with sales enablement materials, and collaborate on our product messaging and positioning with each partner
â€¢Craft and manage partner marketing content, including social media, blogs, AMAs, educational resources, case studies

â€¢Measure and report the performance and success of our co-marketing initiatives
Â 
What we're looking for:
Â 
â€¢Experience: 5+ years of experience in partner marketing, growth marketing, and experience with blockchain/web3 and/or financial services
â€¢Expertise: Deep understanding of blockchain, web3, DeFi, financial services, and growth marketing
â€¢Marketing: Experience planning and executing successful marketing campaigns and growth marketing tactics

What We Offer

â€¢Competitive compensation including salary, future token rights, and/or equity (according to your preferences) â€” we're well-funded and believe that great talent deserves great compensation

title: Brand Marketing Designer
description:
Speak our language!

We are Lingoda. We are promoting wealth and opportunity through Education! Our mission is to empower global talent with the language, cultural and technical skills for integration and success.Â 

Lingoda is a fast-growing online language partner for language learners aspiring to provide a human-centric, personalised and seamless learning experience unmatched by competitors. With Lingoda, you're not just learning - you're teaming up with an expert who understands your goals and guides you to success, every step of the way.

Our classes are teacher-led, and supported in- and out-of-class by the latest technologies and a unique curriculum to empower our students to achieve their language goals. High-quality classes are available online 24/7, so anyone anywhere has the opportunity to learn a language with Lingoda.

As a company we bring out the best in people with a positive culture. We challenge ourselves, and we challenge others. We work smart and make it happen. We believe in personal growth and inclusion.

We work hard to contribute to a better society. How? Here are three examples:
  • Lingodaâ€™s MATCH network and Global Career Centre seek to upskill and match migrants to career opportunities in Germany, supporting them through government-funded education programs
  • In the German healthcare sector, we support international nurses, doctors and midwives to obtain language and professional recognition through state-sponsored education programs. As a result we have become one of the largest educational providers in this field in Germany
  • In December 2022 at the Digital Education Awards, we won â€œBest Digital Learning Product of the Yearâ€ and in 2024, Lingoda was included inÂ  The Time's list of the 100 best EdTech companies
We are currently looking for a Brand Marketing Designer (all genders) based in Berlin or working remotely.

Please note: only candidates with a strong portfolio showcasing a range of design projects, demonstrating creativity, attention to detail, and strategic thinking will be considered!

Your mission with us:Â 

Bring our brand to life through creative concepts and high-impact designs that captivate audiences, support marketing initiatives, and drive business growth


Your tasks:
  • Concept Development: Collaborate with Copywriters and our Head of Creative to brainstorm and develop innovative concepts for marketing campaigns, product launches, and brand initiatives.
  • Design Execution: Produce high-quality, pixel-perfect designs for digital and print mediums, including social media assets, email campaigns, flyers, and promotional materials, ensuring alignment with brand guidelines.
  • Brand Consistency: Maintain and evolve the visual identity of the brand, ensuring consistency across all touchpoints and marketing channels.
  • Performance Optimisation: Utilise performance data, analytics and learnings provided by our marketing stakeholders to refine designs, enhancing engagement and conversion rates.
  • Collaboration: Work closely with Marketing, Product, and Content Teams to ensure cohesive storytelling and messaging.
  • Asset Management: Organise and manage design assets and templates, ensuring they are easily accessible and up-to-date.


You bring to Lingoda:
  • You have 3+ years experience in brand or marketing design, preferably within a fast-paced or agency environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present ideas clearly and effectively.
  • You are not afraid of ambiguity. Creating something from nothing is a creative thrill, not a burden.
  • You have experience with print and digital mediums
  • Youâ€™re fluent in staple tools like Adobe Photoshop, Illustration, Indesign, PowerPoint, Keynote and Figma. Bonus points for Premiere or After Effects.
  • You will be able to combine creative expertise with customer centric thinking.
  • Familiarity with project management tools such as Asana or Trello.

You add to our culture with:Â 
  • Strong analytical skills with a knack for creative problem-solving and adaptability.
  • You are a high motivated candidate.
  • And you have a strong eye for detail.


What you can expect from Lingoda:
  • Approachable leaders and transparent communication - every voice counts at Lingoda!
  • Company events and colleagues who are always happy to socialise + budgets towards team building events!
  • An inclusive environment with great team spirit and passion for languages
  • A well-structured and exciting onboarding process to set you up for success!
  • The possibility to work remotely from your home or in the office located in the heart of Berlin
  • Learning & development opportunities
  • Free access to our language classes
  • Mental Health programs
  • Corporate benefits & pension funds
  • 30 vacation days per year
  • Free snacks & drinks at the office
  • The modern hardware necessary for your work (n/a for freelancers)
  • Flexible working hours

Does that sound exciting? Then, send us your CV right away!
We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Your contact person for the position is Elif.

We ask that you please apply directly via the link provided in the job description or directly on our website. Due to GDPR regulations, applications sent otherwise will not be considered.

Please note that if you are based outside of Germany that only a freelance contract can be offered. All our contracts whether freelance or regular German employment contract start on a 2 year time period.

It is our commitment that every applicant will be evaluated according to their skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion.

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
Every day, somewhere in the world, important decisions are made. Whether it is a private equity company deciding to invest millions into a business or a large corporation implementing a new strategic direction, these decisions impact employees, customers, and other stakeholders.Â 

Consulting and private equity firms come to proSapient when they need to discover knowledge to help them make great decisions and succeed in their goals. It is our mission to support them in their discovery of knowledge.Â 

We help our clients find industry experts who can provide their knowledge via interview or survey: we curate this knowledge in a market-leading software platform; and we help clients surface knowledge they already have through expansive knowledge management.Â Â 

Weâ€™re looking for a Senior Product Designer who enjoys the challenge of designing data-rich products and solving complex problems through deep, customer-led research. In this role, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to shape our design strategy and influence the product roadmap. You'll work closely with senior enterprise stakeholders and have a direct impact on the user experience of our core platform. Youâ€™ll also explore how users interact with AI-enabled products, helping shape intuitive experiences that guide them into a new era of AI-driven workflows. This role includes mentoring and managing another designer, and youâ€™ll report directly to the Head of Product.

The key responsibilities for the role include:

  • Define and drive the design vision across our products, adapting to evolving user and business needs.
  • Lead user research efforts end-to-end, synthesizing insights into actionable product direction.
  • Design and establish best practices and processes for the design team, consistently evaluating and adjusting to ensure alignment with evolving goals and objectives.
  • Develop user journeys that not only meet functional needs but also foster engagement and satisfaction.
  • Evolve and extend our visual design language with awareness of emerging AI and design trends.
  • Translate product objectives into compelling user journeys, wireframes, and high-fidelity prototypes.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure quality, usability, and consistency during implementation.
  • Present design decisions clearly, articulating rationale, tradeoffs, and user value.
  • Mentor and support junior designers with guidance, critique, and design reviews.

Â 

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience designing digital products, with a portfolio demonstrating strong interaction and visual design skills.
  • Proficiency in Figma, across all stages of the design process (from early concepts to high-fidelity prototypes).
  • Proven ability to independently conduct and synthesize user research, including with senior enterprise stakeholders.
  • Excellent communication skills, with confidence presenting design rationale and research findings to cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders.
  • Experience working in agile, iterative environments as part of cross-functional teams, including product managers and engineers.
  • Self-starter with a proactive mindset and a desire to shape design strategy in a fast-growing organization.
  • Rigorously follow design best practices and maintain organized workflows to ensure consistent, high-quality output.
  • Bonus points for experience with B2B data platform.
  • Experience mentoring or leading other designers is considered an advantage.

Benefits

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â  Tenure gifts to thank our loyal staff who help the business to grow

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â  An enhanced Maternity & Paternity package

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â  22 days annual leave each year, and a paid sick leave policy

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â  The opportunity to create, lead or participate in one of our many ERG groups, to help drive diversity, inclusion and understanding across our business

Â·Â Â Â Â Â Â  Corporate Events: from bi-annual seasonal parties to team gatherings, we love to celebrate, collaborate and have fun together!

We are committed to building an inclusive workplace - did you know that marginalized groups are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every requirement listed? If you are interested in the above role, but don't necessarily tick every box, we encourage you to apply anyway - this role could still be a great match!Â 

At proSapient, we are an equal opportunity employer. As such, we offer equal employment opportunities without regard to race, colour, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status and other protected class characteristics.Â 

All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Due to the regulated nature of our clients, all successfully offered candidates are subjected to thorough screening & pre-employment checks, including an enhanced background check, which can affect the outcome of any offer of employment

Â 



About the company

proSapient is the platform that allows our clients to seamlessly connect to Industry Experts around the globe whether they need a three-hour consultation or simply to ask one question. Our clients include hedge funds, private equity, and professional services firms where our experts provide insight.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Intro

Scout AIÂ is a new hiring platform that connects software engineers to opportunities with world-class companies. On Scout, you get a more relevant and growthful interviewing experience, you receive feedback on your performance, and you also get end-to-end support to improve your chances of getting hired.

If you perform well on the Scout interview, you become eligible for opportunities with all companies in the Scout network (only complete the interview once).

This role is with our partner company that is actively hiring:

Sparkwise

About the company

Hi, I'm Ari, co-founder and CTO at Sparkwise. I've spent 20+ years building learning environments for different learning contexts, and am now focused on supporting transformational learning in the workplace. At Sparkwise, we started with a virtual learning experience that centers collaboration and human connection, and engineered platform and program management tools that can scale to meet the needs of organizations of all sizes. We're happy to share that we're looking to bring on a new core member to our engineering team. In this full-stack engineering role, you'll help design, build, and shape the future of product engineering at Sparkwise.

What we do

The world is getting faster, faster. To succeed, organizations are pouring in trillions of dollars to adopt new technologies, upskill their people, and transform their teams.

But it's hard to build new skills, mindsets, and behaviors at scale. Digital content doesn't engage, high-touch live learning can't scale, and AI-only tools lack human connection.

At Sparkwise, our mission is to scale the best way humans learn and transform by automating McKinsey-caliber collaborative capability building, enabled by AI. Our tech facilitates real-time problem solving, collaboration, and practice in small groups â€” without the need for live facilitators. Companies use our platform to teach skills, instill excellence, harness collective intelligence, drive change, and more.

Our clients include world-class organizations such as Harvard Business Publishing, Google, top consulting firms, and more. We're funded by top VCs and angels.

Working with us

What you'll do

  • You will contribute to core areas across our products and platforms, including everything from tooling to new feature prototypes to improving user experiences to refining and enhancing patterns and processes for scale
  • You will discover, cross-prioritize, and translate business requirements into engineering decisions
  • You will help make architectural decisions across our infrastructure and application stack
  • You will represent the engineering team perspective in cross-functional product discussions
  • You will work with our founders, designers, and importantly our customers to ensure outstanding product experiences across all touch-points
  • You will help establish and foster strong engineering culture, processes, and standards

You will prioritize ruthlessly to focus your attention on the most impactful work, but as urgent things come up unexpectedly, you will have some days that allow for uninterrupted deep focus and other days that don't.

Who you'll work with

  • You'll report to Ari, co-founder and CTO, and you'll also work closely with Sparkwise co-founders Romain and Vince. We bring deep expertise and passion in edtech, Future of Work, and venture building:
    • Ari (CTO) has been building edtech for 20+ years, previously serving as Chief Learning Scientist (and employee #1) at Minerva, CTO at Calbright College, and Chief Learning Architect at Grockit. CS PhD.
    • Romain (COO) was a former People function leader at McKinsey who ran global ops, built top training programs, and coached 100s of consultants. MIT, CentraleSupÃ©lec alum.
    • Vince (CEO) helped launch several startups at Polymath Ventures and ran multi-million dollar Future of Work transformations for F500 with McKinsey. Princeton, Harvard alum.
  • You'll work closely with product engineer Juan and product designer AdÃ¡n
  • You'll frequently collaborate with other members of our full team
  • Find more about our team values on our main Careers page.

How we work

Product engineering at Sparkwise is shaped by our Product Team Operating Model. We organize our strategic projects around 6-week engineering build cycles, and fill in other work around those projects. We have established a demo culture both in engineering and across the team, with in-progress demos being featured and celebrated on a regular basis.

Among our operating principles, you'll find:

  • move fast or die (this is a startup)
  • welcome disagreement
  • protect deep-work time

Read about what we embrace and what we say â€œnoâ€ to on our Careers page.

Our tech stack

Our codebase is a pure Typescript application. React on the frontend, Express.js for REST APIs, and Prisma for interfacing with PostgreSQL. We run containers and other infrastructure on AWS, with Cloudflare's security and performance tools in front and an assortment of third-party services playing supporting roles.

Sparkwise is committed to security and privacy. We are proud to be SOC 2 Type II compliant.

Compensation

  • Salary is competitive, commensurate with experience. Salary is location-based, anchored on country or region market rate.
  • Equity is meaningful. As an early employee, we want you to benefit when we succeed.
  • Other benefits include:
    • Health insurance. The specifics vary by country, but we aim to provide coverage or a reimbursement for coverage for all team members.
    • WFH home-office stipend. Expense up to USD $750 per calendar year to enhance work-from-home experience/productivity. (e.g. external monitor, keyboard, mouse, headset, stand-up desk, solo access to co-working space, etc.)
    • Company off-sites. While not a benefit per se, our team off-sites do feel like one. During our offsites, our team congregates for 3+ consecutive days of working together in person. The location varies but the value has been consistent: enhancing trust and empathy, and diving into deeper reflection and planning as a team.

Requirements

Location & work hours

Sparkwise is a globally-distributed remote team with no central office/headquarters.

  • Your regular working hours must include our core collaboration hours: 12pm-4pm US/Eastern.
  • You must have authorization to work in the country in which you intend to live.
